story:
Mary struggled in a three year battle with Breast Cancer, until on September 11, 2012 she took her last breaths on this earth.  She was a strong, brave and beautiful woman who embraced her battle with a smile.  She was selfless, and full of passion for her family and friends.

During her battle, she had to forgo many of lifes events of which she loved to take part.  The financial burden has been great.  If you can find it in your hearts to donate...every little bit counts.  

All moneys raised will go to benefit her children's future, as well as current needs of the family.  

Please contact Shannon Williams, Tina Bowman or Lynn Vermillion Mowry with any questions or concerns.

story:
Short Summary

The purpose of the company is to help to teach the world on African geography, history and culture.
The more you play the Africa Memory Game, the more you will learn of its riches and of the many resources of this vast and exciting homeland.
Get ready to challenge yourself in this great adventure and discover secrets of one of the largest continents in the world! 

What We Need & What You Get

The Africa Memory Game is breaking the stereotype that people get from the media about Africa. 

The travel version is helping to have the game at a low cost and could help to reach other continents such as Africa, Europe and Asia.

Also it will be more easy for family to use the game while travelling by car or plane.

The funds are going also to the development of the Africa Trivia Game, a new product that will help people to discover Africa per country.

So far, the game is used at school, at home and the funding will help to have more inventory.

The Impact

There is lack of products concerning African culture and history. Most of the teaching on Africa are directed to 7th during the month of February. One country only is chosen and is representing the whole continent.

Most of the people will judge you by what they know about you, the least you know the least you trust. By bringing the knowledge of Africa to my own children they were able to understand the legacy they were receiving also to see that they have values they can share with their friends at school.

This game will help also some who have challenges in world history and Geography and build bridges for a better world.

The first version of the game has 3 editions and had almost 4000 copies sold in 4 states only. A better version will bring it further.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word out and use all of the socialmedias you can use to help. Talk to your friends and let's make this happen.

story:
Summary

Association for Women Journalists Chicago Hall of Fame Committee

The Association for Women Journalists Chicago Hall of Fame seeks to honor individuals who have made outstanding efforts to further women’s contributions to journalism in Chicago. To do so, we plan to build an online living museum of honorees as well as present inductees (and, where appropriate, their respective news organizations or university journalism department) with a physical award. To meet this important goal to honor deserving champions of journalism in Chicago, we need your support. 

How your generosity will help

  • We plan to build a "living museum" website to house biographies of Hall of Fame inductees and provide information about the nomination process, present inductees with a physical award, and when appropriate, also present an award with her respective news organization or university journalism department. 
  • As a supporter of this campaign, you will be permanently honored on the "living museum" website for your generosity. You will also receive special recognition at AWJ Hall of Fame events. 
  • We believe $2,500 will cover the basics to get the initial cycles of the award up and running effectively. Funds raised beyond the goal will be applied to future years of the award to ensure that it continues to thrive. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond financial contributions, you can also support this campaign and the efforts to AWJ Chicago:

  • Share this campaign to your social networks. 
  • Follow @AWJ_Chicago on Twitter and on Facebook.com/AWJChicago.

Share this campaign to your social networks.

story:
Who we are…

We are Cause 4 Design, a San Diego based company with years of experience in the apparel design, embellishing and fulfillment industry. 

Our Mission is to provide a creative outlet for graphic artists who wish to expose their talents to a global audience by offering printed apparel ultimately benefitting charities and causes around the world.

Our goal is to bring together consumers and graphic artists wishing to contribute to global and local charities and causes by providing exclusive limited edition designs on a variety of apparel products.

We envision being the ultimate marketplace for consumers wishing to purchase fashionably printed apparel products while supporting global and local charities and causes.

Our Story…

Cause 4 Design is a concept that has been years in the making and when launched will benefit charities all over the world as well as putting some extra cash in the wallets of so many talented freelance artists that need a place to expose their talents. Together we can all make some incredible fashionable apparel with the goal of helping make a difference in the world. With a fully functioning production facility and fulfillment house Cause 4 Design is positioned to provide a platform that continues to give to causes while finding ways to help artists move their careers forward and feel good about who is benefitting from their creations. This is truly what we call a community business idea as those contributing the art benefit, those producing and fulfilling the product benefit, those purchasing the product benefit and charities around the world benefit.  The charities can be global, national, regional or they can be neighborhood causes as long as they are legitimate, legal and verifiable.

People will never stop buying T-shirts or fashionable apparel. Graphic artists always need outlets for their designs to be seen by a buying public and charities will always need a source of funding so they can continue to do good in the community. Help us meet those goals by contributing what you can so that we may build a platform that allows us to help. This is a win-win-win venture. With our apparel, printing, production and fulfillment experience and so many talented artists in the world we can create a marketplace of wonderful pieces that will surely become your favorite piece of clothing knowing that a portion of the sale price went to a cause you are all passionate about supporting.

What your contribution does…

Your contribution will help us cover the coding and development costs that go into creating a site like the one we envision. A website that will feature the apparel, the artist and the charity being supported. The site will allow the artist to track the sales of their specific designs, show consumers how many of the limited edition designs are still available and provide information on the artist and the charity. In addition your contribution will help cover the maintenance and the initial marketing of the site.

The Artists are out there, the production facility is in place and there are many consumers waiting to purchase these cool new exclusive designs. All we need now is place for them all to gather. 

We intend to become the preeminent location for those who want to "Create to Contribute”. The more we create the more we will be able to contribute!

Other ways to  help if you can’t contribute cash?... 

Let your friends know about this campaign -- post the link below on your Facebook page or group page, send out a tweet from your Twitter account

Post This Link - www.igg.me/at/cause4design

Share your talent -- Want to design a t-shirt?

Donate perks -- anything you can give to help thank our donors.

story:
In today's society a severe ruthlessness has been created.  Too many in my city have ceased in caring about one another.  A high level of selfishness has ensued to a point where they'll rob and steal from you not caring of how bad your circumstances may already be.  And this is my story.
 
Back in January, I left my home to help out a family who asked for my assistance.  Upon arriving back home i found a horrific mess.  My home was burglarized, ransacked and vandalized.  Paper was everywhere.  I called the police only for them make me feel guilty for having ever left my home as if it were my own fault.  And it's not the first time.  It's been an ongoing occurrence after the first.  Because upon seeing the video, you'll see that it was major structural damage done.  They initially came throught the wall.  and upon me closing up that hole, the next time because of that weakness they ripped out the framework of the window and gained access that way.
 
It's been an uphill battle.  There are many who wish for me to commit insurance fraud as a way or means to fix all that was damaged.  But for me that's not an option.  It will only make things worst.  And one wrong doesn't begat another wrong to happen.
 
WHAT THEY STOLE
You think you've heard it all?  Well let me tell you what they stole.  On the first burglary they took the larger and smaller appliances which were on the first floor, from things like freezers to microwaves, toasters, and mixers.  I'm a pastry chef, and they stole ALL of my equipment for that.  They took all of my pots, pans, mixing bowls, flatware, utensils, and baking pans of all shapes and types. 
These thieves stole my plumbing, fixtures, electrical wiring, the conduit and electrical sockets straight out of the wall.  they stole the stereo and speakers, the sewage line, space heaters, two portable radios, an electric generator, a brand new flashlight, work lights, a single window pane from the living room, a single window pane from the back room, the bars from the window, the grates and burners from the stove, the racks from the stove, camping equipment, 3 luggage carts, three shopping carts, industrial bungee cords from home depot, all the money from my coin jars, the cords from all the surge protectors, three industrial extension cords, a pair of work boots, power drill, and driver sets, two tool boxes, and a brand new case of Scotts extra soft toilet paper.  i kid you not.  smh.
Second go run, these thieves stole the motors from my washers and dryer, the motor from the furnace,three 3 packs of dial soap, my multipack of coast, zest and caress, several bottles of ultra dawn, ultra joy, and ultra palmolive dishwashing liquid, several bottles of shampoo, two gallons of bleach, clorox cleanup toilet bowl cleaner, 24 small cans of campbell's pork and beans, a case of progresso soup, ragu pasta sauce, hellman's mayo, a bottle of windex, the remaining extension cords, and three USED trash bags.  smh.  I mean they actually dumped the trash out of the bags onto the floor and took the trash bags with them. smh.
Next time they took three hammers and trashed the place.  There wasn't much left to take.  And in the interim, the new clothes I had purchased, they damaged by pouring cooking oil on them as well as all over my shoes rendering me with nothing but the clothes on my back and the shoes on my feet.  All that i had with me, was what i kept.  smh.  With what was done i was shocked that people would even steal what they took.  And i have a feeling there's still stuff that i'm forgetting.  They trashed my house more than once.  smh.  Every time i cleaned, I'd have to go back and clean again.  smh.

What I Need & What You Get

If you've read this far, you understand why I need what I need.  Cause this is a lot to replace and fix.

I need a lot more than what I'm asking for.  Because essentially I have to rebuild my house from the ground up with all that has happened.  Most important are the structural issues.  What i've done so far is only temporary. 
I'm asking for 25K as a means to fix the basics; from that exterior wall which is now hanging to replacing the plumbing, electrical, and heating.  That's as basic as it gets. 
The very first dollars received will go towards replacing that structural wall first.  And then going from the outside in with fixing all of the other issues in the house. 
I'll give a personal message of thanks to those who help me on the greatest levels in video form.  Though i truly appreciate any and all help received.  Every dollar is greatly appreciated. 
 

The Impact

I've spent the better part of my life helping others.  I've given of all that I've had, and continue to do so now even though what I have isn't much. 
The longer my house stays open to the elements the more damage that is caused. I still have to worry about folks trying to rob me.  One guy even attempted it while I was inside of the house one morning.  And that's what caused me to start cementing that wall using the bricks that were there.  I know it's not safe.  But I pray over it everyday.  I don't know when or if the city will come and condemn my home.  I'm staying with relatives who make it known daily that they don't like me being there.  And trust me when i say i miss my home and there's nowhere else i'd rather be.

If you've ever had to depend on the kindness of someone else, and they've made you feel guilty and useless and worthless because you need it; you understand why i want to move back home as soon as possible.  The greatest issue is that exterior wall.  Once that's up, i know how to survive without the other utilities.  I truly appreciate any and all help you can provide.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please send help me by telling others that I need help.  The smallest donations can do so much more when put together and used as one.  I thank you deeply and dearly.  and feel free to share the various links to spread the word.  I really need all the help i can get.

story:
Put a Warlock on Wheels!

Each October, Salem Warlock Christian Day can be seen gliding along the streets of Salem, Massachusetts on a rental Segway complete with his Witchy cape and pointy hat! However, the rentals are rarely available anymore (because the amazing Witch City Segway has become so successful!) so Christian's hoping to raise the funds for one of his own so that he can entertain visitors to Salem and New Orleans throughout the year! However, such major purchases don't just happen by the twitch of a nose. They need financing!

To Give is to Live and to Live is to Give!
All it takes is a few dollars ... just the cost of a cup of coffee a day, and you can help the Warlock get his wheels ... and you won't even have to listen to Sally Struthers! Sure, this might sound like a silly endeavor, but the families that visit us here in Salem light up when they see a Witch flying through the streets and it provides a great educational opportunity to talk about real Witchcraft! If you can help us, visitors to Salem will continue to be entertained by this spectacle of glitz, glamour, and magic!

Powerful Perks!
All those who wish to contribute to the cause will receive fabulous perks! Magical blessings, autographed photos, blessed and dressed candles, signed copies of Christian's book, the Witches' Book of the Dead, Psychic Readings at Christian's shop OMEN, readings by Christian himself (which he rarely does!) and even tickets to Christian's Official Salem Witches' Halloween Ball!

Don't touch that dial! There's a Warlock needing wheels! And while Christian doesn't have an 800 number, you can always reach him on the Ouija board! 

Thank you for your contribution!

Christian Day

story:
Help us expand our manufacturing capabilities to keep up with world demand by purchasing our next generation products. Select your Perk to the right.

Powered by Nanotechnology

NanoSeptic. The New Clean™. NanoTouch is the world's first and only producer of products that are NanoSeptic...the next generation of continuously self-cleaning surfaces.

NanoSeptic surfaces are designed and engineered with a proprietary blend of material science, nanotechnology and green chemistry. The result is a non-toxic surface that constantly kills bacteria, viruses and fungi, without contributing to antimicrobial resistance and without the use of toxins, heavy metals or diluted poisons. And unlike sanitizers, disinfectants, gels and wipes that are one-time kills, NanoTouch is always on, working 24/7.

And NanoTouch products offer more than a way to provide customers with cleaner surfaces, they are designed to visually communicate your commitment to their well-being at every contact point.

 

Worldwide Media Coverage

NanoTouch has been covered in more than 300 national and international media outlets.


The Products

Portable NanoSeptic Mats

Portable products include travel mats, snack mats, counter mats, desk mats, place mats and mouse pads. NanoSeptic products are extremely durable, waterproof and can be cleaned with soap and water and other non-abrasive cleaners (watch the cleaning video). Even hospital-grade cleaners will not harm the surface. Did you know in a study of airplane surfaces, 60% of airplane tray tables tested positive for MRSA! And did you know that US health officials say that hand sanitizers are not effective against Norovirus? Have fun on that cruise!

Peel & Stick NanoSeptic Skins for Facility Touch points

Peel & Stick touch points which include door push pads, door handle wraps and door push bar skins (see our application video). A study showed that only 5% of restroom patrons washed hands properly.

 

Specialty NanoSeptic Surface Products

Specialty products include TV channel guides and shopping cart handle wraps. Talk about a surface in a hotel room that is touched by nearly everyone and never cleaned...your TV channel guide.

 

Here's a link to our brochure PDF.

 

Our Vision

"Cleaner Surfaces for a Healthier World" isn't just a tagline for NanoTouch. It's a goal...a vision of a better world. A world where self-cleaning surfaces work 24/7. NanoTouch impacts lives, but the benefits of NanoSeptic surfaces don't stop there. NanoTouch doesn't use heavy metals or poisons which can build up in our landfills and water supplies. It's a green approach toward creating a stronger, healthier planet.

Beyond the technology, we genuinely believe in the value of the message our products deliver. People want to feel safe and secure. People want to know that there is a safer place to touch...a safer place to rest their personal items. Businesses consumers that use NanoTouch can deliver that feeling. It's not just about the exceptional lab results, it's also about the design that drives perception, emotion and behavioral change.

Society may already be using too many antibiotics and antimicrobials, contributing to the rise of resistant strains of microbes and weaker immune systems. We're not out to create a sterile world. We want to foster better, safer environments in which to live, work, learn and play. We've embraced a focused approach - enabling cleaner surfaces to exist exactly where and when they are needed.

 

Changing Behavior

NanoSeptic products go beyond the traditional "form meets function" concept. While the design is functional, it actually changes peoples behavior. Not only do people want a safer place to touch, they will gravitate towards these surfaces, keeping surrounding areas cleaner. This can help society use fewer cleaning chemicals and support antimicrobial stewardship efforts. And every time a NanoSeptic travel mat is used on a hotel vanity, that's one less towel that gets layed down and has to be washed.

 

How can you help us change the world?

Your Contributions will help us build NanoSeptic Generation III

NanoTouch has successfully designed, developed, fabricated and sold the first two generations of NanoSeptic products. Generation I was more of a proof of concept. It worked great, produced good lab results, and gave us some valuable experience in planning for production. Generation II is currently being produced in our lab in the Center for Advanced Engineering and Research in Forest, VA. Our current production methods are producing good results and can provide enough throughput to satisfy initial orders.


We are very focused on how your contribution will be used.
Money will be spent in 3 very specific areas:

  1. Advanced manufacturing equipment upgrades designed to handle our nanotechnology fabrication process, resulting in new products, increased effectiveness and consistency.
  2. Enhanced automation including material handling (transport, feeding, stacking) allowing us to produce more products and stay ahead of worldwide demand
  3. Additional research and development focused on laboratory testing  optimizing our surfaces effectiveness against the most pressing healthcare threats around the world. We recently spent significant money on lab testing against the human Coronavirus, a strain of which is causing the MERS outbreak in the Middle East. The lab tests produced exceptional results by the way.

 

The Future

The next generation of our fabrication line won’t just provide us with additional capacity, consistency and performance. It also opens up the possibility of creating new products. Products that we have already created successful prototypes of including disposable iPad and Kindle sleeves, menus and menu covers. Imagine being able to take your iPad to the beach and have an inexpensive sleeve to protect it from sand and spray. Or a hotel that loans Kindles to their guests. Kindles that have a sleeve that kills bacteria, viruses and fungi that might have been deposited from the last person. Or a classroom that shares an iPad among 25 students.

 

NanoTouch Awards

  • Entrepreneurs of the Year - Region 2000 Technology Council
  • AloStar's Rising Star Award
  • Woman's Day Top 10 Cool Inventions for 2013
  • Nominated for CIT Entrepreneur of the Year
  • Nominated for District Administration Top 100
  • Mark Sisson appointed to Board of Directors for Centra Specialty Hospital

 

The Team

While the core management team is shown below, we wouldn't be where we are without a great Advisory Board. Consisting of subject matter experts in manufacturing, chemistry, automation, finance, healthcare, hospitality, travel and education, they continue to advise and challenge us every step of the way. Here is a link to our Advisory Board.

NanoTouch is patent pending. NanoTouch and NanoSeptic are registered trademarks of NanoTouch Materials, LLC
story_txt:
Help us expand our manufacturing capabilities to keep up with world demand by purchasing our next generation products. Select your Perk to the right.

Powered by Nanotechnology
NanoSeptic. The New Clean™. NanoTouch is the world's first and only producer of products that are NanoSeptic...the next generation of continuously self-cleaning surfaces.NanoSeptic surfaces are designed and engineered with a proprietary blend of material science, nanotechnology and green chemistry. The result is a non-toxic surface that constantly kills bacteria, viruses and fungi, without contributing to antimicrobial resistance and without the use of toxins, heavy metals or diluted poisons. And unlike sanitizers, disinfectants, gels and wipes that are one-time kills, NanoTouch is always on, working 24/7.And NanoTouch products offer more than a way to provide customers with cleaner surfaces, they are designed to visually communicate your commitment to their well-being at every contact point.
 
Worldwide Media Coverage
NanoTouch has been covered in more than 300 national and international media outlets.


The Products
Portable NanoSeptic Mats
Portable products include travel mats, snack mats, counter mats, desk mats, place mats and mouse pads. NanoSeptic products are extremely durable, waterproof and can be cleaned with soap and water and other non-abrasive cleaners (watch the cleaning video). Even hospital-grade cleaners will not harm the surface. Did you know in a study of airplane surfaces, 60% of airplane tray tables tested positive for MRSA! And did you know that US health officials say that hand sanitizers are not effective against Norovirus? Have fun on that cruise!


Peel & Stick NanoSeptic Skins for Facility Touch points
Peel & Stick touch points which include door push pads, door handle wraps and door push bar skins (see our application video). A study showed that only 5% of restroom patrons washed hands properly.
 

Specialty NanoSeptic Surface Products
Specialty products include TV channel guides and shopping cart handle wraps. Talk about a surface in a hotel room that is touched by nearly everyone and never cleaned...your TV channel guide.
 


Here's a link to our brochure PDF.
 

Our Vision
"Cleaner Surfaces for a Healthier World" isn't just a tagline for NanoTouch. It's a goal...a vision of a better world. A world where self-cleaning surfaces work 24/7. NanoTouch impacts lives, but the benefits of NanoSeptic surfaces don't stop there. NanoTouch doesn't use heavy metals or poisons which can build up in our landfills and water supplies. It's a green approach toward creating a stronger, healthier planet.Beyond the technology, we genuinely believe in the value of the message our products deliver. People want to feel safe and secure. People want to know that there is a safer place to touch...a safer place to rest their personal items. Businesses consumers that use NanoTouch can deliver that feeling. It's not just about the exceptional lab results, it's also about the design that drives perception, emotion and behavioral change.Society may already be using too many antibiotics and antimicrobials, contributing to the rise of resistant strains of microbes and weaker immune systems. We're not out to create a sterile world. We want to foster better, safer environments in which to live, work, learn and play. We've embraced a focused approach - enabling cleaner surfaces to exist exactly where and when they are needed.
 


Changing Behavior
NanoSeptic products go beyond the traditional "form meets function" concept. While the design is functional, it actually changes peoples behavior. Not only do people want a safer place to touch, they will gravitate towards these surfaces, keeping surrounding areas cleaner. This can help society use fewer cleaning chemicals and support antimicrobial stewardship efforts. And every time a NanoSeptic travel mat is used on a hotel vanity, that's one less towel that gets layed down and has to be washed.
 

How can you help us change the world?
Your Contributions will help us build NanoSeptic Generation III

NanoTouch has successfully designed, developed, fabricated and sold the first two generations of NanoSeptic products. Generation I was more of a proof of concept. It worked great, produced good lab results, and gave us some valuable experience in planning for production. Generation II is currently being produced in our lab in the Center for Advanced Engineering and Research in Forest, VA. Our current production methods are producing good results and can provide enough throughput to satisfy initial orders.
We are very focused on how your contribution will be used. Money will be spent in 3 very specific areas:

Advanced manufacturing equipment upgrades designed to handle our nanotechnology fabrication process, resulting in new products, increased effectiveness and consistency.
Enhanced automation including material handling (transport, feeding, stacking) allowing us to produce more products and stay ahead of worldwide demand
Additional research and development focused on laboratory testing  optimizing our surfaces effectiveness against the most pressing healthcare threats around the world. We recently spent significant money on lab testing against the human Coronavirus, a strain of which is causing the MERS outbreak in the Middle East. The lab tests produced exceptional results by the way.

 

The Future
The next generation of our fabrication line won’t just provide us with additional capacity, consistency and performance. It also opens up the possibility of creating new products. Products that we have already created successful prototypes of including disposable iPad and Kindle sleeves, menus and menu covers. Imagine being able to take your iPad to the beach and have an inexpensive sleeve to protect it from sand and spray. Or a hotel that loans Kindles to their guests. Kindles that have a sleeve that kills bacteria, viruses and fungi that might have been deposited from the last person. Or a classroom that shares an iPad among 25 students.
 
NanoTouch Awards

Entrepreneurs of the Year - Region 2000 Technology Council
AloStar's Rising Star Award
Woman's Day Top 10 Cool Inventions for 2013
Nominated for CIT Entrepreneur of the Year
Nominated for District Administration Top 100
Mark Sisson appointed to Board of Directors for Centra Specialty Hospital



 



The Team
While the core management team is shown below, we wouldn't be where we are without a great Advisory Board. Consisting of subject matter experts in manufacturing, chemistry, automation, finance, healthcare, hospitality, travel and education, they continue to advise and challenge us every step of the way. Here is a link to our Advisory Board.

story:
Short Summary

Ryleigh's Place will be an indoor playland for children under 12 in Truro, Nova Scotia.  As a parent, grandparent, aunt, uncle or guardian of children this age you know how hard it is to find safe and fun things for children to do when the weather outside is not cooperating.

This campaign will give local residents an opportunity to prepare for this new attraction in town by purchasing their own VIP access or first year membership at substantially reduced costs.  Building a member base is the last piece of the puzzle before getting underway with renovations of our site, soon to be located at 310 Prince Street, right between Truro Toyota's showroom and Enterprise Rent-A-Car.

We NEED to get the word out and want to let early supporters benefit with savings for their support.

What We Need & What You Get

Before we get started we want to establish some relationships.  Having a solid member base will allow us to create an even bigger, better opportunity for the children to enjoy themselves year round.  Obviously, the more children (and parents) that know who we are and where we are located, the more fun we can have on opening day!  We are looking for $15, 000 during this campaign and in return for your contribution you will receive the following benefits:

  • A $50 contribution nets you:
                                   
                    1) A VIP card, good for discounts on entry fees, special theme parties
                        and classes.  Good for 1 year.

                                                                   or

                    2) A 10 Punch card for your child who is 3 or older. A $70 value. Each
                        "punch" is good for one visit to Ryleigh's Place.


  • A $100 contribution nets you a 20 Punch card for a child 3 or older. A $140 value.

  • A $150 contribution gets you your first year membership.  One full year of passes to Ryleigh's Place just for contributing.  This is a $300 value.
  • Do you have a family with three or more children?  This perk is for you.  For just $300 you can have a membership for all of your children in one membership just for being part of the campaign. A $500 value.

  • Two children in your family?  $300 will get you two annual memberships and a VIP card as well.

If you do not see a perk that fits you, contact us with an idea, chances are there will be others who want the same thing. We can add it to our campaign for others.

Sharing ideas is good for everyone!

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign today you will be helping to bring a fun, safe place for your children to play year round.  Protected from the elements, we will be available 7 days a week.  No more kids bored at home during rainy, snowy or hot days; need somewhere to take your kids when there is no school? Bring them by and burn off all that extra energy.  At these prices the memberships will pay for themselves quickly.  Be one of the first 50 people to contribute and receive some special deals on your next annual pass.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't buy a membership or a punch pass right now? That's OK! Simply spread the word by sharing this campaign through your social media account to friends and relatives.  Getting the word out helps get this entertainment option open more quickly. 

 

Questions?  Feel free to connect with us via email at ryleighsplace@outlook.com

Like us or Share us on Facebook and Follow us on twitter @Ryleigh'sPlace

Remember the opportunity to contribute only lasts 60 days, so get the word out now!

story:
ven∙er∙a∙tion (noun): the expression of respect or reverence inspired by dignity, wisdom, dedication or talent 

Veneration's mission is to build an intergenerational movement anticipating and responding to the realities of aging in American families and communities.   We believe that appropriate, forward-thinking solutions to housing and real estate can pave the path through the legal, financial, social and emotional dimensions of aging.  Our aim is to create the environment and platform for communication, learning and planning about aging.   

Our Story

The Veneration Project was conceived by two Gen X sisters who navigated the realities of aging parents before we found our own footing in adulthood. It was a startling wake-up call to the lack of a social safety net for the aging in America, and the implications for our generation.

As a result or our experience, we're launching the Veneration Project to engage our peers to start thinking and talking about what the future has in store for our parents and ourselves. Meanwhile, we've been sketching out what a master roadmap of aging would look like, and imaging a platform that could guide people along it.   

The Impact

As Boomers enter the labyrinth of aging, families and communities will be affected in unprecedented ways.  Family members will inevitably find themselves providing a whole range of financial, time, and emotional support.  In the next twenty years, this phenomenon could easily double the losses to American businesses due to employees needing to provide various forms of care for aging loved ones – already estimated at $34 billion each year. The Veneration Project is about alleviating the perception of aging as a burden, and harnessing the potential of an aging society, so we can respond, plan and innovate in the face of a rapidly aging society.


The Status

This summer we piloted Veneration Corps, a college internship program aimed at developing a workforce capable of providing and navigating the aging resources.  We've had a team of five college students mapping out the elder service network in Brooklyn, NY, and volunteering at local elder service agencies. We're aiming to scale up Veneration Corps in 2012 as an interdisciplinary internship program, with the aim of breathing new life into the underserved field of aging.  

 

Meanwhile, we've decided our first focus will be helping navigate housing options and related planning for aging Americans and their families.

story:
(Video shot and edited by Doug Vollmayer)

 

 

Our company is O-Zone Product Development, and we have developed 4 technologies that will hit the market shortly, with your contribution.  With a successful campaign, we will present at least two of these technologies to companies at INPEX Tradeshow in June. We are here to raise capital for advanced prototypes, provisional patents, and testing (per company request).



 

Our Story

 

 

I started O-Zone Product Development out of my apartment while studying engineering at the University of Virginia. I had a brief stint as an engineer in Pennsylvania but left due to lack of challenge and also my complete obsession with new product development. O-Zone Product Development is dedicated to developing low-tech products in fields, such as: toy and game, kitchen gadget, athletics, and many more. I am a product developer devoted to simplicity and necessity. I try to capture beautiful design in each piece, but I will not hesitate to be realistic and make sure that we are producing marketable goods. 

 

As before mentioned we have developed 4 technologies and we need a financial push to get them to a marketable status. We have spoken to a few companies for each product and they require a few more steps per technology.



Products

 

 

-Cat Feeding System: Because of the stingy eating habits of many cats, I have redesigned the ordinary cat bowl with enhancements that, research has shown, will have a greater than 50% euphoric effect on cats. I have reached a point where I need to conduct direct product testing and develop factory samples.

 

-Foot Integrating Ankle Brace: Having ankle problems as a young football player, I designed full-foot integrated ankle brace based of stress concentration principles. I am looking to conduct some mechanical studies to verify the overall concepts on video and produce more effective prototypes.

 

-No Flat Soda: I have created a bottle cap sized device that allows soda drinkers to increase their soda drinking pleasure by about 30-40%, by preventing sodas from going flat so easily. I have tested the concept and am moving into advanced prototyping.

 

-Pain-Free Bandage Removal: I have created a very simple and small bandage improvement to remove all small bandages painlessly, by way of a fluid filled capsule. The prototypes work wonderfully, but the bandage companies require at least provisional patent protection

 

 

The Impact

 

 

We have been developing most of these concepts for over a year now and it is our true passion to produce valuable innovations. With your investment, you are promoting creativity in the production of your everyday goods. Every year, there are thousands of inventions that do not even initiate due to lack of funding, and we will not suffer the same fate.

 


                                                


 

What We Need

 

 

Capital raised will go towards:

·      Drafting and filing necessary documents on intellectual property

·      Developing more advanced prototypes

·      Consulting the necessary industry/manufacturing experts

·      Conducting proper lab testing

·      Travel/Show expenses for INPEX conference and other necessary in-person company meetings.

·      Fulfilling perks promises

 

If we meet our goal on the site, the perks and products will be delivered as outlined. If we exceed our goal, we will incorporate more technologies into this campaign, which means more perks for you guys. This is our passion, and you will be promoting our ability to continue working on these projects, so we WILL keep your best interest at heart.

 

If we do not reach our goal:

·      We will not be able to fund the INPEX Tradeshow trip (but will continue to contact the companies by other means)

·      We may have to hone down the product list from 4.

·      Prototypes and testing are the highest priority, so other needs may be cut.

 

With the way we have budgeted ourselves, our perks will be delivered with NO dependence on the overall campaign success. That just wouldn’t be fair because you did your part. But hopefully, there will be no need for this discussion after the campaign.

 

 

What You Get

 

 

Grass Roots Supporter ($1.00)

 

We appreciate any and all donations. Your donation, if successful, will go towards licensing and marketing many products to be available in stores near you and also online. You will be promoting creativity and new product development in fields where it is greatly needed.

 

Rockstar Supporter ($10.00)

 

You will receive a personal thank you letter and your name on the website as a contributor

 

Inventive Minded Giver ($25.00)

 

In addition to a personal thank you letter and your name on the website as a contributor, you will get an exclusive O-Zone Product Development key chain and cardholder

 

Innovation Rockstar ($50.00)        

 

You will receive the OPD key chain, name as contributor on website, and personal letter. You will also get the official company t-shirt and FIRST notification when each product is available for purchase.

 

Creative Stud ($250.00)

 

You will be named an executive contributor on our website as well as receive the personal letter, key chain, t-shirt, and FIRST notification when to purchase each product. You will also receive 1 prototype device with a signed Non-Disclosure Agreement (currently it will be the No Flat Soda device).

 

True Visionary ($500.00)

 

You will be named an executive contributor on our website as well as receive the personal letter, key chain, t-shirt, and FIRST notification when to purchase each product. You will also receive 2 prototype devices and access to internal monthly updates until the tradeshow, with a signed Non-Disclosure Agreement (currently it will be the No Flat Soda and Cat Feeding devices).

 

Innovation Virtuoso ($850.00)

You will be named an executive contributor on our website as well as receive the personal letter, key chain, t-shirt, and FIRST notification when to purchase each product. You will also receive 2 prototype devices and access to internal monthly updates until the tradeshow, with a signed Non-Disclosure Agreement (currently it will be the No Flat Soda and Cat Feeding devices). Most importantly, you will receive 1 product evaluation. I will take a basic idea/concept that you have and bring it to a point where you can present it to companies for a licensing deal on your own. The package includes:

·      Basic Prior Art Search

·      Description (with short market evaluation)

·      3-D Product Rendering and Sell Sheet

·      List of Leads appropriate for the product

·      Many tips on how to proceed

Independent inventors account for billions of dollars of revenue for companies, and you have the opportunity to grab a piece of the pie with little effort! I am SUPER AMPED about this incentive, but hurry up there is a limited supply!!

 


 

 

All incentives will be delivered at least 1 month after the funding campaign.

 

**Non-Disclosure Agreement is necessary for product disclosure prior to filing for intellectual property.**

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

 

Outside of the monetary investments, I need a crazy amount advertising through any medium to which you have access. I need you to refer other potential investors, post this link on your blogs, Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and forums. World of mouth is going to be the key to our success. Thanks in advance for the support.

 

 

O-Zone PD Team:

 

 



Tumi (Founder)


I am the product developer in O-Zone Product Development. I began to develop products seriously in 2009 and am extremely dedicated to the field. I pride myself on breaking the normal schema of the general population with my innovations. Most importantly, I am dedicated to simplicity and necessity in design. I have gotten my feet wet with product licensing deals and am now looking to dive in. I have 12 products in my repertoire and many more on the way.

 





Chernor Jalloh (Advisor)

 

Chernor is a Sierra Leone born Accounting Major from the University of Virginia. We became very good friends in school and I admired his supreme dedication to his schoolwork and his entrepreneurial spirit. He possesses the ruggedness of a politician with the skills of a seasoned CEO. After college, I approached him to pursue a consulting/advising role with my firm. I consult Chernor with financial matters as well as new product direction.



 

  



Eric Pankey (Advisor)


Eric and I came from the same Middle and High Schools, but never really connected until we met again in college. By nature, he has comical qualities that resonate to any person who meets him. However, after college, he has displayed an unparralled focus towards increasing his professional stock and looking into new ventures. He’s a funny guy, but a meticulous and stone-faced businessman. A recent addition, I consult Eric on market analysis and product breadth. 

 


 

 

 

Contact Us:

 

Tumi Oredein Jr.

O-Zone Product Development, Founder

P.O. Box 220882

Chantilly, VA 20153-0882

tumioredein@gmail.com

twitter.com/OZonePD

personal thank you letter and your name on the website as a contributor, you
will get an exclusive O-Zone Product Development key chain and cardholder
 
Innovation Rockstar ($50.00)         
 
You will receive
the OPD key chain, name as contributor on website, and personal letter. You
will also get the official company t-shirt and FIRST notification when each
product is available for purchase.
 
Creative Stud ($250.00)
 
You will be
named an executive contributor on our website as well as receive the personal
letter, key chain, t-shirt, and FIRST notification when to purchase each
product. You will also receive 1 prototype device with a signed Non-Disclosure
Agreement (currently it will be the No
Flat Soda device). 
 
True Visionary ($500.00)
 
You will be
named an executive contributor on our website as well as receive the personal
letter, key chain, t-shirt, and FIRST notification when to purchase each
product. You will also receive 2 prototype devices and access to internal
monthly updates until the tradeshow, with a signed Non-Disclosure Agreement
(currently it will be the No Flat Soda
and Cat Feeding devices). 
 
Innovation Virtuoso ($850.00)
You will be
named an executive contributor on our website as well as receive the personal
letter, key chain, t-shirt, and FIRST notification when to purchase each
product. You will also receive 2 prototype devices and access to internal
monthly updates until the tradeshow, with a signed Non-Disclosure Agreement
(currently it will be the No Flat Soda
and Cat Feeding devices). Most
importantly, you will receive 1 product evaluation. I will take a
basic idea/concept that you have and bring it to a point where you can present
it to companies for a licensing deal on your own. The package includes: 
·      Basic Prior Art Search
·      Description (with short market evaluation)
·      3-D Product Rendering and Sell Sheet
·      List of Leads appropriate for the
product
·      Many tips on how to proceed
Independent
inventors account for billions of dollars of revenue for companies, and you
have the opportunity to grab a piece of the pie with little effort! I am SUPER AMPED about
this incentive, but hurry up there is a limited supply!!
 

 
 
All incentives will be
delivered at least 1 month after the funding campaign.
 
**Non-Disclosure Agreement is necessary for product disclosure prior to filing for
intellectual property.**
 
 
Other Ways You
Can Help
 
 
Outside of the monetary
investments, I need a crazy amount advertising through any medium to which you
have access. I need you to refer other potential investors, post this link on
your blogs, Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and forums. World of mouth is going to
be the key to our success. Thanks in advance for the support.
 
 
O-Zone PD Team:
 
 
Tumi (Founder)I am the product developer in O-Zone Product Development. I began to develop products seriously in 2009 and am extremely dedicated to the field. I pride myself on breaking the normal schema of the general population with my innovations. Most importantly, I am dedicated to simplicity and necessity in design. I have gotten my feet wet with product licensing deals and am now looking to dive in. I have 12 products in my repertoire and many more on the way.
 

Chernor Jalloh (Advisor) Chernor is a Sierra Leone born Accounting Major from the University of Virginia. We became very good friends in school and I admired his supreme dedication to his schoolwork and his entrepreneurial spirit. He possesses the ruggedness of a politician with the skills of a seasoned CEO. After college, I approached him to pursue a consulting/advising role with my firm. I consult Chernor with financial matters as well as new product direction.   

Eric Pankey (Advisor)Eric and I came from the same Middle and High Schools, but never really connected until we met again in college. By nature, he has comical qualities that resonate to any person who meets him. However, after college, he has displayed an unparralled focus towards increasing his professional stock and looking into new ventures. He’s a funny guy, but a meticulous and stone-faced businessman. A recent addition, I consult Eric on market analysis and product breadth. 
 

 
 
 
Contact Us:
 
Tumi Oredein Jr.
O-Zone Product Development, Founder
P.O. Box 220882
Chantilly, VA 20153-0882
tumioredein@gmail.com

story: hello my name is heather, I am 23 years old and ever since I was in high school I wanted to make my mark in virginia beach, in a good way. 3 years ago I decided to host a charity event to raise hunger awareness and collect canned goods for the hungry and what better way to do that then with zombies? Thus the zombie walk of virginia beach was born! the first walk in 2009 only 36 people showed, but that didn't discourage us we still shamble through town center with pride and collected almost 50 pounds of can goods! last years zombie walk mass trippled and we collected over 60lbs of food for the homeless! the event was a success! this year we are expecting over 120 zombies to show up to the event, exciting, I know! sadly I can no longer fund this by myself. this is why I've created this fundraiser online because I'm in dire need of your help! even just a dollar would make a difference. I have paid for the permit fee, but I still need to raise almost $400 for insurance, and I'm not sure how much off duty police officers will cost. if it makes you feel better to know where exactly your money is being sent I will be happy to post up photos of receipts and statements just for your comfort. please help keep the virginia beach zombie walk alive!

story:
About Us

We are Mark & Andrea Newell, and we're preparing to open Toronto's first Bohemian tea house, board game room and hookah lounge.

With backgrounds in the culinary arts, events management, music, photography, performance, and making things awesome, our plan is to bring all of these things together to create a community space full of warmth, comfort, and entertainment. We're very passionate about getting our tea house off the ground because although Toronto has plenty of bars and cafes, there is a shortage of spaces that act as a public living room - and that's what we want to give you.

What is a Bohemian tea house?

The Czech tea house tradition was started by a group of committed tea enthusiasts who continued to illegally import, brew, and sample tea during the Communist Era. After the Velvet Revolution these daring souls opened up shop in Prague, and their passion for tea and its surrounding culture sparked what is now a major industry in the Czech Republic. Today the country, which is less than 1/10th the size of the province of Ontario, is home to more than 300 tea houses. After two visits to Prague to tour these tea rooms, their immense popularity is no mystery to us. The majority of customers seem to find there is something beyond the benefits of mere tea drinking that come with visiting a tea house. Some have described it as a sense of ‘sanctuary’, while others say they love getting away from the usual noisy, bustling atmosphere you find in a crowded bar or a modern, laptop-filled coffee shop. All of the staples for creating this type of ‘magic’ space will be in evidence at Bampot: there will be warm lighting, comfortable seating, multitudes of unique teas, affordable yet delectable food, games to play, tobacco-free hookahs to smoke, and above all an unhurried mode of operations that lets you order, lounge and leave at your own pace.

Our Tea

From the steamy depths of Assam, to the lofty peaks of Yunnan, Bampot will stock a dazzling array of the finest loose leaf teas in the world. We take the time to sift through the offerings of each year’s harvest so that we can offer you nothing but the best. Black teas will be available from every region and in every flavour imaginable, and we will also have an extensive and frequently-updated collection of green, oolong, and white teas. Our herbal infusions will come as a pleasant surprise to those trying to avoid caffeine – no bland, watery, faintly floral cups of hot water here. With more than 30 blending components to work with we’ve developed some truly memorable brews that will drive thoughts of black tea right out of your head. Most of our tea will be served in teapots with a small drinking bowl, which allows you to drink at your own pace while the tea stays warm. Other options will include mate gourds, tea lattes, and iced teas.

Beyond the Tea

Tea is amazing, but you can’t survive on it forever. With that in mind you’ll find delicious food available that ranges from well-known Mediterranean dishes (hummus, falafel, baklava, pita) to homestyle snacks (cheese and crackers, pistachios, cookies) to gluten-free options and a little bit of everything in between. Our ingredients will be locally sourced wherever possible, and our prices will keep you coming back for more. Tobacco-free hookahs are another treat we’ll offer at Bampot, featuring every flavour of tea-leaf-based shisha we can get our hands on. Tea-sha provides a smooth, flavourful smoke that is gentle on the throat and free of tar and nicotine.

Entertainment

On a night out at Bampot we want to make sure you’re enjoying every moment, which is why we’ll be providing a few different options for your amusement. A wide variety of board games will be available, with seating areas built to purpose where you can play with as many as 10 people. We’ll have every game you’ve heard of and many you haven’t, but if there’s anything we’ve missed just let us know and we’ll get it in for your next visit. If your date is late or you’ve come by and you just don’t want to leave, you can pick up a book from our in-house library and read away the hours. Live music or other types of shows will be featured a few times each week, ranging from acoustic folk to captivating cabarets. And finally our walls will play host to an ever-changing collection of artwork by Canadian artists – and we’re always open to new submissions if you’ve got something beautiful to add.

What we need and what you’ll get

Your contributions will make a world of difference to the atmosphere that we are able to provide. The building we are renovating has only ever been used as a family residence, and there is a fair amount of work involved in getting it ready to house a business. We will be using every last penny we have in conjunction with funding from the Canadian Youth Business Foundation to get Bampot off the ground, but even with these two funding sources we still fall short on some important projects. Your money will go towards:
● a vital facelift for the building’s rather residential facade
● an extensive overhaul of the kitchen to make it restaurant-ready
● a second bathroom for customer use to be installed in the basement
● wooden seating platforms where you can take your shoes off and lounge amongst piles of cushions and rugs
● equipment – refrigeration, countertops, sinks, water heaters, a commercial dishwasher, etc.
● and a host of smaller details, like wooden panelling, doorway reshaping, and shelving to keep the ambiance consistent.

Reaching Our Goal

If we don't reach our goal, the funds we receive will still be put towards the renovations. It would, however, mean that not all of the projects above could be completed, and that will inevitably impact the quality and the character of the space we are able to offer upon opening. With this in mind, we are doing everything we can to make it worth your while to help fund Bampot. Besides ending up with a wonderful place in your city where you can enjoy all the tea, food and board gaming you can handle, you will also be an enormous part of helping to add to the diversity of Toronto’s hospitality scene – we’ve looked, and there’s nothing like Bampot currently running in the GTA. Wouldn’t you love to have a new and exciting option for a night out?
Plus, of course, there are the perks. Most of what’s available are vouchers to enjoy all that Bampot has to offer, though you’ll also find options including custom tshirts, handmade mugs, and other Bampot gear you’ll actually use.
We understand that not everyone is able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Every share, like and link we get will help spread the word. So if you're part of the Toronto community and you want to see this space happen, please - let other people know about it! We are so grateful for every dollar and every share you give.

story:
This campaign has ended but our fundraising efforts have not. We are in the process of raising 20% of our development costs ($50,000) from crowdfunding. Visit us at sipandspoke.com to contribute.





THE SHOP

The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen will be a mission‐driven retail business that integrates a full‐service bicycle shop and cafe. Based in the Upham’s Corner neighborhood of Dorchester in the City of Boston, The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen will offer retail sales of new and refurbished bicycles and parts, new accessories, as well as maintenance and repair services to a heretofore underserved local biking community in a key transportation artery that is increasingly used by local and regional cyclists. The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen will serve high quality coffee and a range of food items sourced from local and respected vendors, providing the neighborhood amenities identified by local residents.

The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen is anchored by four central principles:

1. Offer high‐quality biking and cafe products for the local market at reasonable prices;

2. Foster a warm and friendly store environment centered on unity and respect;

3. Contribute positively to the local community—source local products, hire homegrown baristas and bicycle technicians, and support the local biking culture in an area of the city where many rely on the bike as an affordable means of transportation that is faster than walking and cheaper than a car;

4. Become a community hub for residents of Upham’s Corner and the surrounding neighborhoods.

NOAH HICKS AND BOWDOIN BIKE SCHOOL


The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen will be co‐located with Bowdoin Bike School, a nonprofit bicycle repair and education center that uses the bicycle to encourage youth development, economic self-sufficiency, transit justice, and health equity. By providing low-cost repair services and free instruction, Bowdoin Bike School makes cycling accessible to those underserved by traditional bike shops. Founded in 2013 by Noah Hicks, the school’s mission reflects both community need and the personal history and experiences of its charismatic founder.

Noah Hicks was born and raised in Boston’s Bowdoin-Geneva neighborhood and began cycling at the tender age of three. As a teenager, Hicks started tinkering with bicycles in his family’s basement in inner-city Boston, a neighborhood underserved by traditional bicycle shops. His hobby became a lifestyle, providing plenty of spending money and exposure to culture, green spaces, and social activities outside of his neighborhood.

In 2013, Hicks turned an 8’ x 10’ shed in a local park into a pop-up, seasonal bicycle school offering low-cost bicycles and repair lessons to the community. With a dedicated crew of teenage volunteers, Bowdoin Bike School saved countless bicycles from the trash heaps, safely led group bicycle rides through the neighborhood, and outfitted new riders with free locks, lights, and helmets. In partnership with Victory Programs, Hicks launched an earn-a-bike initiative for formerly homeless individuals in the community, connecting them with an affordable means of transportation and the opportunity to share their newly-minted mechanical skills with other burgeoning cyclists. Hicks then spearheaded a successful online fundraising campaign to support the expansion of Bowdoin Bike School into a brick-and-mortar location and hire his volunteer corps. The corps converted a long-vacant automotive repair garage into a bicycle retail shop and education center, planning classes for women, queer youth of color, and working parents.

In housing the nonprofit Bowdoin Bike School within The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen, Hicks is creating a dynamic hybrid model that seeks to use the bicycle as a means of creating opportunity and synergy both for and between residents of communities deeply affected by poverty and for the growing regional biking community. The result will be an active and positive community hub.

THE BUILDING
This project is also an opportunity for community-driven historic preservation and revitalization. Uniquely, The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen and Bowdoin Bike School will be co‐located in the Upham's Corner Comfort Station built in 1912 for the trolley car system. In partnership with Historic Boston Incorporated, The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen will preserve and reuse this historic building, helping to reactivate a key portion of the commercial business district, preserve an important piece of historic architecture, and reconnect the Comfort Station to its original transportation-related roots.

The building lies on what was once part of the Dorchester North Burying Ground which is listed in the State and National Register of Historic Places and within the Boston Landmark designation. Rehabilitation of the comfort station building helps tell the story of the City of Boston’s 19th century expansion and the Dorchester neighborhood’s urbanization and related transportation growth into the 20th century. The comfort station is a remnant of a time of growth and transportation innovation. Its rehabilitation and reuse--particularly for a transportation related purpose--will help to preserve and express that story.

WHY COMMUNITY CROWDFUNDING?

The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen benefits from foundational community support unavailable to most conventional entrepreneurial businesses. The business model was developed through iterative discussions with residents, community groups, and the broader Dorchester business community. It was also shaped by the personal history and experiences of its founder, who has designed a productive and creative for-profit retail business that aligns closely with neighborhood goals and the mission of the nonprofit Bowdoin Bike School.

Community support is vital to realizing this project. While financing is in place to restore the historic structure, funds are needed to build-out the interior of the business and create a functional bike shop and café. Without your support, Noah Hicks will need to take on more debt, resulting in higher prices for local customers, many of whom cannot afford the cost.

Your donation will help us bring this impactful, community-driven project to life. Thank you for your support

Note: 100% of donations will benefit The Sip & Spoke Bike Kitchen. Donations will be collected by The American City Coalition, a 501(c)(3) non-profit partner. Therefore, all donations are tax-deductible to the extent provided by the law.

story:
What makes Dice City Games special?

We are mission-driven, with a guiding philosophy that is simple at it's root, but grand in scope: "Play a better world."

We are building a “second-home” in the DC Metropolitan area for the gaming and geekdom communities. We plan to offer tournaments, game demos and other events no less than 80% of the days that we are open, in a clean, well-lit, inviting environment. Our weekly gaming nights will include pen & paper RPGs, board games and tabletop games; and we’ll host periodic movie nights featuring free screenings of classic sci-fi & fantasy tales from the silver screen, along with cult classics.

In addition to games + collectibles, we will stock tasty snacks and beverages from local vendors that are a cut above what you may expect to find at a local game store.

Adopting a community-driven approach for events and inventory. We will actively and regularly poll customers for what games you are interested in us stocking and hosting events for.

Our multiple weekly Magic: The Gathering offerings will cater to both the casual and competitive player. We are excited to host tournaments for all of the major sanctioned formats (Limited, Standard, Modern, Legacy, Vintage) as well as to host periodic beginner days where we teach new players of all ages how to play.

We will lead the charge for organized play of community-driven formats  -- think EDH, 1 v 1 Commander, Pauper, Old School, Cube Draft, Chaos Draft, and beyond.

Making inclusivity key. Dice City Games values creating a welcoming space, and will respect our patrons through our suggested Player Code of Conduct, policies, and a staff who pledge to lead by example. We welcome gamers of all: levels of skill, physical ability, age, economic status, gender expression, sexuality, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, creed, and political affiliation. We are here to facilitate such a space, but not to tell you how to live outside of our store, regardless of whether you are a progressive, a liberal, a libertarian, a conservative, or apolitical. All are welcome. Bullying and harassment will not be a part of store culture. We come together to build each other up, through mutual respect.

Designing for accessibility. Whether you’re from next door in D.C., from Montgomery or Prince George's Counties, or further out, Dice City Games aims to be easily accessible regardless of your form of transportation. Our proposed space is conveniently located in Wheaton, Maryland just over the D.C. border, and is Metro-adjacent, near ample public parking, is easily reached via Metrobus and Ride-On, and also convenient via MARC Train and the Capitol Beltway. We plan to have a wheelchair-accessible entrance.

Multilingual accessibility is important to us as well, so we will stock boardgames in a variety of languages. We plan to be the first area store to regularly stock Spanish-language Magic cards upon release.

Promoting ethically-sourced products. We will carry items that are fair-trade, union-made, green, and/or American-made whenever possible. We’ll sell vintage / secondhand items when possible to help reduce factory waste. 

We’re planning accounts with vendors like Looney Labs who design great games like Fluxx --right here, in neighboring College Park, MD -- and Game Science, who are not only the sole USA dice manufacturer, but also producer of the world's most accurate dice.

  

Part of the backer perks, their precision dice set will ensure you fair rolls and fun discussion pieces for years to come. 

Always looking to buy. We want to give you top dollar for your old stuff, with trade-in credit-bonuses. Help our selection grow, while turning your trash into treasure!

Operating locally, while making an impact in the wider gaming community. While our mission starts here, we plan to create original content focused on video games, board games, and cinema, to keep you informed, wherever you live. Our website will feature original video content, podcasts, and articles about your favorite hobbies, as well as a major online store that will be launched at a later date. 

Our content team includes creators such as fandom & Star Wars expert Fiona Barbour, and Joel Sadowsky, member of 2015 World Magic Cup Team USA. We will stream in-store events, including tournaments for underserved Magic formats like Legacy, Vintage, Pauper, and Old School.

So what will Dice City Games stock?

Cream-of-the crop board games, including select popular titles from Rio Grande, Mayfair, Ravensburger, Days of Wonder, Fantasy Flight, Blue Orange, Steve Jackson, SlugFest and Wyrd Games, among others.

Pen & paper RPGs, including Dungeons & Dragons and Pathfinder, but also out-of-print titles from TSR, Games Workshop, and White Wolf Games.

Retro videogames, including rare, import, and classic software and vintage home consoles from Nintendo, Sega, Atari, Sony, and beyond. Imagine walking into a local game store and finding a top-loader NES, Dreamcast, Virtual Boy, Turbo-Grafx16, Super Famicom, Vectrex, or Neo-Geo on the shelf...

The entire Magic Multiverse. Yes, all of it. Already purchased, our Magic singles inventory will be the most exhaustive in town, on opening day. We aim to stock every non-foil/promo card in print from 1994 to today, as well as many foils. We already have hot standard cards, Modern staples, original dual lands, Reserved Lists cards, and rare EDH gems, along with the widest selection of sealed and out-of-print Magic packs in the area! Plus, popular accessories from KMC, Dragon Shield, Ultra Pro, Dex Protection, Monster, Deck Tutor, and more will be available to keep your collection clean and organized.

A carefully curated selection of geeky odds & ends, including comic book paraphernalia, fandom collectibles and apparel, fanzines, vinyl records, vintage movie posters, and cult classic movies on HD, DVD, VHS and even LaserDisc.

Who is behind Dice City Games?

Dice City Games' Owner & Founder, Jimmy Cooney is a local advocate, award-winning filmmaker, and entrepreneur, who discovered gaming when a chronic bone condition limited his mobility during childhood. Never one to rest on his laurels, Jimmy has explored the gameplay, collectible, and community-building aspects of tabletop, video, and role-playing games, all while successfully helping to open or manager several local brick & mortar businesses, including a food co-op, a green catering company, the DC area's first​ full-service organic vegan restaurant, and the area’s first sweatshop-free men's retail store. 

A University of Maryland  alum with a B.A. in American Studies + minors in Media Studies and Ethnic Studies, Jimmy believes that comic books, science fiction, pop culture, vinyl record albums, and cult classic cinema are all inherently culturally significant. He looks forward to curating a selection of each for our patrons.

In Magic, Jimmy has has finished in the Top 64 at Worlds (Vintage Championship), Top 32 of Star City Games (Standard) Opens, Top 16 of SCG (Team Limited) Classics, and 1st in several Old School 93/94 Magic tournaments, where he is the standard bearer of the Merfolk Archetype.

Jesse Crowley is a Dice City Games Investor & Store Manager. A Prince George's County teacher, sound engineer, and competitive gamer who has overcome a chronic degenerative eye condition to become one of the top ranked Magic: the Gathering players in the area, Jesse looks forward to teaching new games and advanced play techniques to players of all ages at Dice City Games. His Magic accolades include numerous Invitational Qualifier (IQ) wins and Grand Prix (GP) Day 2's, an SCG (Legacy) Open Top 8, and an SCG (Modern) Open Top 16. He is the residing SCG (Modern) State Champion for Maryland!

Eric Lee is a Dice City Games Tournament Organizer. A research assistant at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, and proud immigrant from Singapore to the United States, Eric loves the community side of Magic, but can also play competitively, with frequent successes in the IQ, SCG, and GP circuit. He enjoys painting Warhammer miniatures and looks forward to sharing with players at our events the joy of a well-organized, clean, fair, and friendly play-environment.

Shaunica Pridgen is a Dice City Games Communications Adviser and Campaign Coordinator. She is a professional political strategist; a singer, blerd, and member of the Washington Metropolitan Gamer Symphony Orchestra.  Shaunica will school you in Settlers of Cataan, but you can keep Splendor to yourself. She's currently excited to be learning Magic.

Julian Marin is a strategic adviser to Dice City Games, and intends to be one of the store’s Magic judges. He has a penchant for organizing and growing gaming spaces, having worked as a longtime Level 2 Magic Judge and as an editor/author on MTGFanatic.com. He is a lifelong gamer, working in DC as a business analyst. Julian frequently enjoys boardgaming, tabletop roleplaying, Magic (Commander, tho he recently Day-2'd a limited GP), and returning to his alma mater's annual 100+player LARP (Live-Action Role-Playing) game, which he co-founded.  

Our Board of Advisers is composed of talented people from across the spectrums of professional expertise, gender, ethnicity, and hobby -- shout outs to Lizz, Sean, David, Cory, John, Lily, Tani, Sam, Nathan, Annalee, Stevan, and co. -- who will offer us valuable guidance.

Combined with the support YOU, our community stakeholders, we will strive to make Dice City Games a second home for both competitive and casual gamers alike. One the community deserves.  

What expenses will this campaign cover?

Your contribution will go towards vital finishing funds in several areas:

1.) Compensating the creative talent behind this project, including videographers, photographers, graphic designers, and the artists who designed our perks. Because we are purchasing American-made products from vendors who provide living wages, roughly 25% of funds raised alone will go to covering the cost of manufacture of the backer perks.

2.) Helping defray incidental costs, including legal fees, supply expenses, pop-up event costs, and R&D costs.

3.) Helping defray startup costs, including our first month's rent, build-out expenses, and if we exceed our goal, improved fixtures and displays.

4.) Indiegogo deducts 5%, plus 3.3% is additionally deducted by third party processors from all funds we raise in this campaign.

Where will the funding not go? Since Dice City Games has been in development for over six months, the bulk of our inventory has already been purchased. Any further inventory we purchase before opening will come from our private investment.

On that note, 90-95% of Dice City Games' funding and start-up costs are self-funded by the ownership and supplemented by loans; this campaign represents the final 5-10% push .

What are the risks?

As with every new business, there are risks involved. We’ve identified our three biggest challenges, and identified ways to mitigate them:

Securing our proposed location. We have been in negotiation with the landlord for our proposed location near the Wheaton Metro. However, we do not feel comfortable signing for a five-year commitment until we have funded this campaign and have the demonstrated-support of the community behind us. Until we officially make the commitment and sign a lease, there remains the possibility of the landlord offering someone else the space. To mitigate this risk, we have identified several back-up spaces and are in negotiation on those spaces as well. There is also the possibility of negotiations stalling if we can't reach terms with a landlord that are fair and conducive to business.

Red tape and bureaucracy. New businesses in our home county are prone to running into red tape and unforeseen obstacles. To anticipate these concerns, our Board of Advisers includes a local lawyer and the owner of a fellow forward-thinking brick & mortar business that has ahad success in Montgomery County.

The day-to-day challenges of managing chronic illness. Part of the reason building a welcoming, inclusive community is so important to the Dice City Games team is that members of our core founding team have been managing chronic illness and rare diseases, in some cases since birth, adding an additional layer to the stress and considerations of starting a new business. Unexpected health road bumps have already come up, but by building an agile, collaborative, and multi-talented core team, we’ve been able to overcome them and edge Dice City Games ever closer to becoming reality.

In Conclusion...

We've seen many people shy away from the dream of opening a brick-and-mortar business that celebrates the hobbies they love. We know that in the age of corporate buyouts and a consolidation of the market to online mega-sites.. community-focused, small, retail businesses are becoming rarer by the day.  However, we also know that geekdom is expanding and shows no sign of slowing down, and no-one is better fit to serve the gamer community than it’s life-long local participants  -- especially when they are dynamic and forward-thinking business people. Given our team’s love of hobby games and experience with startup businesses we are confident that Dice City Games will become a destination for the geek in all of us!

Unique perks for our backers:

^Reflecting our love of Magic's rich art and various formats, we have commissioned an exclusive set of 3 tokens from the original Art Director of Magic, Jesper Myrfors. The size of playing cards, the Golem/Elemental, Demon, and Zombie rival his original Magic art!

^The limited-run playmat (think giant mousepad) features art inspired by our vision, "Play a Better World" and some of the most iconic cards in Magic. Referencing 15 classic cards and illustrated by Greg Fenton, who is noted for being one of the first collectors of original Magic art, and the Vintage community-mainstay behind the deck Fenton Oath, Greg is just the sort of artisan who's work we want to bring to you! 

For our exclusive full art dice bags, backers can choose between the the colorful "Play a Better World" montage by Greg Fenton, or the dark fantasy Golem/Demon art of Jesper Myrfors.  Machine washable, and large enough to your dice, pen, and a notepad. 

 

Show us the Perk Combinations!!

 

 

[Shirts are sweatshop-free, unisex, and available in S, M, L, XL, and XXL]

 

 

 

 

 

[Precision Dice Set, DCG Notepad & Pen, 16 tokens]

 

 

 

 

 

 

^Become a Keyholder to the City and get a Silver, Gold, or Platinum card good for 1, 2, or 4 years of discounts on ALL in-store purchases...

With your help NOW is the time to build our community gaming hub and share with the world our message, "Play a better world!"
