story:
INTRODUCTION

My name is Michael,  am the Founder and Executive Director of ICOD Action Network, an East African based nonprofit.  I am the author of Tears of Resilience, a book about Female Genital Mutilation.

In July 2015, we raised $612 here on Indiegogo to help 3 of our reproductive health program beneficiaries with fistula get reconstructive surgery. We want to support five more Female Genital Mutilation survivors get reconstructive surgery to fix Obstetric Fistula. We have started preparing the patients, we have booked surgeries for December 23, make a small contribution to our patients today, every little bit helps.

Your support will help  eradicate Female Genital Mutilation, Obstetric Fistula and build safer communities for every girl.

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL DO

The cost of one-time fistula reconstructive surgery rose from $204 when we did it last year, to $285 this year. We will need $1425 for the five patients.

  • Your donation will help patients who would otherwise not have gotten this life saving surgery to live healthier, and rebuild their lives.
  • All girls and women, just like men have rights to health, security and physical integrity, the right to be free from torture, inhuman treatment, and the right to life. When you contribute to this campaign, you giving women a platform to fightback. Lets do this together!

Please  share this campaign with your friends, family, workmates, associates, strangers, and, encourage them to contribute to my campaign.

 

    HELP END FEMALE GENITAL MUTILATION

    Female Genital Mutilation is the worst form of abuse against women and girls. For nearly 8 years that I haven been involved in work to eradicate Female Genital Mutilation, I have been exposed to it’s realities and I have tried to do much more eradicate it.  My first goal here is to let you know, the reader, that Female Genital Mutilation affects us all and we need to do a lot more to eradicate it.

    HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL BE SPENT

    All funds will go to paying for the patients surgery.

    Reconstructive surgery for 5 patients  will cost  $1425 ( less indiegogo platform fees)

     

    WHAT DO YOU GET WHEN YOU CONTRIBUTE?

    I don't have much,  BUT I want to share a free copy of my book with  everyone who contributes. We are the final stages of publication and launching my book. Please visit my book's website Tears of Resilience

    WHAT I HAVE DONE BEFORE?

    • I founded ICOD Action Network in early 2008, our work has reached out to 6700 girls and  women and increased the number of women accessing to maternal health services. I been involved in work to eradicate Female Genital Mutilation and Mutilation in Africa, I hope you can join me too.
    • I have represented human rights and minorities rights organizations in East Africa and have been consulted by several organizations across Africa.

    Lets connect on LINKEDIN

     

    OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

    Every contribution of any amount is deeply appreciated and will help us reach our goal.

    • Please tell a friend, or 25 friends, or even a 100 friends, acquaintances and co-workers, clients, about my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools on the pitch picture above.
    • Spread the word about the book on your social media sites, email and blog if you have one! 
    • Post a message on your Facebook page and Twitter

    THANK YOU

HELP END FEMALE GENITAL MUTILATION
Female Genital Mutilation is the worst form of abuse against women and girls. For nearly 8 years that I haven been involved in work to eradicate Female Genital Mutilation, I have been exposed to it’s realities and I have tried to do much more eradicate it.  My first goal here is to let you know, the reader, that Female Genital Mutilation affects us all and we need to do a lot more to eradicate it. 
HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL BE SPENT
All funds will go to paying for the patients surgery.
Reconstructive surgery for 5 patients  will cost  $1425 ( less indiegogo platform fees) WHAT DO YOU GET WHEN YOU CONTRIBUTE?
I don't have much,  BUT I want to share a free copy of my book with  everyone who contributes. We are the final stages of publication and launching my book. Please visit my book's website Tears of Resilience 


WHAT I HAVE DONE BEFORE?

I founded ICOD Action Network in early 2008, our work has reached out to 6700 girls and  women and increased the number of women accessing to maternal health services. I been involved in work to eradicate Female Genital Mutilation and Mutilation in Africa, I hope you can join me too.
I have represented human rights and minorities rights organizations in East Africa and have been consulted by several organizations across Africa.

Lets connect on LINKEDIN
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Every contribution of any amount is deeply appreciated and will help us reach our goal.

Please tell a friend, or 25 friends, or even a 100 friends, acquaintances and co-workers, clients, about my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools on the pitch picture above.
Spread the word about the book on your social media sites, email and blog if you have one! 
Post a message on your Facebook page and Twitter


THANK YOU

story:
What is KLEUR?

By surface definition, we are a boutique where you will find an eclectic mix of  curated, quality miscellany for the home and self, both handcrafted and found. Below the surface, KLEUR will be a community hive for curiosity, conversation, and education. Please read on to find out what that means. 

KLEUR is a shop where you can stop in and find:

- His and Her apparel      -Hand crafted designer clothing originals    

- Handpicked found goods for the home -Handpicked One-of-a-Kind clothing finds

 - Wood-crafted furniture, originals   - Eclectic Adornments

-Found eclectic furniture pieces  - crafted Body & Beauty products

- Jewelry, both hand-forged and found   - Lighting   - Wall decor  

 -Original art and prints     - Weavings and other textile & fiber work  

- Gently used and new books   - Zines & Other press    - Kitchenware

-Hand-forged wooden wares   - Leather goods   - Bags and other accessories

-Artist and Maker Supplies, gently used and new    - Maker and crafter tools


Most of our goods will be hand made or hand-picked by North Carolina locals. With our operating model (described in detail below), the makers and curators featured in KLEUR are making more money for their hard work AND increasing their national visibility. Twenty or so years ago, shops like ours began popping up all over the world, with an intense resurgence in the trend in the last ten years, since social media began inspiring people like us all over the country to create their own version. A blend of minimal and simplistic style, combined with the classics, creates an aesthetic in our shop that is rich in both modern and vintage tastes. Each item available to you at KLEUR is chosen for it's tasteful simplicity and it's role in our modern-nostalgic style. Our goods are carefully designed or hand-picked for their role in this aesthetic, and reflects high quality craftsmanship, taste, and care. 

THAT is the boutique side of things. 

Under the skin, however, our goals are much bigger. While by day we may seem like a simple shop, if you look on our front door or on our website you will find a calendar of events: on several evenings throughout the week and during the weekends, we will work hard to provide inexpensive or free workshops, tutorials, discussions, salons, readings, and similar social events that are intended to enrich not just the active arts community downtown, but attract and involve the rest of the community as well. We are BEYOND excited to offer downtown WSNC an intimate and casual setting for maker-skill workshops, how-tos for household projects, discussions about music, race, gender, public education, fear, empathy, anger, love, art, and the allure of laziness. 

 We are excited to invite you to participate in hands-on community-building that explores how lines can blur. 


Boutique by day, innovative community clubhouse by night. We hope you will support us! We can't wait to be your neighbors this October. 


Please scroll to the bottom for links to shops like ours, many of which we have already connected with.


What We Are Asking For & Why

Because we are makers ourselves, it is difficult for us to come up with a financial safety-net that will ensure KLEUR's survival and maintenance (described below) during those first months. We are confident that we will surely be able to stand on our own feet in a short period of time (because, we swear, you will like us!), but we've worked out that ONE YEAR'S worth of expenses up front will allow us to offer you and our makers much, much more. 

Let us break down what we are asking for and why. 

  • The goal of $12,500 will just about cover our expenses to maintain the shop for one year. This will allow us the flexibility to raise our own money through purchases while at the same time making sure the makers 
  • CONSIGNMENT. The work that will be available in the shop will mostly be made by North Carolina makers (most of them local) who are willing to sell their goods by consignment, meaning we take a percentage commission. We are dedicated to asking for HALF of what other shops who work on this model ask for, to ensure that our makers get as much as they can from each sale. In order to keep our commission so low, we need a cushion of funds for our first year, to give us the space to build our own funds from these commissions. 
  • WHOLESALE. Some of the goods in our shop will be purchased wholesale from their suppliers. These goods will mostly be purchased from makers in far-off cities like Atlanta, Portland, San Francisco, Brooklyn, Nashville, and other non-local areas. Having this opportunity means we can bring you goods not normally found in this area, saving you travel or shipping fees (a.k.a. Convenience!) To put it bluntly: You can come into our shop and find some cool stuff you'd only see in other areas. 
  • ALL funds made from this campaign will go toward the following: Rent and other monthly expenses, PR and marketing, creating workshops and other events, shop maintenance, and wholesale purchases for selling. 


IN RETURN: Our Impact

We don't want you to think we are asking something for nothing. In addition to the (comparably) humble tokens of thanks we will give to each doner, we are 100% dedicated to making KLEUR an asset to our fast-growing downtown arts community. Not just a storefront, KLEUR is going to be an active part of the local scene in terms of community empowerment, education, and inspiration. We plan to do this through events offered weekly, either free or at low-cost. This we believe is truly a way we can "give back" to everyone who chooses to be involved. Anyone who contribute to this effort will be among the first to know about the following:

WORKSHOPS & TUTORIALS - A CASUAL SETTING FOR SKILL LEARNING: Think about all the different things that you've wanted to take a quick class on. Have you ever wanted to get the basics on how to arrange flowers? Planting and maintaining an herb garden? The basics of leather working? Basic fashion design. How to ground an outlet. Book-binding. Hand-lettering. Quilting basics. Tool safety. Jewelry design. Creating fragrances. Upholstering basics. Restoring a Goodwill-found turntable sound-system. How to make knives. Basic yoga or Pilates. Tricks for eating wholly on a budget. Urban farming. Urban renewal. Dying fabric. Weaving. Chair caning. The list goes on. 
While there are certainly community opportunities for some fantastic skill-building in the arts scene, we hope to keep ours low-commitment and low-cost, in a casual setting. In addition, we do not want to restrict ourselves to only tutorials 

LOCAL ENGAGEMENT WITH CURRENT ISSUES - Similar to above, but more suited to formal and informal discussion, KLEUR will be the host site of many salons and discussions regarding current and ongoing social issues, both specific and general: Racial equity, Humans and their relationship to Empathy, Gender equality, socio-economic disparity, the state of public education in North Carolina, upcoming election and political issues, clean water, at-risk and high-risk teens, the death (or rise) of art, and on and on and on...

NETWORKING AND VISIBILITY FOR OUR MAKERS (and WSNC)

We mentioned already that our commission rate is much lower than other shops like ours (made possible by donors like you), but the added HUGE benefit to the makers who have their work in KLEUR is the increase in their visibility! Here's putting it simply: by digitally connecting with hundreds of shops similar to ours on forums like Instagram, we are interacting daily with owners and patrons of like-shops in cities like San Francisco, Seattle, Atlanta, New York, Boston, Chicago, Nashville, Richmond, and so forth. We "like" their photos, they "like" ours (it sounds trite, but hang on a minute here), and inevitably perhaps WE see a product for sale in their shop that we have to have. We contact the maker via Instagram. We ask them for a Wholesale order, and BAM, Jewelry Maker for Melting Sun Apparel from Atlanta, GA is in KLEUR (this is a true story...this is exactly how we have snagged many of our out-of-town makers)...Well, the same is true on the flip side. Say a shop in California sees a local WSNC maker's work on our feed. They contact him/her directly. Wholesale order. Suddenly a WSNC has their work in a shop across the country, and the orders keep on coming. 

If this seems like a fairy tale, we assure you it is not. We have done our homework on this incredible phenomenon called Social Media and what it can do instantly for a hand-crafter's career.

The reality: if we do this well, and continue to be as networked as we potentially will be in this maker-lifestyle movement, we can add to the appeal of Winston Salem on the world stage as a hub for arts and innovation. 



Future KLEUR Endeavors...


TOOL-SHARE PROGRAM  -  A major future goal of ours, we have already started collecting and storing a vast arrangement of gently used hand tools, including presses, vices, awls, files, mallets, saws, and the like. We are working to develop a tool-share program, where members can come to us, exchange a token, and rent a tool for free for as long as they need it. 

MAKER and ART SUPPLIES - As time goes on and networks improve, we hope to eventually offer a selection of choice pigments, canvas, brushes, solvents, other mediums, textiles and fibers, and additional supplies. 

KLEUR PRESS - 

ARTIST RESIDENCIES: In the future, we hope to grow enough to offer residencies for out-of-town artists to come and collaborate with locals and build a body of work that reflects this innovation. We need your help to get started.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone is in the position to help us reach our financial goal, but that doesn't mean you can't help us in other ENORMOUS ways:

  • Please share our Indigogo campaign through your Facebook page and shout out to people you know who might be in a more flexible financial position! Ask them to reference you, and we'll show you our thanks, love, and gratitude in several ways. 
  • Help us to SPREAD THE WORD about KLEUR on all of your social media outlets! 
  • Follow us on Instagram at @Kleur_Shop and ask your friends to do the same. You can't imagine how those little numbers help boost not only the shop's visibility, but also the work of our makers! Networking is KEY!
  • Please attend our opening night party, and any other events. Keep this ball in the air! You can't know how much we'd appreciate it. 
  • Be our friends. Give us input. We will listen.


Other Shops Like Ours in Far Off Places

Have Company: http://have-company.com
Need Supply: https://needsupply.com
Whiskey and Honey: http://www.whiskeyandhoney.us
Na Nin: http://shopnanin.com
Orn Hansen: http://www.ornhansen.com
Ro & Ro General Merchants: https://instagram.com/roandromerc/?hl=en
Little Paper Planes: http://littlepaperplanes.com

Meet Us & Our Makers So Far


Molly Grace* (Co-Owner, local painter and musician, curator of found and vintage)
Amanda Vaughn-Redmon* (Co-Owner, Designer of Formation Design Apparel)
Emma Wallace* (Co-Owner, Designer of Narrow Lines Co.)
OTHER MAKERS
Cory Wood *(Hold Steady Leather Co., WSNC)
Laura Lashley * (Painter, artist, WSNC)
Kait Neely* (Quiltmaker & Seamstress, Kait Cetera Designs, WSNC)
Chandra Noyes* (Embroidery, Mixed Media artist, Textiles, WSNC)
Jody Erickson* (Fine artist, prints, in Brooklyn, NY -- WSNC native)
Tony Fonda* (Refried Upholstery, WSNC by way of San Francisco)
Fred Frederick (FF Knives, out of Philadelphia, PA)
Cole Moser (Otto Haan leather goods, Charlotte, NC)
Megan Thompson *(Wild Rituals Soap Co., WSNC)
Sarah Whittlesey (Little Sey Organics Products, teas, salves, soaks, Charlotte, NC)
Samantha Urbanick (Illustrator and print work, Greensboro, NC)
Desiree Fonda* (curator of found and vintage, WSNC by way of San Francisco)
Evan Hawkins* (designer, EH84 Goods, lighting,home, and convenience)
Lauren Visconti-Beckett (designer & maker, Melting Sun Apparel, Atlanta, GA)
Will Isenogle (Illustrator, Printmaker, Oakland, CA)
Sean Warring (Woodworker, Furniture-Maker, WSNC)
...and that is just a start...

Follow us


IG: @Kleur_Shop 
Web: www.kleurshop.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kleurwsnc

story:
"Reconciling our past to build a brighter future for all."

Please help us raise one year of start up capital for an innovative initiative in Siem Reap.

The Cambodian War Remnant Museum

Sustainable tourism is our goal.

  • Education
  • Innovation
  • Empowerment

Your support will change lives. 

Here's how far your money will go...

  • $5 will provide lunches for 17 employees for one day
  • $10 will provide water and transportation for four days 
  • $25 will pay for administration and marketing for 10 days for the museum
  • $50 will provide lunches for 17 employees for ten days
  • $75 will fund water and transportation for one month
  • $100 will fund one employee for one month

Think you get the idea....

The Impact

The Impact of this project will run deep.

  • You’re investing in people.
  • You’re investing in a country.
  • You’re investing in a rich, unique business and cultural expression.
  • You're investing in sustainable tourism.

Immediate Outcomes

  1. Full time wages for 17 people for one year
  2. Steady employment for land mine victims who in many cases are otherwise unemployable
  3. Better access for tourists to a greater understanding of Cambodian history.
  4. The creation of a training centre to link with other local, like-minded organizations to create greater change in the community
  5. Promotion of peace and reconciliation through storytelling
  6. The ability to engage experts that can provide counselling in post traumatic stress syndrome

History

Cambodia, or as most locals still fondly refer to it, “Kampuchea” named after the French colonial rule, lies sandwiched between redefined borders once belonging to the Ancient Angkor Empire, now divided into Thailand, Laos and Vietnam. 

“As rich as a Cambodian” goes the old Chinese saying - as the region was rich in water and alluvial silt from the Mekong River and could yield up to 3 rice crops a year, with fresh fruit and fish in abundance. In the ‘60’s Cambodia was described as the “Pearl” of Asia with a modern Western rock culture and an envy of many developing South East Asian Countries.

Caught up as a political pawn in the Vietnam War, Cambodia spiralled into 30 years of civil war and a genocide program under the Pol Pot regime that saw an estimated 2 million of the country’s educated people exterminated.

Peace finally came in 1999 with the capitulation of the Khmer Rouge, but the country is still struggling to come to terms with the loss of an educated generation. Heavily mined by all sides of the conflict, people are still suffering today from the effects of land mines, the “perfect soldiers”. An estimated 6 million mines remain undetected.

Angkor Wat was listed as a UNESCO world heritage site in 1992 and since then the tourist growth has been phenomenal.

Many people come to visit the temples, but have a very vague knowledge as to the suffering that is ongoing as a result of the war. 

Cambodia is now one of the poorest countries in South East Asia with the vast majority of the population living on the poverty line of $2/day.

Despite the hardship, Cambodians are a resilient and happy people, just getting on with life.

Summary

This interactive social enterprise is about making a difference through storytelling, building better relationships with tourists and engaging local Cambodians.

This isn’t about a short-term bandaid. It’s about coming alongside a group of land mine survivors who are passionately committed to earning a living while educating others about their history. They need your help to begin this journey to meaningful, sustainable work  that will impact the healing taking place in their beloved and beleaguered country. 

It’s about telling stories about Cambodia’s past, but even more importantly about shaping its future. 

The Cambodia War Remnant Museum was a former battlefield and holds a unique value for the guides and the local Cambodians living nearby. Many artifacts on display at the museum were found while constructing the site. 

It’s located a few kilometres from the temples of Angkor Wat and the guides want to share their story about Cambodian culture, and Cambodia's difficult and violent past with you and they want to educate a younger generation about an empowered future full of hope and opportunity.

Visitors to the Museum will not only help to sustain the war veterans and land mine victims but will also help to provide basic needs such as fresh water, education and essential medical supplies to their immediate families and friends living within the grounds of the museum. A community approach.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 12 months of start up capital and operational funding to get the museum off the ground. 

This will allow the guides to build their business one tourist at a time. 

The location is minutes away from the world renewed temples of Angkor Wat where over 2.5 million tourists come visit year from around the world. 

Can you see the potential?

The impact is far reaching. The financial opportunity for growth is huge. It really is so multi-layered.

Your money will fund 4 distinct line items:

  1. 17 Staff at $100 per month each for a grand total of $1700. Yes that’s only $1700 to keep 17 people employed. (comparable local wage)
  2. Water and transportation @ $2.50/ day = $75/month
  3. Food for staff @ $5.00/day = $150/month
  4. Administration, Fundraising and Marketing @ 2.50/day = $75/month

Total: $2,000/month

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk for the museum is that they may be forced to close before they are 'discovered' by tourists.

There is a lot of competition for the tourist dollar in Siem Reap, but we believe that the War Remnant Museum just needs time to get the word out and they will become a 'must-see' stop in a visit to Angkor Wat.

The marketing has begun.

The website is up. www.warrmc.com

Social media attention is growing.

Other Ways You Can Help

The first way you can help is COME AND VISIT!!!!

Please also help us get word on the street about this campaign, but more importantly about the Museum itself. 

Ultimately the goal is to get to the point of at least 25 visitors per day. That's it. Not only will this cover operational costs, but will give the museum the opportunity to grow and further develop their social program. 

Share it on YouTube

Share it on Twitter

Share it on Facebook

Leave a review for the museum on Trip Advisor

Tell your friends about the Museum.
story_txt:
"Reconciling our past to build a brighter future for all."Please help us raise one year of start up capital for an innovative initiative in Siem Reap.The Cambodian War Remnant MuseumSustainable tourism is our goal.

Education

Innovation
Empowerment
Your support will change lives. Here's how far your money will go...

$5 will provide lunches for 17 employees for one day


$10 will provide water and transportation for four days 


$25 will pay for administration and marketing for 10 days for the museum


$50 will provide lunches for 17 employees for ten days


$75 will fund water and transportation for one month


$100 will fund one employee for one month


Think you get the idea....

The Impact
The Impact of this project will run deep.

You’re investing in people.
You’re investing in a country.
You’re investing in a rich, unique business and cultural expression.
You're investing in sustainable tourism.

Immediate Outcomes

Full time wages for 17 people for one year
Steady employment for land mine victims who in many cases are otherwise unemployable
Better access for tourists to a greater understanding of Cambodian history.
The creation of a training centre to link with other local, like-minded organizations to create greater change in the community
Promotion of peace and reconciliation through storytelling
The ability to engage experts that can provide counselling in post traumatic stress syndrome

History
Cambodia, or as most locals still fondly refer to it,
“Kampuchea” named after the French colonial rule, lies sandwiched between
redefined borders once belonging to the Ancient Angkor Empire, now divided into
Thailand, Laos and Vietnam. 
“As rich as a Cambodian” goes the old Chinese saying - as
the region was rich in water and alluvial silt from the Mekong River and could
yield up to 3 rice crops a year, with fresh fruit and fish in abundance. In the
‘60’s Cambodia was described as the “Pearl” of Asia with a modern Western rock
culture and an envy of many developing South East Asian Countries.
Caught up as a political pawn in the Vietnam War,
Cambodia spiralled into 30 years of civil war and a genocide program under the
Pol Pot regime that saw an estimated 2 million of the country’s educated people
exterminated.
Peace finally came in 1999 with the capitulation of
the Khmer Rouge, but the country is still struggling to come to terms with the loss of an educated generation. Heavily mined by all sides of the conflict, people are still suffering today from the effects of land mines, the “perfect soldiers”. An
estimated 6 million mines remain undetected.
Angkor Wat was listed as a UNESCO world heritage site
in 1992 and since then the tourist growth has been phenomenal.
Many people come to visit the temples, but have a very
vague knowledge as to the suffering that is ongoing as a result of the
war. 
Cambodia is now one of the poorest countries in South East Asia with the vast
majority of the population living on the poverty line of $2/day.
Despite the hardship, Cambodians are a resilient and
happy people, just getting on with life.


Summary
This interactive social enterprise is about making a
difference through storytelling, building better relationships with tourists and
engaging local Cambodians.

This isn’t about a short-term bandaid. It’s about coming alongside a group of land mine survivors who are passionately committed to earning a living while
educating others about their history. They need your help to begin this journey to meaningful, sustainable work  that will impact the healing taking place in their beloved and beleaguered country. 
It’s about telling stories about Cambodia’s past,
but even more importantly about shaping its future. 
The Cambodia War Remnant Museum was a former
battlefield and holds a unique value for the guides and the local Cambodians
living nearby. Many artifacts on display at the museum were found while
constructing the site. 
It’s located a few kilometres from the temples of
Angkor Wat and the guides want to share their story
about Cambodian culture, and Cambodia's difficult and
violent past with you and they want to educate a younger generation about
an empowered future full of hope and opportunity. 
Visitors to the Museum will not only help to sustain the war veterans and land mine victims but will also help to provide basic needs such as fresh water, education and essential medical supplies to their immediate families and friends living within the grounds of the museum. A community approach.
What We Need & What You Get
We need 12 months of start up
capital and operational funding to get the museum off the ground. 
This will allow the guides to build
their business one tourist at a time. 
The location is minutes away from
the world renewed temples of Angkor Wat where over 2.5 million tourists come visit
year from around the world. 
Can you see the potential? 
The impact is far reaching. The
financial opportunity for growth is huge. It really is so multi-layered.
Your money will fund 4 distinct line
items:


17 Staff at $100 per month each
for a grand total of $1700. Yes that’s only $1700 to keep 17 people employed. (comparable local wage)
Water and transportation @ $2.50/
day = $75/month

Food for staff @ $5.00/day = $150/month


Administration, Fundraising and
Marketing @ 2.50/day = $75/month


Total: $2,000/month
Risks & Challenges
The greatest risk for the museum is
that they may be forced to close before they are 'discovered' by tourists.
There is a lot of competition for
the tourist dollar in Siem Reap, but we believe that the War Remnant Museum just needs time to get the word out and they will become a 'must-see' stop in a visit to Angkor Wat.
The marketing has begun.
The website is up. www.warrmc.com
Social media attention is growing. 
Other Ways You Can Help
The first way you can help is COME AND VISIT!!!!
Please also help us get word on the
street about this campaign, but more importantly about the Museum itself. 
Ultimately the goal is to get to the
point of at least 25 visitors per day. That's it. Not only will this cover
operational costs, but will give the museum the opportunity to grow and further develop their social program. 
Share it on YouTube
Share it on Twitter
Share it on Facebook
Leave a review for the museum on
Trip Advisor
Tell your friends about the Museum.

story:
Overview

Mike D's BBQ is a line of signature BBQ sauces and all purpose dry rubs. Our sauces are my twist on the traditional BBQ sauce with some unique seasonings and spice levels. A core ingredient of our sauces is our all purpose dry rub which is great with beef, pork, or any bird. Whether you are in your kitchen, backyard grilling, or smoking our sauces and rub are the perfect flavor compliment by not overpowering the natural flavor of the meat.

History

Our history is still being written, but has its beginnings with me and my love for smoking meat. I am a BBQ junkie. In my quest to find the perfect BBQ, I once had a blog where I reviewed the various que spots I encountered while on the road. I also was intrigued by the various sauces and rubs that were available as I wanted to find the perfect combination for my desired flavor. Eventually, I decided to make my own rub and sauce and after many variations I found the perfect combination of sweet, smokey, and a little bite!

In December 2013 we launched MIke D's BBQ, and a crowdfunding campaign in 2014 helped us roll out our first products. Check out this video about year 1 of business 

and year 2 if you missed it above 

Business Highlights:

  • In business since December 2013, started selling Dry Rub in March 2014 and BIG Sauce in July 2014
  • in 2014 passed $3k in sales
  • Picked up first retail location (Big Al’s BBQ – Raleigh) on May 2, 2015
  • Shipped to 25 states and D.C.
  • Launched Sweet & Spicy Rub June 12, 2015
  • Picked up Second retail location (King's Red & White Market - Durham) on June 24, 2015
  • 23% sales increase in 2015 from 2014

What's Next

We've had a pretty successful 2 year run, but need to do a few things to help propel us to the next level. We want to increase our retail presence in 2016 which means

  • we need UPC labels on our products. Many retail outlets will not take products without these UPC code labels on them. Cost $250
  • Launch Spicy BBQ sauce - $2500 (already lab tested just needs to go to production)
  • Launch Fire BBQ Sauce - $2750 (needs to go to lab and then production

In addition to these new items we also need to Scale production on two current products whose demand is increasing more than I can produce on my own. Also, the cost of ingredients for the rubs fluctuate making it hard to budget for expenses. taking the rubs to full production means I will have volume to match demand and can get control on production expense to a fixed costs

  • All-purpose rub to full production - $1500
  • Sweet & Spicy rub to full production - $1500
Yes, these costs add up to more than our goal....the goal gets us the amount we are currently short of achieving all this. Our hope is to have the upc codes, the new products, and current products to full production by summer 2016 our busy season!

Perks (all shirts, hats, aprons are from VL Custom Apparel)

We have some exciting perks to show our appreciation for those who make a contribution. We have 8 levels of perks ranging from $5 to $1300! 

$5 - BBQ Enthusiast: 10% off next order

$10 - BBQ Starter Pack: Coupon for 15% off next order

$20 - Kitchen Master: Mike D's BBQ Apron and 15% off next order

$50 - Backyard Master:  Mike D's BBQ tshirt, Mike D's BBQ Hat and 15% off next order

$100 - Block Party Maestro: Mike D's BBQ tshirt, Mike D's BBQ Hat, Mike D's BBQ Apron and 15% off next order

$300 - Pit Crew Trainee: All of Maestro perks plus personalized BBQ on the go kit which includes 13 piece set, complete with Insulated cooler compartment and 3 large cooking utensils, personally engraved for you. 

$500 - Cook Team: All of Pit Crew perks plus Mike D will throw you and guest of your choosing a private smoke party with all the fixins!!

$1,300 - Shark Tank: If you are a fan of Shark Tank, you know that Mr. Wonderful likes to work royalties into his investments. This perk is in the tradition of Mr. Wonderful and gets you monthly royalties based on 2% of the monthly sales of sauces and rubs

* There are limited perks available at each level, so get in on the action before they run out!

The Impact

We know that we are still in tight times, and the economy has not fully recovered for everyone, but your contribution will help to continue to grow  a lifetime dream. The business has alredy grown more than expected in the first 2 years and this next push can help take us to the next level of having enough products and sales to have our own storefront that will be your one stop shop for all things BBQ.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, we still appreciate your support. Please share this campaign and together we can make this a reality!

story:
Our Story

Many people today are suffering from back pain possibly due to poor posture.  Extended periods of time sitting puts more pressure on joints, making breathing more difficult, and can lead to back and neck problems. As a person becomes weaker and is not able to sit up-right, the upper body may begin to lean to the side causing the spine to be out of alignment.

This is a great concern for the individual as well as for caregivers.  As my mother became less social and was experiencing more pain, the search was on to find something other than pillows and rolled up towels to give her support and enable her to sit up-right. 

My mother had a contagious smile that you could not help but return.  As she became weaker and her pain increased, she began to lose that beautiful smile.  It saddened me to see my mother in so much pain.  I knew I needed to do something to try and ease her pain. One day I thought of a solution that might help and began drafting it on paper.  After several trials I created the perfect design.  I wanted something that would give her support without being too hard or restricting.  It had to be strong enough to enable her to sit up-right yet still be comfortable.  After several trials I created the perfect design.

Almost immediately Mother’s pain had improved and her contagious smile was back.  The added support improved her breathing, digestion, spinal alignment and overall comfort.  For 18 precious months my mother was happier and could sit with dignity again.  I like to call it a comfort system because mother had rheumatoid arthritis her entire life and my design provided her comfort and safety and helped lessen the pain she was feeling.  It was thrilling   to see the amazing improvement in her quality of life.

I was heartbroken when my Mother passed away, but I knew that I must strive to help others like I was able to help my mother. I knew in my heart that I would be able to help so many others with the same product I used to improve my mother’s final years.

When my childhood friend, Ron Sutton, saw the how much it helped mother, he helped me to manufacture the product.  With his knowledge of textiles and my design, the Acme Posture Partner was created.

The word acme means “the best” and we felt our product would provide the best support to those in need, so we gave the name Acme Posture Partner to our product.  My mother’s name was Bonnie Hall; therefore, our company name is Hall International, named after my mother. 

It is heartwarming to see the improvement in the quality of life with this very simple yet versatile and restraint-free product.  The Acme Posture Partner may be used in most any chair, bed, vehicle and RV for added support, positioning and comfort.  Over time, we have found there are extended uses to support the head, neck, lumbar, arms and knees.  It can provide comfort for children and adults with special needs, it may provide infant safety, and is especially comfortable for anyone falling asleep in a car.

Together we can help provide a better quality of life for those in need.  With your contribution we can all feel a sense of joy by providing the Acme Posture Partner to anyone of any age needing additional comfort.

Thank you in advance for helping us to reach our goal.  We appreciate you sharing Acme Posture Partner’s crowdfunding efforts with your family and friends.

Why we need you!

We’ve turned to Indiegogo to open our idea to you and to individuals around the world.  There are many people living in the world today who suffer due to age, muscular diseases, and injuries. Our goal is to raise $8,000 to get the product into the hands of people who need the support system. Your funding will help make this possible.  Help us spread the joy of comfort this holiday season by contributing.

You can also help us by spreading the word about Acme Posture Partner.  The more people that know about this product, the more men, women and children we will be able to help.  As contributions come in, products will be shipped to an individual in need.  Early contributions will allow products to be received by Christmas.

Please feel free to contact us with suggestions of individuals in need at susan@hallllc.com

Testimonials

Sue Chambliss R.N., Texas

“Ms. Childress’s mother would lean to one side or slide down in her chair throughout the day.  There was no one way to align her body with pillows, they would slip or be the wrong size. Since the Posture Partner, Ms. Childress made her mother, it is easy to get good body alignment most of the time.  Her mother is doing better now that many of her aches have lessened.  She is talking more and generally happier since the Posture Partner has been in use.”

Tom McCann

“I wanted to take this opportunity to let you know what a blessing it has been for my Mother since we acquired the “Posture Partner”.  It has made such a dramatic difference in the quality of life which my Mom experience as a nursing home resident. She no longer has to endure the constant difficulty of trying to maintain a comfortable and upright posture while occupying her wheelchair during the day.  And no more sore, stiff neck after awakening from an afternoon nap in front of the TV.  In fact, my Mother’s disposition and attitude have experienced a very noticeable improvement since acquiring the Posture Partner. I enthusiastically and wholeheartedly recommend the Posture Partner to anyone who has a family member or loved one that is in need of a product that would enable them to maintain a comfortable and upright position while occupying a wheelchair.”

Holden Hronek, LVN, Texas

“This product not only provides postural support, but allows patient to participate in socializing, promotes nutritional intake, and does so without being restrictive to patient.  This system allows patient to have a higher quality of life as well as improving comfort and posture.  There is a trend of Facilities striving to be “Restraint Free”.  This system could be instrumental in achieving this goal while assisting patients with postural deficits. I strongly recommend this product.”

Juanita Brown, PT, Park Plaza Nursing and Rehabilitation

“I hope you all try these products in your long term care settings.  These devices are practical, economical and produce very dignified seating environments.  Our facility has had improved sitting postures with reduction of skin breakdown and improved postures for safer swallowing.  Give them a try, you will be hooked.”

Shanna Zertuche, LVN/Alzheimer’s Unit Director, Creative Solutions

“It is very difficult to keep residents positioned properly as they age and health declines-i.e. weakness to back, neck, and extremities.  With the Acme Posture Partner, this resident sits in an appropriate upright position and is comfortable in her chair when she was leaning to the side, causing pain and difficulty eating.  I think this device is wonderful and would benefit so many other people, greatly improving quality of life, which is our main goal!”

Lawana Stevens, Scott & White Home Care/Hospice Executive Assistant

“I wanted you to know the recent patient we are using it on, works wonderfully. We have an assisted living that really likes them for our patients.”

Tyrone, Charge Nurse, Ballinger, TX

“Since implementation of Acme support device, resident has had significant increase in appetite.  I believe that this is related to ease of positioning while being fed.  Presence of “would-be” decubitus pressure areas have improved.  I recommend the usage of the Acme Posture Partner support device in the geriatric patient.”


The Impact on Your Health 

There are 41.4 million people age 65 or older in the United States. In 2060 that number is projected to be 92 million. As our life span continues to increase and the elderly population grows we are seeing a larger need for products such as the Acme Posture Partner.  Dr. Ben Rubin, M.D. orthopedic surgeon and sports medicine legend states “the core stability is the ability to stabilize your spinal column against gravity.  Posture seems to affect the health and well-being of every cell and every system in your body.”

According to the Spine Institute, “While millions of individuals suffer from chronic neck or back pain, many are unable to find the source of their discomfort.  If a doctor has ruled out a spine condition such as spinal arthritis, degenerative disc disease, or sciatica, poor posture may be to blame.  Maintaining a good sitting posture can not only help to improve your appearance but it can also alleviate pain in the neck and back.”  The lesser-known benefits of good posture include: easier breathing, healthier joints, and better concentration.


Specifications of the Acme Posture Partner

This easy care comfort system is portable and comes in a clear plastic carrying bag for convenient travel. The cushions are made with Polyurethane foam and covered with durable vinyl.  The covers for each piece are made of 100% Polyester, washable fleece material.  All five pieces are indigo blue, and have been treated with anti-microbial and flame resistant treatments.  The design is patented, and the product is available in one size.  The back cushion is 28”X18 ¾” with straps for attachment.  Two small cushions are 19” in length with a circumference 13”.  Two large cushions are 19” in length with a 17 ¾” circumference.

Presence of “would-be” decubitus pressure areas have improved.  I recommend the usage of the Acme Posture
Partner support device in the geriatric patient.”
The Impact on Your Health 

There are 41.4 million people age 65 or older in the United States. In 2060 that number is projected to be 92 million. As our life span continues to increase and the elderly population grows we are seeing a larger need for products such as the Acme Posture Partner.  Dr. Ben
Rubin, M.D. orthopedic surgeon and sports medicine legend states “the core
stability is the ability to stabilize your spinal column against gravity.  Posture seems to affect the health and
well-being of every cell and every system in your body.”
According
to the Spine Institute, “While millions of individuals suffer from chronic neck
or back pain, many are unable to find the source of their discomfort.  If a doctor has ruled out a spine condition
such as spinal arthritis, degenerative disc disease, or sciatica, poor posture
may be to blame.  Maintaining a good
sitting posture can not only help to improve your appearance but it can also
alleviate pain in the neck and back.” 
The lesser-known benefits of good posture include: easier breathing,
healthier joints, and better concentration.Specifications of the Acme Posture Partner
This easy care comfort system is portable and comes in a clear plastic
carrying bag for convenient travel. The cushions are made with Polyurethane
foam and covered with durable vinyl.  The
covers for each piece are made of 100% Polyester, washable fleece material.  All five pieces are indigo blue, and have
been treated with anti-microbial and flame resistant treatments.  The design is patented, and the product is
available in one size.  The back cushion
is 28”X18 ¾” with straps for attachment. 
Two small cushions are 19” in length with a circumference 13”.  Two large cushions are 19” in length with a
17 ¾” circumference.

story:
Calling all Popcorn Lovers, Family, & Friends! We are are extremely close to opening the Ithaca Popcorn Company and we need your help to purchase the last piece of equipment needed to make fabulous gourmet savory & sweet popcorn. 

How We Got Here

It’s funny how when you get older you start to think about all the things you wanted to do but didn't. In our case, Robin & I had long tossed around various business ideas --but they just never felt quite right. That all changed the two summers ago. When on vacation we wandered into a quaint popcorn shop to grab our favorite snack. As we munched away during the ride home we realized that a gourmet popcorn company would be an awesome addition to the Ithaca community. While the popcorn we were eating was good we knew we could improve upon it; a line of gourmet popcorn that wasn’t filled with GMOs, corn syrup, artificial colors, or preservatives. In addition, we realized we could lend support to other small businesses by sourcing some of our ingredients locally. 

Whenever I smell popcorn, my mind goes back to helping my mom make massive amounts of popcorn that literally filled two brown paper grocery sacks for a night at the drive-in movies. I still fondly remember giggling under the stars with my brothers and sister as we happily munched on popcorn waiting for the movie to begin. We hope our popcorn will stir these types of memories in others, as well as help create new memories.

As our idea developed, I began researching everything I could about the gourmet popcorn industry. Next, I gathered recipes, and then the easy part came: recruiting taste tasters! I knew we had finally turned the corner when our tasters began asking to purchase their favorite popcorn flavor. I retired in January 2016 to devote all my time & energy to find a production site - something that had eluded us for over a year. I'm happy to report we signed a lease for a shared kitchen 10 days ago.  

Our Mission:

Yes, all businesses need a mission statement and ours definitely reflects our quirky senses of humor. Our mission is to save you from tutti-freaky, day-glow popcorn laden with GMOs, preservatives, and artificial flavors and colors like the stuff below.

How will we accomplish that? By bringing good old-fashioned, all-natural popcorn with a twist --that is crafted with love & the finest ingredients --to you. 

What We Have Accomplished to Date

I can’t believe how much we've accomplished since securing a production facility. Here’s a quick overview: lease signed, insurance[s] purchased, all additional required licensing & legal paperwork submitted, smaller equipment purchased, packaging finalized & ordered, supply-ordering initiated, POS products finalized, website under construction, and graphic design for labels initiated.

How We Plan to Spend the Funds Raised

The equipment that we plan to purchase:

The Cretor Caramel Processing plant containing a 10-gallon caramelizer and 60oz popper with table. I am truly giddy with joy just looking at this picture. BIG batches of honey caramel here we come!  Cost: $11,216.99 plus shipping.

The Impact

-If you believe Ithaca needs an all-natural snack made with the finest ingredients available, please support our campaign!

-If you are a friend or fan of Ithaca Popcorn Company then please support our campaign!

-If you believe that it takes a village to raise a child or in this case nurture a budding small business and as a bonus helps other local small businesses then please support our campaign!

-If you have become addicted to our caramel popcorn lovingly referred to by some of our customers as “popcorn crack” or one of our other flavors then please support our campaign!

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges in opening a new business but without taking risks we are doomed to fail and life is way to short to live with regrets. 

The biggest challenge besides finding a location so far has been hitting the kickstarter button and that’s only because it’s easier for us to help others then ask for help ourselves.

Other Ways to be Supportive

If you can’t contribute at this time but you would still like to help, please: 

o  Share our campaign with your family, friends, and co-workers through social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc.) with the Indiegogo tools or via email, phone, fax, or telepathy.

o  Shout our name from the tallest buildings in Ithaca and cities across the world. Okay this may be overkill but if the feeling moves you go for it!

o  Like Ithaca Popcorn Company on Facebook.

Shout-Out Time

Thanks everyone for all the love and support we have already received! A special shout-out to all the fabulous INFO SCI majors/alumni, the Student Service posse, and Robin’s co-workers that have encouraged us each step of the way. I’d also be amiss if I didn’t thank Kyle and Graham for telling me over and over to “GO FOR IT”, Colin for sharing his mind blowing talent, Zach for always believing in me, Sam for being so patient, and Alex for just being Alex!

Yes, it’s a little unusual to give a shout out as part of a campaign but I’m a little unusual and I absolutely refuse to not express my appreciation to everyone that has done so much already to help this dream become a reality.

story:
Who We Are

The Grinning Goblin is a venue for gaming enthusiasts to get together, play games, drink, eat and have fun.  We are gamers and we are building for gamers so we have thought of it all.  From full immersion virtual reality systems to console games to card tables and of course, food and beer.  When it’s done the Grinning Goblin will be the premier hangout in the Midwest.  

 

 

Looking for a place to play games with friends?  Looking to meet new people?  Want to hang out with men and women who are into video games, board games, cosplay, comics and all things geeky?  The Grinning Goblin is for you.

 

 

Why don’t gamers have the same options as all the sports fan when it comes to bar selection? Gamers and geeks often are relegated to bars with sports playing in the background; music so loud you can’t enjoy the company you are with; and Wack-a-Mole type games. Gamers and geeks alike need a place to feel they belong; a place for them. That’s what we are building, a place for gamers and geeks enjoy what they love. It’s time to stand up and be proud to be a gamer and geek. Show this town that you need a place made for you by people just like you.

 

Our Origins

In the beginning we wanted to build a card shop, but it was soon clear that the gaming community needed something bigger and grander.  So we set out to build the kind of place that we would like to visit.  A place with great food, plentiful drinks and fun activities.

 

 

After meandering the streets of Wichita, we came across a building that glittered like the gold we had just hidden in the rafters. That was where we decided to build our bar! We decided take this 3,500 sq-ft of nothing but concrete and a steel support beam and build a home for Wichita nerds to hang, drink, and destroy. Their fellow nerds will heed their victory on the field of gaming glory.

  Before

Construction has begun but we still have much to do. As building has progressed we realized something was missing, YOU!

You who play board games, card games, video games, storm the battlefields in D&D, collect your favorite geeky obsessions, who like to watch E-Sports instead of those ‘regular sports’. It is YOU we are missing.

Now we don’t want you to feel obligated to help us create an awesome hangout for Wichita. After all Wichita only needs 1 place to geek out and play games. The entire community can fit into 1 place right?

Current

Getting out and sharing hobbies you enjoy shouldn’t be relegated to just a few places. You deserve to have a bar option just as much as sports bar patrons. But it takes community support from people like you to bring in something new. Without you, variety can't happen and that is what we want for all of you.  To sum up, we could really use your help.

 

We have finished most of the construction, what we need help with is the electronics. We need computers, consoles, games, and general geekery.  Even if this campaign is not successful the bar will still open. But this is your chance to make it great. You can make a difference and help create a better Grinning Goblin, and get yourself some pretty sweet perks along the way. Tell us your opinions, what you like or what you would like to see, suggestions are ALWAYS welcome! We want this to be YOUR bar.

 

 

Why IndieGoGo

We want every donation to count and for  you to be able to say, “I helped build the Goblin!” IndieGoGo gives you the flexibility to make your donation count, whether this project is fully funded or not.

 

At the end of the day we want you to feel like you have found a place to rest your weary head after a rough day of pillaging and mayhem. Where you and your friends can relax, have a drink, and argue about who has the best collection of memorabilia in existence.  The Grinning Goblin is going to be amazing, and with your donation we can make it even better. But keep your mits off the hidden gold...it’s special.

So click that pink button, pick one of the amazing perks, I highly recommend a geeky apron made by the talented Chasing Wonderland Designs. While you are at it stop by Triple Diamond Cosplay to check them out and pick up a print!

 

Special thanks:

Nerd Barrage for the video

Chasing Wonderland Designs letting me show an apron in the video

Triple Diamond Cosplay for letting me borrow your AMAZING Harley.

April Gloria  Cosplay photo

Tahnee Lane Cosplay Photo

Novastar Gaming Photo Contribution

 

 

Special shout out my fallen compatriots in the geeky community:

Battlestations Gaming and Fireshark Gaming

story:
LA Hardy, Daniel Ryan and David Frank are in the process of opening a restaurant that will be the elite entertainment club for quality entertainment in the north palm beach county area. This new entertainment club plans on bringing a different twist to the nightlife in the north end of the county including National Touring Comics you've seen on TV, touring Jazz Bands, Live Music, Movie Nights and more.

We will be creating the perfect place for date night, to grab some food and drinks or to just watch some fun entertainment.

With your help we can break into an untapped market with perfect potential for growth. We have produced some great shows throughout Palm Beach County and appreciate everyone that has supported every room we have open. Now we have a chance to open and run our own place and do it correctly while not only creating more jobs in Palm Beach County but bringing a much needed twist to the nightlife in Northern Palm Beach County.

We are willing to work out some great incentives for anyone willing to invest capital into the business.

Anything helps, no matter how big or small the donation is. Thank you to everyone for your donations and support in everything that we do. Without you all, none of this is possible.

story:
Short Summary

We are a society focused on building interpersonal bonds, offering opportunities for professional development, and coordinating with faculty to improve the Systems Engineering department for all students.
Raising funds will enable us as a society to hold our weekly meetings, coordinate social events, and have professional development courses. 

We are seeking the support of UNCC faculty, UNCC Students, family and friends to make this possible!

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $500, however our goal is to surpass that amount to heighten our flexibility and increase opportunity as a society. 

All funds will be used to pay for items such as food for weekly meetings, social and professional development events. 

Your contributions will get you a polo or button-down shirt depending on the perk you select! 

Men's Polo. Pick your size and color!!

Woman's polo. Pick your size and color!

Button downs for all. Pick your size and color!

T-Shirt for men. Pick your size and color!

T-Shirt for women. Pick your size and color!

Hat for all. Pick your color!

SSE Pens.


The Impact

Your contributions will have a positive impact on our member's (your friend's, child's, or student's) academic career, professional future, and the direction of the Systems Engineering and Engineering Management department at UNC Charlotte. 

Our motivation is simple: "Connect. Empower. Achieve."

Risks & Challenges

If we do not raise funds, we do not get to do the things we hope to do. We want to keep our members excited about what's coming up next! 

And, we need pizza. Not having pizza every weekly meeting is a big problem....

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign! Please let your extended family and your network know about our mission so we can reach our goal!

story:
What is Tours for Humanity?

Our story is simple: boy meets girl, girl is mean to boy, they start dating, girl gets cancer and they decide to start their own social good enterprise after realizing that life is short and fragile. It’s a vision dreamt up by Bo Hammond, a former history major and DC tour guide, and his cancer fighting, business guru girlfriend Lisa Maurer. 

Ever since Lisa’s battle with cancer, we wanted to do something meaningful to fight the disease and make the world better in general. We’re avid fundraisers, raising money for charities such as the American Cancer Society and the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. We want to find a way to make giving core to our life. Why should helping people be part time? We shouldn’t be forced to separate any of our life’s ambitions, whether they be personal, professional, or philanthropic. We want to give every day of our lives. The more we give, the more we live.  

In that spirit, we decided to combine our passions of history, business, and giving to create a social enterprise. Tours for Humanity uses history to help people. We provide walking tours of Washington, DC such as the National Mall, Arlington Cemetery, Capitol Hill and many more. At the end of the year our company donates a portion of profits to charities combating ignorance, poverty and disease. Every part of our company, right down to our uniforms, does good in the world. Our goal is to help people and make money doing it. It’s a way to address two essential needs with an action that unifies them both.

We’ve put together a talented team of teachers, history buffs and MBAs. With some hard work, Lisa’s business savvy, and more importantly your support, we can make a real difference.

We need to raise $18,000 to get our company started. This capital will enable us to cover our initial start up costs, from strategic marketing campaigns to DC guide licenses.

Here’s how you can help: donate to our campaign, share our story on social media, and come on a tour.

A tour won’t save the world but it’s a step in the right direction.

Carpe Diem,
Bo & Lisa


Why should I help? 

Help us help the world. By helping us achieve our goal, you are contributing to a social enterprise that measures success in the amount of good it creates, not just profits. In fact, we pledge to contribute a portion of our profits to three charities, including the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society and Ashoka. As a perk, our third charity will be chosen by a vote from our top donors. We believe that our supporters should be rewarded with the choice of what global cause we support. At the end of every year this third charity will rotate and a new one will be chosen by our community.  

We don’t stop there. Every part of our supply chain, right down to our uniforms, does good. We are striving to meet rigorous standards of social performance, accountability, and transparency to attain B-Corp certification, which is a certification from the nonprofit B Lab. Where feasible, our supply chain will be sustainable and fair trade. We will start with our uniform for good, where each product purchased provides a social benefit to the world. 


Is 18K enough to fund an entire tour company? 

No way. It’s just enough to cover our initial startup costs. The $18K we need to raise with this project will allow us to hit the ground running, ready to give our first tour. We’ve broken down some of the boring business costs that are necessary for our startup to succeed.  

We look forward to reaching and even surpassing our goal with your support. What’s important is that the more we raise the greater our impact.  Greater funds will allow us to employ more guides, reach more people, and do more good.  You are part of something that will continue to grow.  In the years ahead, we will expand to other cities and find new ways of reaching people.  And it all starts right here with you.

How can I help to start something that matters? 

1. Donate funds to the cause.

2. Share our Indiegogo campaign on social media: 

     http://igg.me/at/toursforhumanity

3. Follow and share us on:

    Facebook: toursforhumanity

    Twitter: @humanitytours

4. Come on one of our tours and rate us on Trip Advisor or Yelp. 

Are there any perks? 

A perk is great but we all know that the real reward is being a part of something that matters.  You scratch our back and we’ll scratch yours! Here’s what you will get:

1.  $10: Historical fun fact

2.  $25: Digital photo guide of DC

3.  $50: A tour for donors only

4.  $100: T-Shirt for humanity

5.  $250: One private tour of choice

6.  $500: Two private tours and a vote

7.  $1,000: All tours and a vote

8.  $1,000: All in and supper too

If you choose to come on one of our tours, here’s what we offer:

NATIONAL MALL TOUR: Washington Monument, White House, WWII Memorial, Korean War Memorial, Vietnam Veterans Memorial, Lincoln Memorial

ARLINGTON NATIONAL CEMETERY TOUR: The Kennedy gravesites, the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, Arlington House ~ The Robert E. Lee Memorial, the final resting place of Pierre Charles L'Enfant, memorials to the Challenger & Columbia Shuttle Crews, and the Mast of the USS Maine

TIDAL BASIN TOUR: Martin Luther King, Jr. Memorial, Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial, Thomas Jefferson Memorial, George Mason Memorial, Japanese Cherry Blossom Trees

CAPITOL HILL TOUR: House of Representatives, Senate, Supreme Court, Library of Congress, Capitol Building

LINCOLN ASSASSINATION TOUR: National Theater, Ford’s Theater, Baptist Alley, Peterson Boarding House, White House, Lafayette Square, Site of Vice President Johnson’s Hotel, Star Saloon, US Treasury Building

Are our tours any good? 

No. They’re *!$%ing great! We’ve already given a few tours and here’s what people are saying about us:


“Bo knows DC”

Our guide, Bo, couldn't have been nicer, friendlier, more knowledgeable, and more patient/humorous with the kids peppering him with questions! Walking pace is easy enough, and the kind of unofficial info passed along really enhanced the tour. 

"Bo soldiered on and didn't let the rain shorten our experience"

On Friday night we did the Monuments Tour with Bo. He was engaging, very knowledgeable, and very genuine. The tour was well paced. It started pouring rain with about 45 minutes to go- but Bo soldiered on- and didn't let the rain shorten our experience. (Even though he was getting wet- after he kindly let some of our fellow tourists use his umbrella that he had brought along!)

“I am learning stories that I didn’t even know”

I teach at a high school in the Bronx. I am here on this tour today and it has been absolutely fantastic. The tour guide has been extremely informative. I have been teaching U.S. history and government for the last five years and I am learning stories that I didn’t even know. I’m going to take them back to the classroom. It’s been fantastic and the kids have loved it. It’s funny. It’s engaging. They have had plenty of time to see all of the exhibits and all of the monuments. It’s just been a blast! 

“Our guide Bo, was a history grad and it showed!”

For a city teeming with rich history, a guided tour was a must-do for a history buff like me. Our guide Bo, was a history grad and it showed! At every memorial/monument, we were treated to it's fascinating back story, and those of the great men and women who've been honored there. It was a bleak rainy day, but Bo kept us in good cheer with his narration, interspersed with funny and interesting historical anecdotes. Overall highly recommended.


Are there any risks? 

We’d be lying if we said there weren’t any risks. There is the potential that tourists will not care if their tour helps people or not. We believe that people are inherently good and that given the chance to help others they will.  Building a startup is full of challenges and it might fail, but the world will spin on.  If we succeed then we can do our part to improve the world for years to come.  We have a year to lose or everything to gain. As Franklin Roosevelt wrote, “The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.”

Who are your guides? 

Our guides are passionate about history, educated and want to make the world just a little better.
story_txt:
What is Tours for Humanity? 


Our story is simple: boy meets girl, girl
is mean to boy, they start dating, girl gets cancer and they decide to start
their own social good enterprise after realizing that life is short and
fragile. It’s a vision dreamt up by Bo Hammond, a former history major and
DC tour guide, and his cancer fighting, business guru girlfriend Lisa
Maurer.  
Ever since Lisa’s battle
with cancer, we wanted to do something meaningful to fight the disease and make
the world better in general. We’re avid fundraisers, raising money for
charities such as the American Cancer Society and the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. We want to find a way to make giving core to our life. Why should helping people be part
time? We shouldn’t be forced to separate any of our life’s ambitions, whether
they be personal, professional, or philanthropic. We want to give every day of our
lives. The more we give, the more we live.  
In that spirit, we decided
to combine our passions of history, business, and giving to create a social
enterprise. Tours for Humanity uses history to help people. We provide walking
tours of Washington, DC such as the National Mall, Arlington Cemetery, Capitol
Hill and many more. At the end of the year our company donates a portion of profits to charities combating ignorance, poverty and disease. Every part of
our company, right down to our uniforms, does good in the world. Our goal is to
help people and make money doing it. It’s a way to address two essential needs
with an action that unifies them both. 
We’ve put together a talented team of
teachers, history buffs and MBAs. With some hard work, Lisa’s business savvy,
and more importantly your support, we can make a real difference.
We need to raise $18,000 to get our
company started. This capital will enable us to cover our initial start up
costs, from strategic marketing campaigns to DC guide licenses. 
Here’s how you can help: donate to our
campaign, share our story on social media, and come on a tour.

A tour won’t save the
world but it’s a step in the right direction.Carpe Diem,Bo & Lisa 


  

Why should I help? 

Help us help the world. By
helping us achieve our goal, you are contributing to a social enterprise that
measures success in the amount of good it creates, not just profits. In fact, we
pledge to contribute a portion of our profits to three charities, including the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society and Ashoka. As a perk, our third charity will be chosen by a vote
from our top donors. We believe that our supporters should be rewarded with the
choice of what global cause we support. At the end of every year this third charity will rotate and a new one will be chosen by our community.  



We
don’t stop there. Every part of our supply chain, right down to our uniforms,
does good. We are striving to meet rigorous standards of social performance,
accountability, and transparency to attain B-Corp certification, which is a certification
from the nonprofit B Lab. Where feasible, our supply chain will be sustainable
and fair trade. We will start with our uniform for good, where each product
purchased provides a social benefit to the world. 





Is 18K enough to fund an entire tour company? 



No way. It’s
just enough to cover our initial startup costs. The $18K we need to raise with
this project will allow us to hit the ground running, ready to give our first
tour. We’ve broken down some
of the boring business costs that are necessary for our startup to succeed.  








We look
forward to reaching and even surpassing our goal with your support. What’s important is that the more we
raise the greater our impact.  Greater funds will allow us to employ more
guides, reach more people, and do more good.  You are part of
something that will continue to grow.  In the years ahead, we will expand
to other cities and find new ways of reaching people.  And it all starts
right here with you.
How can I help to start something that matters?  
1. Donate funds to the cause.
2. Share our Indiegogo campaign on social media: 
     http://igg.me/at/toursforhumanity
3. Follow and share us on:
    Facebook: toursforhumanity
    Twitter: @humanitytours
4. Come on one of our tours and rate us on Trip Advisor or Yelp.    Are there any perks?  
A perk is great but we all know that the
real reward is being a part of something that matters.  You scratch our
back and we’ll scratch yours! Here’s what you will get: 
1.  $10: Historical
fun fact
2.  $25: Digital
photo guide of DC
3.  $50: A tour
for donors only
4.  $100: T-Shirt
for humanity
5.  $250: One private
tour of choice
6.  $500: Two
private tours and a vote
7.  $1,000: All tours
and a vote
8. 
$1,000: All in and supper too
If you choose to come on
one of our tours, here’s what we offer: 


NATIONAL MALL TOUR: Washington Monument,
White House, WWII Memorial, Korean War Memorial, Vietnam Veterans Memorial, Lincoln
Memorial 
ARLINGTON NATIONAL CEMETERY TOUR: The Kennedy gravesites, the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, Arlington House ~ The Robert E. Lee Memorial, the final resting place of Pierre Charles L'Enfant, memorials to the Challenger
& Columbia Shuttle Crews, and the Mast of the USS Maine 
TIDAL BASIN TOUR: Martin Luther King, Jr.
Memorial, Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial, Thomas Jefferson Memorial, George
Mason Memorial, Japanese Cherry Blossom Trees
CAPITOL HILL TOUR: House of Representatives,
Senate, Supreme Court, Library of Congress, Capitol Building
LINCOLN
ASSASSINATION TOUR: National Theater, Ford’s Theater, Baptist Alley, Peterson
Boarding House, White House, Lafayette Square, Site of Vice President Johnson’s
Hotel, Star Saloon, US Treasury Building   Are our tours any good?   

No. They’re *!$%ing great!
We’ve already given a few tours and here’s what people are saying about us:

knows DC”

friendlier, more knowledgeable, and more patient/humorous with the kids
peppering him with questions! Walking pace is easy enough, and the kind of
unofficial info passed along really enhanced the tour.

On Friday night we did the Monuments Tour
with Bo. He was engaging, very knowledgeable, and very genuine. The tour was
well paced. It started pouring rain with about 45 minutes to go- but Bo
soldiered on- and didn't let the rain shorten our experience. (Even though he
was getting wet- after he kindly let some of our fellow tourists use his
umbrella that he had brought along!)

story:
Help Take the Clan to the Next Level 

One of the key messages we heard from gamers during past events and lan parties was the need for a Local-World-Shop to help Sicilian gamers quickly and effectively plug into their local and world gaming communities, to access support as and when they need it.

Single, multiplayer, LAN: stop in alone or bring friends for an amazing gaming party – we're probably open right now!

What We Need & What You Get

To do this, we need $50,000 to build a highly functional, user-friendly, personalized gaming centre, to buy computers, gaming consoles, and to innovate sharing gaming experience. This centre will enable Sicilian gamers to plug into the local and world gaming ecoystem. Help us!

All contributions welcome with a big Thank You from our whole creative community! T-shirt, Magnets, Clan Points to spend in the "Clan" e-Shop to buy gadgets, gaming wear, time to play, tournament accesses and much more.

How You Can Help?

  • Donate what you can - every bit counts! Let's show the power of crowd. 
  • Get the word out and make some noise! Share our crowdfunding campaign to your personal, organizational and social media networks using Indiegogo's share tools.

Aiutaci ad accelerare il progetto del "Clan"

Una delle necessità che abbiamo percepito dai nostri amici gamers è la possibilità di condividere la propria passione per il gaming a livello locale e, attraverso l'innovazione tecnologica, mondiale.

Single, multiplayer, LAN: vieni da solo o porta degli amici per dei fantastici gaming party!

Di cosa abbiamo bisogno e come possiamo ricompensarti

Per dare vita al nostro progetto abbiamo bisogno di 50.000$, da spendere in tecnologia, pc, console e allestimento di un gaming centre capace di tradurre la gaming experience in condivisione di una passione e motivo di crescita.

Tutti i contributi riceveranno un enorme "grazie", la promessa di un grandissimo impegno per realizzare il nostro progetto e, a seconda degli importi, accessori del "Clan" quali t-shirt, magneti, Clan Points da utilizzare nell'e-Shop per comprare gadget, attrezzature da gaming, ore di gioco, accesso a tornei e molto altro.

Come ci puoi aiutare.

  • Donando nell'apposita sezione di Indiegogo. Ogni cents conta. :)
  • Parla di noi. Condividi. Contribuisci a realizzare il nostro sogno.

story:
Short Summary

Balsam Hill is partnering with Pikin Padi Network this Christmas In July to help raise awareness and make an impact in poverty stricken areas of Sierra Leone.  All donations up to $1,000 will be matched 100% by Balsam Hill, and Balsam Hill will also match 10% on donations exceeding $1,000

What We Need & What You Get

The Pikin Padi Network is a community-based organization in Sierra Leone focused on promoting the well-being of children, youth, and their families by identifying and designing opportunities for their social, emotional, mental, physical, and vocational development. The organization includes three main programs: a free primary school for vulnerable children, a youth empowerment program for adolescents, and a university student scholarship program. 

For every $50 dollars donated, you will receive a mystery ornament from Balsam Hill's Mistletoe and Holly Christmas Ornament Set.  

The Impact

The Mission Statement of the Pikin Padi Network (PPN, www.pikinpadi.org) is to promote quality education for girls, boys,as well as youth, to stop child labour and violence, and to help the community to be a happy place.

Anyone who talks to the children and youth of Sierra Leone will quickly find that their top concern is whether or not they will attain education.  The desire and motivation for education are prevalent but often times poverty prevents these young people from achieving their goals. This is particularly true in the aftermath of Ebola which has increased the number of orphans and negatively affected the economy in Sierra Leone. The PPN was started by Jeff Bulanda, a visiting American Fulbright Scholar to the Sierra Leone, when he worked with local community partners to develop programs for children at risk of engaging in child labor, dropping out of school, and/or becoming victims of early marriage.

Your donation will go directly to Pikin Padi Network, with the funds raised helping to provide quality education and empowerment programs to disadvantaged children and youth in Sierra Leone. We are unique compared to other charities in that we take a "Pay It Forward" approach to helping others, whereby our beneficiaries are given opportunities to help their communities and country!


Other Ways You Can Help

For more ways to support Pikin Padi Networks - Click Here
