And perhaps you even come and visit us in Zimbabwe. Maybe even in time to come and help out with this next programme. We love welcoming friends from afar. 
Thank you!

story:
Global Cinema Platform

World's First Global Cinema Platform

Hi, my name is Cihan Atkin, Founder of the XCINEX Global Cinema Platform. I have a background in business and a great deal of passion for movies. Since 2012, we have been developing XCINEX with a mission to pioneer the first ever global cinema platform. Our mission is to revolutionize the film industry by developing a secure global platform which will instantly connect studios, from all over the world, with consumers world wide. Finally a product which will improve the film industry upgrading it to the 21st century. With the current technologies of today, we are able to develop a secure platform which will provide the luxury, comfort and convenience of watching the latest theatrical 1st run movies, direct from studios, in full HD or 3D, in the comfort, convenience and safety of home.

Our Indiegogo Campaign is extremely important because it gives our potential members, "the people", an opportunity to take part in making history. As we pioneer the global cinema platform, your support is very important. With your contributions, XCINEX will come on step closer to success. 

What's Next

In order to take XCINEX to the next level, we need you to support the XCINEX Revolution! A finalized system is required to show content providers that the XCINEX Audience Detection Sensor is unmistakably accurate and that content uploaded to the platform is completely secure. To achieve this task within the timeline we have set and successfully launch the XCINEX Platform by December 25, 2015; we are looking to raise, in our first round of funding, $155,000 through crowd-funding. Our goal is to raise $3 Million Dollars within the next 12 months through various funding campaigns. Rather than running one single campaign for the entire amount of $3M, we've decided to take things step by step utilizing numerous funding platforms, with smaller funding goals, to reach our milestones. Funds will be used to perfect the XCINEX Audience Detection Sensor making audience detection fool-proof and finalizing the Global Cinema Platform by developing and fine-tuning its full spectrum of operational functions, features and communication with other devices. Already, the XCINEX Prototype version 1.0 is 85% accurate with audience detection.

To ensure the highest quality of product development, we plan to bring on highly experienced software developers, electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, application developers and kernel engineers into our existing, extremely passionate and highly capable core team. Funds will also be used to purchase parts & hardware, research & development, beta testings as well as advertising to increase and maintain a steady membership growth. Once the final product is complete, funds will be used to travel and meet with studios to present them the XCINEX Global Cinema Platform. By demonstrating its ingenious security features and fool-proof audience detection sensor capability, XCINEX will obtain content commitments. XCINEX will increase the revenue of studios tremendously giving them instant 24/7 access to hundreds of millions of consumers world wide. This is impossible to do with brick and mortar theaters.  

If we are not able to reach our entire Indiegogo funding goal, XCINEX can use the contributions we have successfully obtained to keep moving forward as we continue to seek funding through other avenues. This is our main reason for choosing the option for flexible funding. XCINEX is evolution and it is unstoppable! This is the natural progression of the market as internet becomes faster, more readily available and home entertainment technologies become more enhanced. We are on the right track to pioneer a single, secure, global platform to upgrade entertainment to the next level and finally eradicate content piracy costing the industry billions of dollars in losses.

The Impact of XCINEX

As the first global cinema platform, XCINEX has a tremendously beneficial impact on the film industry as well as consumers worldwide. XCINEX provides a level playing field for all production companies, major and independent, to instantly reach mass audiences world wide. Consumers all over the world can instantly access content and studios can get the most recognition and value for their work. Until now, going to a movie theater and catching a showtime was your only option to watch 1st run movies in optimal quality. After about a week of the theatrical release, you can get illegal torrents from online with terrible audio/video quality. Couple weeks more, you can buy a pirated copy of the movie with so-so audio/video quality with subtitles you don't need and probably can't remove. By the way, this is an illegal act which we do not condone and are working to eliminate. A couple more weeks and the movie is now available on Netflix, DVD or illegally online. Well, XCINEX provides instant satisfaction and removes the need for consumers to settle for pirated content or endure the long wait between theatrical release and DVD releases.   


With the XCINEX Platform, studios will upload their latest content onto a secure platform for everyone to enjoy instantly. With an audience detection sensor, studios have no risk of losing revenue because just like the theater, each person watching the movie is required to have a ticket. In fact, studies show that XCINEX will increase 1st run, DVD and Soundtrack revenue for studios. Working with some of the best in the industry, XCINEX also eradicates piracy utilizing numerous technologies designed specifically to ensure digital content security. Finally, a product designed specifically for the film industry with both the studios and the consumers in mind. XCINEX also offers studios a fixed 90% of each ticket sale for as long as the content is on the platform. This is much better than the sliding scale used in the industry today.    

XCINEX Members world wide will have the luxury of streaming first run movies, direct from studios from all over the world, in full HD or 3D, right to the comfort of their homes. Grab your favorite drink, order your pizza, slip into your favorite PJ's, sit or lay on your own couch and enjoy the latest 1st run movie. Need a break? Pause the movie or save it to watch it later. XCINEX works on many devices anywhere with high-speed internet. Enjoy the latest motion picture entertainment on your TV, tablet or phone. Access the XCINEX Platform from your home, RV, yacht or vacation cabin. XCINEX is perfect for commercial application as well bringing 1st run movies to hotel rooms, hospitals, dorm rooms pretty much any location with internet. Remember, each person in the room must purchase a ticket so studios never risk losing revenue!  


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in many ways! Get the word out and let everyone know that XCINEX is moving forward to revolutionize the film industry by pioneering a global cinema platform. Sign Up and become a members through the XCINEX website and remember membership is always FREE! Connect with us through our social media accounts and stay informed of our progress. Share our website URL as well as the URL to our Indiegogo Campaign so everyone can have the opportunity to contribute as we pioneer the first global cinema platform. Join the XCINEX Revolution and let's make history together!

remove. By the way, this is an illegal act which we do not condone and are working to eliminate. A couple
more weeks and the movie is now available on Netflix, DVD or illegally online. Well, XCINEX provides instant satisfaction and removes the need for consumers to settle for pirated content or endure the long wait between theatrical release and DVD releases.   

With the XCINEX Platform, studios will upload their latest content onto a
secure platform for everyone to enjoy instantly. With an audience detection
sensor, studios have no risk of losing revenue because just like the theater,
each person watching the movie is required to have a ticket. In fact, studies show that XCINEX will increase 1st run, DVD and Soundtrack revenue for studios. Working with some
of the best in the industry, XCINEX also eradicates piracy utilizing numerous
technologies designed specifically to ensure digital content security. Finally, a
product designed specifically for the film industry with both the studios and
the consumers in mind. XCINEX also offers studios a fixed 90% of each ticket sale for as long as the content is on the platform. This is much better than the sliding scale used in the industry today.    
XCINEX Members world wide will have the luxury of streaming first run movies,
direct from studios from all over the world, in full HD or 3D, right to the comfort
of their homes. Grab your favorite drink, order your pizza, slip into your favorite PJ's, sit or lay on your own couch and enjoy the latest 1st run movie. Need a break? Pause the movie or save it to watch it later. XCINEX works on many devices anywhere with
high-speed internet. Enjoy the latest motion picture entertainment on your TV,
tablet or phone. Access the XCINEX Platform from your home, RV, yacht or vacation cabin. XCINEX is perfect for commercial application as well bringing 1st run movies to hotel
rooms, hospitals, dorm rooms pretty much any location with internet. Remember, each person in the room must purchase a ticket so studios never risk losing revenue!  Other Ways You Can HelpYou can help in many ways! Get the word out and let everyone know that XCINEX is moving forward to revolutionize the film industry by pioneering a global cinema platform. Sign Up and become a members through the XCINEX website and remember membership is always FREE! Connect with us through our social media accounts and stay informed of our progress. Share our website URL as well as the URL to our Indiegogo Campaign so everyone can have the opportunity to contribute as we pioneer the first global cinema platform. Join the XCINEX Revolution and let's make history together!

story:
Our Story:   We are looking to open a group home for orphans from Mexico and Central America in the United States. These children will have the option for a "forever home" or to use our house as a transistion to a permanent home.

We are in the process of forming a non-profit organization and funding the purchase of a 5 acre ranch.

The Impact:  We will offer these children a home with a family to love and grow up with, school support, art programs, performing arts, recreation and sports, life skills development, counseling and pet therapy. The home we are looking to purchase has a large private yard for playing outside safely, a swimming pool, an area for llamas and barnyard animals, gardening, and other outdoor activities.

The impact we can have in the future is to love and nurture the "whole child" and teach them the skills they need to become productive adults in our society. 

We have the education and experience to make something wonderful happen for "broken" children who have lost their families, and pray that the right people cross our path and offer assistance. We welcome anyone who wants to sponsor or get involved with our dream.

On behalf of the children we will help, thank you.

Yay for the kids! 

Other Ways You Can Help:  Please get the word out about our campaign by sharing with your friends through word of mouth, email, and by using the "share" tools!.

story:
The ski industry has been taken over by Big Business.

Conglomerates and private equity firms with no connection to local communities have bought up ski areas large and small, while many community-based mountains have closed. Lift ticket prices have gone through the roof, making snow sports inaccessible for many. Urban sprawl in our mountain towns is degrading the natural environment while a select few make a large profit. 

We want to offer an alternative!

 

Who We Are

Mountain Rider’s Alliance is a group of passionate snow enthusiasts dedicated to making a positive change in the ski industry by supporting mountain communities and being more sensitive to the environment. We want to bring the triple bottom line of people, planet, then profit to the ski industry. We believe riding is more than a sport, but rather a way of life.

MRA is creating or converting values-based, environmentally friendly, rider-centric Mountain Playgrounds around the world. Our model will help local businesses prosper, create renewable energy and offer an authentic skiing experience.

MRA's Triple Bottom Line Business Model

 

Why Should You Support MRA?

You love community.

You want ski areas to support their local economies and preserve the individual character of ski towns. You want skiers to have a voice in how their ski areas operates. You want your ski area to partner with non profits to make the world a better place. 

You love the environment.

You want ski areas to reduce their fossil fuel dependence, harness renewable energy techniques and lower their footprint. You love snow and the mountains, and want them preserved for future generations.

You love skiing.  

You are not concerned about time-shares, out-of-boot amenities, or overpriced lift tickets. You want affordable uphill transportation with the emphasis on skiing and riding. 

Matt Reardon on Manitoba Mountain, Alaska

 

What Do We Need?

Our grassroots organization has been bootstrapping for over two years. We have made an enormous amount of progress without any operating capital. Recently, the first round of seed investors has contributed to support our global vision. Now we are now seeking additional funds to move forward from concept to reality.

Two ski areas are ready to become the world's first Mountain Playgrounds, with many more to follow. You can make that happen.

 

How Can You Help?

Donate: Your contributions will have a direct impact on moving our plans forward and, more importantly, support the sustainable future of skiing and riding.

Represent: Wear your MRA attire with pride and spread the good word!

Share: Like us on Facebook. Follow us on Twitter.

 

Meet the Leadership Team

Director of Finance and Development Pete Blanchard graduated from Duke with honors, worked a stint on Wall Street, and recently received his masters in Sustainable Business from Presidio Graduate School. His ability to speak in "financial talk" is a key piece of the team. As a long-time member of the pro leisure tour, Buddy Pete's gifted ability to put the team's ideas on paper makes him our three-time returning MVP.

Project Manager Dave Scanlan is a jack of many trades. Over the years he has been known as Tele Dave, No Poles Dave, Bumping Dave, Hippie Dave, and Tie-Dye Dave. As chairman of his local Land Use Advisory Planning Commission on Alaska's Kenai Peninsula, Dave's ability to eloquently discuss the finer details is top notch. His work ethic and attention to detail are in a league of their own. He would like nothing more than to create more cool places to ski.

CEO Jamie Schectman has been around the block a time or two. He is the guy who keeps everything organized and everyone moving forward. He comes from an entrepreneurial background and isn't afraid to try new things by challenging the status quo. As a self-proclaimed change agent and global ski bum, "Shecky's" ultimate goal is to create the job of product tester at MRA Mountain Playgrounds around the world.

MRA has over 50 active team members from 6 different countries contributing to our grassroots organization, and has recruited an imressive group of advisory board members, bringing a diverse wealth of knowledge to our collaboration.

story:
Check the Updates to:

  • See a mobile unit in action
  • Find out how it works
  • Watch and share our viral video

WHO ARE WE?

We are Nebulous Technologies. Mike has been a designer and entrepreneur for 30 years. Jonathan makes games and apps for mobile devices. We've been working together on a project for the past 5 years in our spare time.

WHAT IS OUR IDEA?

Our starting point was the observation that all animatronic ('robot') toys on the market were without exception boring, predictable and inane. We set out to change that by asking the question: If mobile animatronic toys could talk to each other, what would they say, and what would they do?

Well, they could share data about their environment, they could learn from each other, they could develop adaptive behaviours, and collaborate to achieve objectives which are impossible individually.

WHAT HAVE WE DONE?

We have developed a small, cheap wireless device (patent pending) which, inserted into any animatronic toy design, enables such toys to form social groups spontaneously and provides dynamic spatial awareness. The device is user-programmable, providing full control of all the toy's features in the context of shared data, and therefore infinite variation of personality and capability.

The working title of this technology has been CUI, but we know that's lame. Get involved and help us come up with a better name!

WHAT IS OUR PLAN?

We intend to sell this device in large quantities to major toy manufacturers.

But applying this device to EXISTING animtronic toys barely scratches the surface of its potential applications. This technology gives rise to an entirely new genre of animatronic products where socialization, collaboration and dynamic spatial awareness are central to the design.

Any product built around this technology can be responsive, adaptive and unpredictable to its human user. And these capabilities multiply exponentially when many toys interact with each other, and with their human users.

The opportunities for end-user-programmability are substantial, and applications extend well beyond entertainment.

WHAT DOES THE FUTURE HOLD?

Imagine, for instance, an animatronic puppy dog which follows you around wherever you go (sometimes even when you tell him not to), who will mimic your movements, learn the tricks you try to teach him, and play fetching a ball, or hide-and-seek, with you if you ask nicely. A puppy dog who is just as happy to amuse himself, to gambol and play hide-and-seek or ball games with other puppy dogs, and who will also take himself off for a nap in his basket when he gets tired.

Imagine a squadron of six animatronic tanks attacking an enemy position over any terrain you care to construct. You decide your battle plan, but it may have to be torn up soon after engagement with the enemy begins. Your friend will have his own plan on how to deploy his squadron of tanks to defend the position, and he may have decided on a pre-emptive strike. Battle orders are delivered to the squadron by mobile app or PC, but then they’re on their own and anything could happen.

Imagine intelligent spatially-aware inter-communicating toy weapons in the hands of a human operator, fighting with other humans in a squad against either an animatronic enemy or a similarly empowered human enemy, and you have the makings of a new participation sport.

Imagine how powerfully the web can be used to share experiences, videos, ideas and end-user-developed software.

WORLD DOMINATION?

This is a mass market technology. By Christmas 2015 we want all of the most popular animatronic toys world-wide to be enpowered to reach their full potential.

WHAT DO WE NEED THIS MONEY FOR?

This project has been a labour of love for many years. We put food on our table by other means, and have devoted all our spare time and money to get the idea to this stage. 

What we need now is to move to the production engineering stage so that we can manufacture the device in large quantities. We will establish a worldwide standard so that we can guarantee the inter-operation of all devices powered by it. Imagine your dinosaur playing with your tank, and puppy and helicopter...

To be absolutely clear, none of the money raised will go on anything except getting to the production engineering stage. We will continue to earn money for food and bills with day jobs, and even running costs and expenses for Nebulous Technologies we're pay for out of our own pockets.

The goal of $24,000 is what we need to get most of the way there. If we get more, then we have loads of plans for how we can make it a bigger success. If we get less, then we can still do it, but we know it's going to take longer and be less effective.

WHAT CAN YOU DO?

We want you to get involved, contribute if you can, and above all spread the word if you think toys deserve better.

story:
Who Are We?

The Sleepless Goat Cafe and restaurant is a workers' cooperative located downtown in Kingston, Ontario. Transformed into a cooperative in 2000, The Goat has spent the last 12 years serving healthy, homemade food and fairtrade, organic coffee to the Kingston community. As one of Kingstons only vegetarian-friendly restaurants, the Goat strives to maintain an open, inclusive, and safe space for everyone. In addtion, we also provide soup and baked goods at no charge for anyone who asks. We believe everyone deserves access to healthy, affordable food and we work diligently to provide the community with just that.

 


Revitalization Campaign
At present, the Sleepless Goat is seeking support from the community to help continue the revitalization of our space. As many of our customers are aware, we have undergone significant renovations in the past months, and we are looking to further improve our space in the coming months.

The money raised during the Revitalization Campaign will be used to acquire new equipment, as well as continue with several renovations already underway.
Some immediate concerns are:


1) Blenders: We are looking to purchase two new commercial blenders in order to make blended drinks- especially smoothies, which are popular during the summer months. Commercial blenders cost in the area of $600.00 each, and at least two will be necessary for effective and efficient service.
2) Washrooms: Our washrooms were renovated at the beginning of the year, however, we recognize that further improvements are necessary. Donated funds will be put towards labour and materials to repair both washrooms.
3) Storefront Sign: The front sign above our entrance is in a rather weathered condition, and needs to be repaired. We would like to restore it to its former glory, with hopes that the improved aesthetic will draw attention to our business.

If money is raised above and beyond our goal, we have many other items that need to be purchased, such as:


- a new cappuccino machine- for faster service and better coffee.
- a POS system- will enable us to better track sales and adapt quickly to customer preferences, as well as directly send orders to the kitchen which will save time.
- repairs to the front entrance- first impressions are important!

 

We thank you for you interest and support, and look forward to continuing to serve you in the future!

 

Love,

the Goats <3

 

Update: Day 2

Thanks for the amazing show of support everyone- we are off to an incredible start!! Be sure to leave a comment with your thoughts/suggestions, as we alway want to hear what you think about us and our Revitalization Campaign. More pictures to come, and hopefully a video! And if YOU have any photo's of the Goat, feel free to send them to revitalize@thegoat.ca

Day 6

Support is still coming in- thanks everyone!! We added some larger perk options for those interested! Also, our staff have donated almost $3000 of their own money towards the continued operation of the Goat. So let's keep up the good work!

 

Day 9

We had some incredibly generous folks donate to us in the past day- in addition to the dozens of generous people who have contributed so far! A huge thanks to everyone!! We are half way there, with 21 days to go. Our goal is well within reach, with your support. Thanks everyone, and please spread the word!

 

Day 14

It is looking good, everyone- with over two weeks left, we are less than $300 away!! We have all been truly amazed by the support we have received, both financially and otherwise. Again, thank you everyone, and I hope to make another update soon letting you know we've reached our goal- so stay tuned!

 

Day 15

We have reached out goal- and then some! Everyone here is amazed at how quickly it happened, and we are looking forward to getting our new projects underway this summer. But we have 15 days left- let's see how above and beyond we can go! Thanks everyone!!

 

FOUR DAYS LEFT!!

We are almost at the finish line, folks!! We have reached our goal- but let's see if we can go further- spread the word!! Thanks everyone for helping us get this far!

-------

The End!

THANK YOU!! We could NOT have done it without your help!!

story:
Short Summary

We are Bakersfield Burrito Project

  • We go into the community and feed the hungry and the homeless. We do this without requiring anything of the people we help. No song or dance, just take the food, water or clothing and we ask for nothing in return.
  • Every Sunday afternoon, we meet at Weill Park on the corner of James and Q Street, assemble burritos from rice, beans, tortillas, cheese (and whatever else is donated that week). People can come to the park, grab a burrito, a bottle of water, and go through whatever donations are available at that time to take with them.
  • After the burritos are assembled, we go into the community and hand deliver the food to places we know where people need it. The homeless, the down-and-out, the addicted, the helpless.
  • Every Sunday takes about three hours to assemble, and deliver the food we collect through the week.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to get our 501(3)(c)

  • $500 dollars will help us get through all the processes and paperwork that is needed to file the paperwork to get our non-profit status.
  • Once we gain our non-profit status, we can request bigger donations from companies and other non-profits that concentrate on helping people in the community. This means being able to solicit donations toward establishing a soup kitchen, or a catering truck to better deliver food into the community.
  • If we do not reach our goal, all money will be used to purchase more food. Bulk beans, bulk rice goes a long way, and can be stored indefinately until we need it. Please be generous with your donations, for if we go over our goal, we can also use the excess money for food and water.
  • What do you get? The warm, happy feeling that you are using your money to help a group help local people. Every penny stays within the community in food purchases, and not a red cent goes into any of the members pockets. We use everything to fund feeding people who need food, water and clothing.

The Impact

Please keep in mind the following:

  • Non-profit status allows us to collect bigger donations. Bigger donations mean more opportunities to aid people in need. We can also solicit other non-profits, like food banks or other agencies that will aid in clothing or hygiene kits.
  • We have worked within the community for over three years. Every Sunday, we hand out over 100 burritos directly to the people who need them. We have received local coverage in the newspaper, the radio, and television. A google search for Bakersfield Burrito Project will show the dozens of news articles showing our work.
  • Even if we don't reach the goal, any donation helps. $5 buys 5 pounds of beans, 10 pounds of rice, 2 dozen tortillas. If three people donate $5, those three people feed 40 people. Three people refer three other people who give $5, the impact of feeding the hungry becomes tangible. Join us!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can make a financial contribution. But there are lots of other ways you can help!

  • Spread this campaign through the Internet and get it to people who can make a contribution.
  • A bag of dried beans. A bag of dried rice. A dozen burrito sized tortillas. A bag of cheese. A case of water. Bring it out to the park and drop it off.
  • Come out to the corner of James and Q Streets on Sunday, around noon. You can put your hands into the rice and beans and torillas and help assemble burritos yourself. Or meet after all the burritos are built, and take a bag of them to spread to people you know are hungry. Hand them out.
  • Go through your closet and get rid of the old clothes you no longer wear, no longer fit into. Bag them and bring them to the corner of James and Q Street and watch people gratefully take what you can no longer use.
  • Come on out to the park on the corner of James and Q Street and tell us we're doing a good job. Every Sunday, we do have a lot of fun. Join us!
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are Bakersfield Burrito Project

We go into the community and feed the hungry and the homeless. We do this without requiring anything of the people we help. No song or dance, just take the food, water or clothing and we ask for nothing in return.
Every Sunday afternoon, we meet at Weill Park on the corner of James and Q Street, assemble burritos from rice, beans, tortillas, cheese (and whatever else is donated that week). People can come to the park, grab a burrito, a bottle of water, and go through whatever donations are available at that time to take with them.
After the burritos are assembled, we go into the community and hand deliver the food to places we know where people need it. The homeless, the down-and-out, the addicted, the helpless.
Every Sunday takes about three hours to assemble, and deliver the food we collect through the week.

What We Need & What You Get


We need to get our 501(3)(c)

$500 dollars will help us get through all the processes and paperwork that is needed to file the paperwork to get our non-profit status.
Once we gain our non-profit status, we can request bigger donations from companies and other non-profits that concentrate on helping people in the community. This means being able to solicit donations toward establishing a soup kitchen, or a catering truck to better deliver food into the community.
If we do not reach our goal, all money will be used to purchase more food. Bulk beans, bulk rice goes a long way, and can be stored indefinately until we need it. Please be generous with your donations, for if we go over our goal, we can also use the excess money for food and water.
What do you get? The warm, happy feeling that you are using your money to help a group help local people. Every penny stays within the community in food purchases, and not a red cent goes into any of the members pockets. We use everything to fund feeding people who need food, water and clothing.



The Impact
Please keep in mind the following:

Non-profit status allows us to collect bigger donations. Bigger donations mean more opportunities to aid people in need. We can also solicit other non-profits, like food banks or other agencies that will aid in clothing or hygiene kits.
We have worked within the community for over three years. Every Sunday, we hand out over 100 burritos directly to the people who need them. We have received local coverage in the newspaper, the radio, and television. A google search for Bakersfield Burrito Project will show the dozens of news articles showing our work.
Even if we don't reach the goal, any donation helps. $5 buys 5 pounds of beans, 10 pounds of rice, 2 dozen tortillas. If three people donate $5, those three people feed 40 people. Three people refer three other people who give $5, the impact of feeding the hungry becomes tangible. Join us!



Other Ways You Can Help
We understand not everyone can make a financial contribution. But there are lots of other ways you can help!

Spread this campaign through the Internet and get it to people who can make a contribution.
A bag of dried beans. A bag of dried rice. A dozen burrito sized tortillas. A bag of cheese. A case of water. Bring it out to the park and drop it off.
Come out to the corner of James and Q Streets on Sunday, around noon. You can put your hands into the rice and beans and torillas and help assemble burritos yourself. Or meet after all the burritos are built, and take a bag of them to spread to people you know are hungry. Hand them out.
Go through your closet and get rid of the old clothes you no longer wear, no longer fit into. Bag them and bring them to the corner of James and Q Street and watch people gratefully take what you can no longer use.
Come on out to the park on the corner of James and Q Street and tell us we're doing a good job. Every Sunday, we do have a lot of fun. Join us!

story:
Our Story

We are Agora Collective; a platform that empowers individuals through multi-disciplinary collaborative creation, a gathering space of professionals, driven by the urge to explore new ways of interaction and collaboration in todayâ€™s context. We are dedicated on creating intelligent forms of producing, working and living - artistically, socially and economically.

Our approach to this is looking at the process and not just the final product. Seeking the balance between individuality and collectivity.

Not only an airport of ideas; making bridges, connecting talented and engaged people. Agora is also an incubator; developing and supporting artistical, social, environmental and economical projects.

The Impact

We are re-designing the present.

Concentrating on solutions instead of on problems, Agoraâ€™s mission is to re-think ways of relating to working and living in our actual context. In the process of multidisciplinary co-creation we try to come to creative solutions on actual issues.

And hope to reach as many people as we can with our projects. The impact is making a step forward, together, in a time that its hardly needed. We have been working with what we have, and plan on continuing doing this, but we are growing fast and need the financial support in this moment to keep up with this growth in a healthy way.

What We Need & What You Get

Basically what we are asking for is two months of our rent. Rent that is really weighing on our shoulders and making it hard for us to move forward. We are asking for financial help to give us some more breathing space. So you are directly helping us finance our ideas and keep this space going.


Our ongoing projects:
Currently we are working on several projects including:

Agora Business Incubation Program is a new business incubation program in Berlin focusing on aiding Innovative Social, Educational and Sustainable startups to develop their ideas into functioning businesses.

Agora Residency Program aims to provide an opportunity for creative development in
all areas of the arts.
The program facilitates comfortable studios, living spaces, contact with Berlin based artists and Agoraâ€™s active community offering discussions, media exposure and the opportunity for creative development in a thriving collective environment.

CSA project
Community Supported Agriculture consists of a community of individuals who pledge support to a farm operation so that the farmland becomes, either legally or spiritually, the community's farm, with the growers and consumers providing mutual support and sharing the risks and benefits of food production.

Helping us does not mean only in a financial way, we hope you can see the cause of this, exchange ideas with us and who knows, be part of this movement. Your help means a lot to us and we will try to show this gratitude in the best possible way, so please, check out our perks, and if you just want to contribute in a smaller way, every dollar counts. The idea is that we do this together with as many people as we can reach!

Other Ways You Can Help

As mentioned earlier in this text, not only financial help is needed. Spreading the word of this project is a big help on itself. Maybe you have a good piece of knowledge, a great contact or are willing to share your network with us to spread the word!

story:
Solar Lights for Haiti

In 2007 I came up with an idea that I thought would change the world and maybe its still not to late. I invented and patented a product called a solar sign light:

My name is Thomas Meyers the inventor of Sslite.

I want to turn what was a financial disaster for me into something that can help people living in a real life natural disaster in Haiti. Instead of looking at these things everyday feeling sorry for myself and wondering what if I did this or that differently, I just want to give them to people in need. I am doing it to put it all behind me. The whole Sslite project was a disaster. It cost me my home at the time and nearly my marriage. I want to turn what’s left into beacons of hope for people I have never met and at the same time help me to heal

By donating to this cause or by purchasing a solar sign light you will help people living in the dark. As Americans we really don’t know what dark is. I can go out my front door at midnight and because there are street lights and porch lights it never really gets dark. Just the ambient light from metro Atlanta reflecting off the atmosphere makes it less than dark. Please help me help others out of the dark.

Make a donation to help people living without out power or lights in the poorest part of the world. All I ask is to help with shipping, I will donate 850 solar lights.  

 

I need to raise $8500

That is $10 to ship 850 sign lights to people in Haiti:

  • The funding is going directly to shipping cost!
  • For every light you purchase I will ship 2 free Haiti!
  • Not only will you be helping people living in the dark but help me feel like I did not do all of this for nothing.

The Impact will be felt

We are so blessed in this country. Even the people struck by Sandy have begun to see things starting to improve. Little by little streets are being cleared and power is coming back on. In Haiti nothing has changed and nothing will change in any time soon if ever. Just imagine what that must feel like?

I don’t know a better way donate $10 than this.

If you have any doubt about my sincerity or my product please visit www.uspto.gov and search my patent number 7,357,527.

Help me turn my financial disaster into helping others deal with a natural disaster.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are not able to contribute please help by posting this on your facebook page, twitter or anything else to spread the word:
  • Please help me spread the light and get the word out.
  • Indiegogo has some really great share tools that I would like to ask you to use!

Thanks again for your support.

story:
Giant Leap of Faith!

I am a small business owner of a photographic services company in Virginia Beach, VA. A career in the arts has always been my dream.  It wasn't until my family lost the most amazing woman that this planet has ever known, that I realized how important photographs are to the memory. 


After working in serveral portrait studios, for several different companies, they all had one thing in common.  SALES.  Finally, I gained the confidence, took a giant leap of faith, and started working on my business full-time in February.  I have made it my goal to never turn any family or couple away because of a tight budget.  Now that I have built a steady clientele; consisting of wonderful, supportive, return customers, it is time to upgrade my equipment and provide them with better quality images!


I started this "Indiegogo" campaign in search of funds for better quality equipment to service the largest military community in the world!  These people deserve it!  There is no feeling greater than providing tears of joy for a 80 year old man's birthday or a mother or father overseas getting to be a part of their child's first birthday!

The Break-Down

Here is a "Reader's Digest" version of the shopping cart of neccessary tools my company needs to make it all happen.  My poor 8 year old camera is in need of a replacement and to best service my clientele, purchasing the Canon 5D Mark ii is of the upmost importance. Along with that, a 50 mm lense to provide the best portraits, a wide-angle lense for those wonderful weddings, and a fish-eye lense for those fun, creative shots.  Also, on the list are new lights and a backdrop or two, in order to decrease costs of studio rentals. 


The equipment above will cost just under $10,000 for everything. The remaining will be used for flyers and promotions for my upcoming Family Portrait Month in October. A portion of the preceeds from all family sessions in October will be donated to Operation Smile!

Your Impact

Your contribution will go towards solidifying memories for all types of families in beautiful, quality portraits.  You are also helping a small business support our troops and charities! 
 
If you cannot contribute anything today, that doesn't mean you can't help!  Please pass this along to all of your friends and family! 
 
Thank you for all of your support!

story:
About me

Hello, I am Tereza, a brazilian, living between California and Bahia, on a property called Paraiso Verde (www.casaparaisoverde.com)

 

Bahia is located on the east coast of Brasil, right below the Equator. For the past thirty years my family and I have owned this property. Years ago we had our amazing artist friends like Keith Haring, Tseng Kwong Chi, Kenny Scharf, Bruno Schmidt, Steve Muller, come to the house and enjoy and make art. This is such an inspiring place, and it has become a treasure for artists and those who love and appreciate art and nature.

We have eight amazing structures built on the land. As the global community is going through a fine tuning, we see the need for a communal safe space that can be used by artists, teachers, and healers. We want to make an educational environment geared toward bringing back the consciousness of the mind, using art therapies (movement, visual art, music) to create brighter and wiser human beings. It has been proven that human beings must be creative to feel complete. Around Paraiso Verde, the main concern of the community is to survive on a daily basis. They are not aware of their own creativity. Creating a space will bring back the community awareness to the region and the spark and joy of life that creativity brings.

 What is an OCA?

An oca is a typical type of habitat/ living space of indigenous people. They are typically built collectively with the help of several members of the tribe. They are usually quite big, reaching up to 40 meters. This is so many different families can live there together. There are no divisions or separations in the oca. The structure of the ocas are very resilient being that they are made of bamboo and tree trunks. A well made oca structure can last over 20 years. 

OBJECTIVE

• to build a natural structure (OCAS) with the natural materials from the surroundings; Bio Construction is a model for 0 impact over the environment

• to provide a lodge and environment for the locals and for the community abroad to learn and share alternative ways to improve the environment and life in a sustainable way, using art as “the way”

 • to create a space that facilitates the merging of traditions and practices of Brazilian and International art with the rest of the world, that better the environment and the quality of life;

• to create a space and the best atmosphere for healing the mind, body and spirit thru art, culture;

• to build an art center that actively creates alternatives and responses to the global problems of the area, bringing education and promoting solutions. 

 

The Budget 

MAIN OCA ROOF: $10,000.00

MAIN OCA FLOOR: $6,000.00

MAIN OCA DECK: $2,700.00

KITCHEN: $3,700.00

BATHROOM: $3,000.00

LABOR: $10,000.00

TOTAL= $35,400.00

This is exactly what we need the funds for. Once this structure is built it can be a positive part of the community. It can also be used for you to come visit and be apart of the healing, art experience!

 

The Impact

For the past 4 years that I have been living in Brasil, I noticed the need for a space where we can facilitate events that integrate work of expansion of consciousness through art therapy, including body work (dance, yoga, functional exercise), visual arts (paint, sculpture, fashion), and music (harmonization, percussion, singing, performing). This is a place that can be done in nature, as the cities has become overcrowded and full of stress. This OCA will provide a safe enviroment where local and international artists, teachers and healers can come and share their knowledge, improving people’s life and lifestyle in many different ways.

 Back in 1995 Kenny Scharf and I raised about U$ 800.000 to bring awareness to the Amazon Rainforest, with a benefit called Don't Bungle the Jungle. 

By making a donation you will join us on the journey to create a structure to raise people’s awareness of their higher self through art, and ultimately creating a better world for all of us collectively. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation now please help us spread the word and make this project a reality. 

Thank you!

story:
The Story of Urban Run Club

Back in 2008 a few friends got together with the bright idea of forming a community running group, fit for all ages, shapes, and different. Here we are 4 years later and we are still running. We didn't really think we would last this long when we started, but here we are. Our daily goal is to inspire people to live healthier lives through exercise and being actively visible in our neighborhoods. Yes we are Urban Run Club, however we support all types of activity. Running, walking, healthy eating, camping, kayaking, hiking, anything to get us moving is on the list including dancing. Join our one song dance party every Friday at 11 am where ever you are to get your heart rate up and oxygen moving head to toe. 

As the organizer, I have participated in many different types of races, some short distances, some team races, and loads of fun neighborhood races. in talking to a great number of our run club members I have started to hear a good number of our runners state they would love to do particular races, but the races cost too much money. I myself slacked off a steady race calendar because I realized those race bibs add up at the end of the year and it wasn't always been in my budget, so I understand other run club members when they share their honest feed back about their light race calendars.

By reaching our goal we will take 24 racers to 3 different races to challenge themselves in ways they may have never dreamed about. All three races are multi day events and require lots of planning and more funds than your average neighborhood 5k. The lasting memories and the feeling of great accomplishment will forever be on the list of some of the best experiences to date for most of the team members.

What We Need & What You Get

So, here is where your help comes in. We need $5500. Race registration is $2840 for three races, the remaining $2660 is part of what it cost to make the race actually happen...rent vans, hotel rooms, van supplies, gas for vans, and other small cost. We have organized many teams before and the calculations are spot on.   Just think, you might look up in your town and see a pack of smiling runners and a walker or two and say to yourself, "I helped make this happen!" make sure you check out the perks!

Here are links to the races:

http://www.gulfcoastinterstaterelay.com/

http://www.ragnartrail.com/

http://www.rockcreek.com/stagerace.rco

 

Why Does This Matter?

Urban Run Club has always been a free running group to join. Over the years we have attracted thousands of runners from the Metro Atlanta area.  We have staged our own free race. We have been very successful with only missing 3 Tuesdays in 4 years (Due to ice on the ground and 2 lightning storms.) We have consistently provided support to runners during races. We want to help a hand full of people feel the joy of the race. A race they may have never been able to join.

At the end of the day, by supporting this campaign will help a number of racers enter races the can not afford to run. Just because you may not have seen any of these runners take first place in races, they still run hard and are dedicated to living healthy and this always earns reward. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can not give does not mean you can't help. Tell your friends, family, co-workers, church members, neighbors and strangers about our campaign. Spreading the word is a huge help.

We have organized many teams before and the calculations are spot on.   Just think, you might look up in your town and see a pack of smiling runners and a walker or two and say to yourself, "I helped make this happen!" make sure you check out the perks!
Here are links to the races:
http://www.gulfcoastinterstaterelay.com/
http://www.ragnartrail.com/
http://www.rockcreek.com/stagerace.rco
 
Why Does This Matter?
Urban Run Club has always been a free running group to join. Over the years we have attracted thousands of runners from the Metro Atlanta area.  We have staged our own free race. We have been very successful with only missing 3 Tuesdays in 4 years (Due to ice on the ground and 2 lightning storms.) We have consistently provided support to runners during races. We want to help a hand full of people feel the joy of the race. A race they may have never been able to join.
At the end of the day, by supporting this campaign will help a number of racers enter races the can not afford to run. Just because you may not have seen any of these runners take first place in races, they still run hard and are dedicated to living healthy and this always earns reward. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Just because you can not give does not mean you can't help. Tell your friends, family, co-workers, church members, neighbors and strangers about our campaign. Spreading the word is a huge help.

story:
Mobile technology is integrated into everyday life all over the world; Help us show people how to make the most of it!

We are organizing a workshop and hackathon that’s going to take place during the 5th International Conference on Appropriate Technology in Pretoria, South Africa in late November.

The goal of the workshop is to give participants an introduction to mobile tech applications that enable new approaches to issues such as urban and community planning, economics and markets, political participation, and personal and environmental health.  We want participants to leave with ideas of what’s possible and what some of the successes and pitfalls people have experienced are.

Ultimately, we want to get workshop participants interested in incorporating mobile tech into their own appropriate technology work. We'll arm them with information about projects that we (the organizers and panel presenters) and others have done, and also give them practice in constructing a project idea and working with mobile developers during a hackathon to start to bring it to life.

What We Need & What We'll Do

We need funding to cover several aspects of these events:

  • We want to bring workshop presentors and facilitators who represent a variety of project areas and target users.  We need about $2400 for travel and lodging.
  • The rest of the funds will go toward video documentation production, and hackathon operational expenses -- materials, meals, and awards.

If we don't reach our entire goal, funds will first go toward travel for the workshop presenters.  Facilitating a good workshop experience is highest on our priority list.

From these events, we are going to produce:

  • A website cataloging the ideas and applications developed as a part of the workshop and hackathon. The site will also contains detailed information about the proceedings during the workshop and the hackathon.
  • If we surpass $4000 we will also produce a video documenting the workshop and hackathon.
  • All donors from $25 up will be listed in the credits on the site. Donors at the $100 level also get special mention in our workshop materials.
  • Funders over $500 will receive their name and logo of choosing in a dedicated space on the site.
  • Funders over $1000 will receive a producer credit in the video.  You will also be invited to attend the workshop so that we may thank you in person.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, don't worry, there are other ways to help out!  Spread the word. Ask other folks to get the word out.  It would be a great help if you share this workshop with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, or just through email.  You can use the sharing tools right below the video on this page!

story:
I have started this campaign in honor of and to help the two teenage daughters of a man who was killed in an accident on Saturday, August 25th, he was 41.  He was a longtime friend of mine named Aaron Robar.  Aaron was part of a group named Rolling Thunder, an organization that puts together rides for veterans.  The day of the accident they were on an annual memorial ride for a fallen soldier who was killed in Iraq in 2007.  The accident occurred when an 87 year old driver crossed the center line and stuck the bikes, along with Aaron one other motorcyclist lost his life and five others were seriously hurt.  They had an escort of one police cruiser and two state troopers on motorcycles, all with their lights flashing.  Aaron was not only a devoted father but also a community activist.  He was the commissioner and founder of the local flag football team, which recently won the national world cup in Massachusetts.  He was also the assistant football coach for the towns high school.  He had recently purchased a new home and had just finished the renovations less than a month ago. 

 

With the family’s approval I have started this campaign to assist with the support of his daughters, 16 and 12.  This will not only help with their daily support but also help with their future education, and the girls would like to set up a scholarship program for athletes due to their fathers love and devotion to sports. 

 

Any amount donated would be much appreciated and all proceeds will go directly to a fund set up for his two girls, and the scholarship program.

story:
The Cocreatrix is about building stronger communities and making the world a lot more fun.

Imagine a world where we all engage.  

The Cocreatrix is a map based social navigator that weaves your online life into the real world.  It is an accessible, open source database of community resources, where people can share their passions, knowledge, creative work, and dreams.

The internet has incredible potential as a community building tool, but we have only just begun to realize that potential.  As a society we live in cities populated by unimaginable numbers of people, yet we go through our lives disconnected from those around us.  The internet helps us connect, yet simultaneously alienates us from our immediate environment.  

Our dream is to use the power of technology to help people weave together strong and a vibrant communities.  We designed the Cocreatrix to allow people to ‘cocreate’ – connect , exchange, and collaborate – on a local level to build healthier, happier neighborhoods and create sustainable social ecosystems.


How?

Seed your sphere:

Seeding is putting yourself on the map to cocreate a database of community resources. First you post your offerings - your passions, resources, knowledge and skills - to your neighborhood. Then you share your journey, showing activities, causes, beliefs, and interests you might have in common with other users in your neighborhood. 

Feel secure on the Cocreatrix - we put the privacy controls directly in your hands. You decide exactly who sees what.  Personal data is encrypted and your personal information stays private.   

Find your tribe:

The information you share when seeding your sphere will help you discover your tribe - the people, projects, events, and organizations that will support your growth and evolution.

Using mobile-friendly mapping, calendars, and other organizational tools you can easily coordinate with your people on Cocreatrix.   A neighborhood open mic, early morning tai chi, or a flash mob at noon - life is vibrant when we cocreate.

Make Your Move:

Share your creative work with automatic  feeds from youtube, soundcloud, vimeo, flickr, and other media sources.  Add live video streaming and instant image uploads to any event.


Take part in local discussions with our consensus module and take action as a community.

Support one another through real exchanges of time, energy and resources, creating a social economy of wellbeing and abundance

When we combine our time, energy, and knowledge, we find that we have an abundance of resources right at our fingertips. 

 

Symbiosis and Evolution

In a healthy ecosystem all different organisms function symbiotically, supporting each other in their growth and evolution.  Human societies could learn a lot from the rest of nature. The more we share and support each other, the stronger and more vibrant our communities will become.


We believe that strong communities are the key to a happy and sustainable future. We are developing a set of web tools that will help us connect with those around us on a more meaningful level.

At first we were working on three individual projects...

Scott was building a website that helps artists and musicians share their work, collaborate, and connect directly to their fan-base.


Kala was working on an idea for a map-based browser that would help people share resources through local social economies.

Mars had created a digital democracy tool that help communities reach consensus and take real world action.

We realized that if we worked together and combined these projects we could offer the world an empowering tool for the future.

Support us


We are committed to bringing this vision into reality, and you can help!  Donate here and help us fund the project.  Share this project with your friends and family.  

If you have ideas that you want to bring to life in the Cocreatrix, let us know!  
If you are involved with a project that aligns with the values of the Cocreatrix, get in touch -  
info@cocreatrix.com - collaboration is the name of the game!

Complex networks require powerful servers and lengthy testing and development.  The more funding we have, the quicker we can release all of the features we have been cocreating.  

Supporters will always be the first to get to play with the new tools.

Features for Phase 1 of development:

  • Local map-based browsing
  • Seamless integration with social media services like facebook, twitter, youtube, soundcloud, vimeo, bandcamp, tumblr, and others
  • Discussion tools that reward coherent and meaningful responses that discourage  spammers and trolls
  • Digital democracy tools that help communities reach consensus and take action
  • State of the art encryption to protect your data
  • Full mobile compatibility
  • Calendars and events that you can automatically export to any devices
  • Organizational utility that allows for anyone to be an event co-ordinator
  • Instant image uploads to events and projects

 

More Funding More Fun.

If we go over our funding goal we will put those resources towards developing more features including:

  • Live video streaming for events and projects
  • A fully secured meta-currency that is tied to existing local currencies and time banks to facilitate exchanges of time, energy, and resources.
  • Dedicated server space offered to projects and organizations.
  • Interactive games and quests, like scavenger hunts, geocaching, and city wide capture the flag, to turn the world into a playground
  • Tools for digital cocreation - social video, image, and live online jams
  • Open source tools for cooperative education and knowledge sharing

 

Thank you!


Your support will help bring this dream into a reality.

If you have any questions, comments, concerns, ideas, or feedback of any sort, we would love to hear from you - write us us at info@cocreatrix.com.

story:
Support us on Indiegogo so we can grow GrowSmart

Introducing the brains behind GrowSmart....

Hi.I'm Saren - a busy mother of three from New Zealand and I care about what I feed my kids because I want them to have the best start in life. The problem is with life being so busy it can be hard to find a quick snack for them that 

1. They all like to eat

2. That isn't full of the usual nasty chemicals which makes convenience snacks for kids taste good. 

So I came up with a solution. A nutritional and TASTY biscuit made from New Zealand's finest milk powder and manuka honey. 

Tell us about the biscuit! 

I'm no newbie when it comes to business so what was once just a pipe-dream in my mind is now a reality. With the help of a well known NZ food technology company this biscuit has already been produced, tasted and ENJOYED in a test quantity. The biscuits featured in the video are the REAL DEAL!!! They are ready to go and the kids really do LOVE them. 

They contain

*35% New Zealand's finest milk powder - desirable for it's high calcium content to meet the needs of growing strong bones and minds! 

*New Zealand Manuka honey - a uniquely flavoured honey known for it's healing and health properties. 

What's next?

The next step?? Well, this is what I need your help with. I really want to share this little slice of New Zealand goodness with families around the world. The biggest step is to do a larger production and establish our distribution channels and marketing to ensure we meet our target sales and fund the ongoing production of the biscuit factory. This is going to take a lot of work and require a significant amount of funding. With your help I know we can get there!

We are already in negotiation with a major food chain in Australasia and a second in Asia. To get across the globe we are going to need to employ two full-time staff members and complete the next round of marketing and packaging for export. 

How can I help?

The good news for you is by helping us you can be amongst the first to own a box of GrowSmart before they hit the shelves, even in New Zealand! Try them today and spread the word because this little slice of New Zealand can't wait to be shared with your family! 

I have also teamed up with the best New Zealand has to offer, so not only can you sample this unique piece of paradise but a whole range of unique products developed and sold here in New Zealand. See all our perks there's something for everyone! 

With your support we can offer our kids a better option - no more hunger meltdowns when you're out and about!!! 

Here are some of the many ways you can help us out...

*buy one of more of our perks on offer

*spread our story to your friends and family - click the share button here on Indiegogo!

*join our facebook page and share our posts - https://www.facebook.com/GrowSmartKids

*email us some encouragement! growsmartnz@gmail.com

Buy and try today!!! GrowSmart - Yummy NZ goodness!

story:
Short Summary

We believe in a dream to have a club that holds events managed and hosted by us but, envisioned by the customers (YOU). We want to create a community for LGBTQA to come and feel free of judgement. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5000 to finalize projections and create and host a more personal fundraiser here in town
  • You can pledge and receive free admissions as well as discounted meals
  • If our goal is not fully met we will precede as planned in finalizing market projections and hosting a larger more personalized fundraiser

The Impact

When I envision the success of this club I see a space with people like me with their similarities and differences, comforted, free from judgment at events that make them excited to be out enjoying themselves. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's understandable if you can't contribute. Everyone is chasing their own dreams and, dreams take hard work dedication and sometimes a lot of money. If you would:

  • Share this with your friends
  • Check out our website
  • Help us, help you

story:
Short Summary

A honeymoon in hell with a 6 months (Flat -rent) contract

  • My self and my wife young couple (age 26-20) married three months ago. To have a private and independent life we worked very hard to pull funds together and rent a flat (no honeymoon). We bounced back to work a day after marriage. My wife juggle two jobs together working 70 hours a week and my self longer shift sales assistant so that our rent can be paid. Unknown to us the flat we thought could be a home for us has damaged floor above us and sign of water leakage, both were covered up with fresh white paint before we moved in and sign 6 months contract.

 

  • We started to notice foot step which later become a very loud kick/noise from the top floor because any step made above us no matter how slight it was became a kick or a cracking- wood- sound- like. We were unable to sleep without using earplugs which became uncomfortable. It was later that I went to the floor above us and realise the floor was in a bad shape/ damaged and our rooms start to show sign of water leakages coming out of the white paint.

  • I develop constant headache and nose bleed follow.

  • Our marriage almost got to a break up point because we were always in a tense mood because of that.

  • Our landlord claim no wrong doing and try to keep us in base on contract signed, all these with the agent support and backing.

      

  • We decided to put together online an editable database of tenants experiences in flats and tenants experiences with Landlords and Agents so that things which are not visible during flat viewing can be looked upon online before another tenant become a victim like us.

 

  • This will help lots of tenants with independent information about the flat they are moving in

  • It will also keep both the landlords and agents in check . They will for once know there is an online database where all their acts and misconduct can be reported.

     

  • Your help raising the funds will greatly help us achieve these aims and goals which will in return save a whole lots of tenants like us the hassle and save them from become a victim



What You Will Get:

I am an up and coming songwriter and performer. I write about social problems and inequality. Video above.

Copy paste this link for my work: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X5doM8oR6fg

  • I have a written piece about our experience in this flat which will be recorded

  • Donors will be given a free download link for the finished song and opportunity to read the lyrics and contribute before final recording.

  • Your name on the websites.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Pls share the page to friends and talk about this to get the word out there

story:
**Update**

Thank you for all your support so far!

We recently moved into our new roasting facility, about five minutes from the cafe in Pasadena. There's still a lot of work to be done, so please excuse the mess. We were simply too excited not to share.

Front area, still sparsely furnished but to be spruced up for roasting tours and tastings:

Clancy, our master roaster, making adjustments to the 15 kg Joper we recently purchased:

Installing an exhaust pipe through the ceiling. We will enclose the area around our roasters with glass in order to maintain air quality, which is crucial for roast consistency:

Green beans from Mexico ready to be tested:

An example of a sample:

Clancy always takes a measured approach. Be sure to ask him about the motorcycle when you visit:

Breaking down the supply chain. Our roasting tours are all about in-depth education:

As you can see, things are coming together quickly. Your continued support will help accelerate our build out and get our roasters online more quickly. 

Thank you for your interest, and please continue to support us by spreading the word! 

**End of Update** 


The Copa Vida Story 

A coffee shop has always been my dream. After many years in the food manufacturing business, I had a chance to start fresh two years ago. I immersed myself in coffee, tea and design and traveled throughout the US and Europe to see what some of the best coffeehouses had to offer.

I also had the chance to take a “source trip” to Costa Rica and stayed at Coope Dota, a coffee cooperative comprised of 800 families and farms.

For three weeks, I observed and participated in every step of the harvesting process. The trip gave me a deeper appreciation for the complexity of the supply chain--not just where coffee comes from but how the trees are cultivated, the fruits picked, the seeds processed and the beans exported.

It reinforced my view that the production process must be viewed holistically, that the weather in Costa Rica for that season should influence how the beans are roasted and the way they are brewed, and that, even for the casual coffee enthusiast, this level of attention to detail would matter, as long as they were informed.

As a lifelong casual coffee enthusiast now pushing headlong into the coffee business, I wanted to recreate this discovery process and find a way to bridge the amazing, yet admittedly complex, world of specialty coffee and tea with the greater community. The trick would be to find a way to achieve high standards of excellence while remaining transparent, accessible (in price and otherwise), and even instructive.

I have been fortunate to partner with two coffee afficionados and award winning baristas, Sam Hong and Frank La, and a highly experienced chef with a fine dining background, Erick Lee.

Together we developed the Copa Vida concept: a café that is approachable and welcoming, authentic and transparent, and an engaged member of the local and global community

In August 2013, we opened our doors in the heart of Old Town Pasadena, CA.

A Cup of Life

Copa Vida comes from the phrase “pura vida,” which literally means “pure life.” As an affirmative expression in Costa Rica, it broadly corresponds to the English phrase “life is good.".

During my time in Costa Rica, I found myself easily adapting the phrase, though it struck me as almost overly expressive. I like to think it reflects a passion for life so infused into the culture that even seemingly trivial questions such as “how are you?” or “how was the date?” are met with “pura vida!” I wanted to capture that passion in some way when we were developing the cafe.

The name Copa Vida is a play on that phrase and roughly translates to “cup of life.” We chose it to represent our values--high quality, passionate living, openness and communal sharing--and our mission to use coffee, tea and food as vehicles to convey them. They are further distilled in our theme “Go, Enjoy, Experience,” which has guided the way we've shaped the cafe to fit your life.

For those on the go, we have a self-serve “honor bar” featuring cold brew, iced tea on tap and a basket for payment. It’s a convenient service that allows our regulars to skip the long lines.

For when you’re dining in or settling down for a thoughtful moment, we’ve designed an open and communal space, with big windows and low countertops and plentiful tables to linger at. We chose low profile or clear machines in order to facilitate customer and barista interaction, and the tables, cabinetry, wood paneling and menu display were all specially designed and handcrafted by Sam and his father, who is a carpenter.

Lastly, for those who want to nerd out on caffeinated drinks with us, we’ve created an experiential slow bar for cuppings, tea flights, pairings and brew method classes. The offerings change weekly and reflect what is happening in the coffee and tea community at that moment.

Chef Erick has created special pairings of food with some of our specialty drinks, such as a shortbread that highlights the creaminess of our milk oolong tea. We recently introduced breakfast, served weekdays from 8 to 11 AM, and our regular food menu runs until 3PM. Brunch is served every weekend from 10 AM to 2 PM.

What We Need

We are fundraising to purchase a roaster and extend the Copa Vida experience.

Coffee beans are the pits of coffee cherries. Upon extraction, they look like this:

Beans in this natural form maintain their freshness as exporters ship them to roasters here in the US. The heat from the roaster then browns and hardens them and coaxes out their flavor and aroma. Much as a barista must carefully select grind size and brew temperature, a master roaster calibrates the batch size, time, temperature and agitation levels for an optimal roast. 

Our own roaster will allow us to guarantee freshness and quality and to explore unique alignments among beans, roasts and brewing methods, resulting in thoughtfully integrated drinks.

The roasting facility will also give us another way to engage with you, whether through direct delivery of our freshest or roasting tours and workshops where you can do custom roasts and take home your own beans.  

We plan to purchase a 15 kg roaster from Europe with a cast iron double drum that allows for more uniform heat distribution throughout the roasting process. These are high-quality units that typically run upwards of $45,000, with ancillary equipment expected to run another $30,000.

What You Get

We’ve tried to come up with interesting and experiential perks that hopefully intrigue you. In addition to drinks and coffee, you can find some of our previously listed slow bar classes on our Facebook page. Broadly speaking, we design classes around three categories:

1. Signature beverages - create with us seasonal, specialty beverages such as salted caramel ice cream with an espresso pour over or a fruity sorbet in sparkling tea

2. Pairings - specially designed food and beverage pairings such as butterscotch tea with persimmons or coffee with chocolate

3. Education - learn new brewing methods and techniques such as japanese style iced coffee or latte art

We are in the process of designing our shirts and selecting the fabric. We will upload more details as available. 

All proceeds will go toward the purchase of our roaster, but we are also taking this purchase as a chance to open up another engagement point with you. By sharing our story and values and goals, we hope to build on our relationship, becoming more than just a business and a product but also a story, a collective journey and a second home. 



Thank you for all your support so far, and we look forward to serving you your cup of life.

Warm regards,

Steve Chang
