story:
**NEW Arcade/Music Game App #DiamondMan is now available in the App Store for FREE courtesy of @Dee_Low @RapsMyInitials & @jeniusLogic ...Let us know what you think...  

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/diamond-man/id831727397?mt=8

ULTIMATE PERK *LIMITED QUANTITY*

$125 WILL GET YOU:

- BETA TESTING FOR NEW RELEASES OF THE NEW ARCADE & MUSIC GAME APP #DIAMONDMAN 

-*LIMITED EDITION* jeniusLogic LLC. MEMBER & SUPPORTER T-SHIRTS IN GRAY, WHITE OR BLACK.

-1 HOUR APP  DEVELOPMENT CONSULTATION OR CHAT WITH jL via FACETIME OR SKYPE

-PERSONAL OR PROFESSIONAL CREDIT ON OUR WEBSITE AND WITHIN THE jeniusLogic APP.


Who I am

In 2013, Joshua “ jL ” Mitchell, Founder, CEO, and Lead Developer; established jeniusLogic LLC. out of his love and passion for Technology and Entrepreneurship. During his 3.5 year career at Apple Inc., jL worked as a Lead Genius assisting over 1 Million Apple product users, Facilitated National Apple iOS Certification courses, Implemented Global Apple strategies by the analysis of Market Trend and Culture metrics, and is Self-Taught and Certified in iOS Application Development. jL’s career at Apple Inc. has given him unique insight into Apple’s market and culture, the Application (App) Development Industry, along with candid feedback from Apple consumers explaining their experience using Apple's devices and applications to enhance their personal and professional lives.

jeniusLogic LLC.

We are an App Development Firm dedicated to the development of iOS Applications for companies to utilize as avenues for creative expression, increasing brand loyalty and generating revenue. We are aiming to revolutionize how companies monetize and engage with their brand following by providing the services of: Native iOS Application Development, User Interface/User Experience Design, Mobile Marketing and Mobile Strategy Consulting & Implementation. 

We believe that Application Development is the contemporary choice for businesses who are in need of innovative avenues to engage with and express their brand. Our holistic perspective of the App Development Industry allows us the freedom to focus on creating Applications that are mutually beneficial to the end-user and the company. Our jeniusLogic LLC. App will be the first of many Applications that supports this perspective in the vision of Increasing Creative Expression Through Technological Innovation. 

#WhatIsYourjeniusLogic 

When jeniusLogic is broken up into two words it means crazy or moronic logic. When striving for a dream that is unique to you, others will attempt to devalue your vision by viewing your logic for success as crazy or moronic. 

#WhatIsYourjeniusLogic will be the community component of our jeniusLogic LLC. App that will promote and share our users jeniusLogic with the world in efforts to inspire others to strive for their dreams regardless of personal or professional negative influences. Our users will be able to upload a video selfie or provide a link to a YouTube video which will be focused around these questions:

  • What Is Your Dream & Why
  • How Are You Pursuing That Dream
  • What Are You Persevering Through 

All of the uploaded videos will be saved to our digital database. The categories of our database will be determined by the nature of the users jeniusLogic. 

Your Impact

To some people Application Development is reserved for those with Computer Science Degrees or have been in the Technology field for many years...WRONG! I am living proof that anyone can learn how to program and apply that skill to an area of interest that is important to them. There are revolutionary movements going on around the world that are aiming to inspire others to learn how to program. In the near future we foresee computer programming of some sort to become a prerequisite for college admission. As this revolution grows so will the need for work opportunities in the fields of the Application Development Industry. Your support in this campaign will not only fund a positive community App but a company that is aiming to provide quality services, jobs and careers to this exponentially growing Industry. 

What We Need & What You Get

This is what jeniusLogic LLC. needs:

  • A Development Budget of $2000

Which will cover legal fees and the cost for the expertise listed below:

  1. User Interface/Experience Designer
  2. Application Developer
  3. Back - End Server Building and Maintenance 

This is what you get in return:

  • PERK 1 = A mailed Letter of Thanks signed by jL and your email added to our company newsletter. *All Perks & Contributions come with this letter.
  • PERK 2 = A 15 minute App Development Consultation or chat via FaceTime or Skype with jL
  • PERK 3 = A 30 minute App Development Consultation or chat via FaceTime or Skype with jL
  • PERK 4 = Be apart of the BETA TESTING GROUP for our jeniusLogic App, A 30 minute App Development Consultation or chat via FaceTime or Skype with jL.
  • PERK 5 = Personal or Professional Credit on our Website and within the jeniusLogic App, be apart of our BETA TESTING GROUP and a 1 hour App Development Consultation or chat via FaceTime or Skype with jL.

*Along with the personal satisfaction that your contributing to a high quality company with an innovative and worthy vision.

Our Flexible Funding Model

We chose the Flexible Funding Model for two simple reasons:

  1. We believe that we can reach our goal
  2. We want you to have the option to contribute with via Credit Card or PayPal Account, not just a PayPal Account 

We believe that we have a very valuable vision and product within jeniusLogic LLC. The Flexible Funding Model allows us to keep any funds that are collected to put towards our App vision and business cost. The jeniusLogic App WILL BE BUILT. Indiegogo is just one avenue that we are using to generate funding so even IF we do not reach our goal of $2000, you can be confident that all perks will be honored and all monies collected will be going towards the App and jeniusLogic LLC. Accountability and Professional Integrity are very important to us. If you have any questions or concerns you can reach us on any of our communication outlets.

*After we reach our goal all surplus funding will go towards:

  • New features of the jeniusLogic LLC. App
  • Development budgets for future Apps 
  • Start-Up costs for jeniusLogic LLC.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is not the only way that you can support jeniusLogic LLC. You can help and support us by:

  • Deciding what YOUR DREAM is, pursue it and record a video to be apart of the #WhatIsYourjeniusLogic community
  • Using the Indiegogo Share Tools to increase our GoGoFactor - our campaign awareness
  • Telling people about our vision and campaign via Word Of Mouth, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Vimeo, Pinterest, LinkedIn, and any other forum you think is appropriate
  • Investors who are seriously interested in negotiating EQUITY in jeniusLogic LLC. please email jL@jeniusLogic.com

story:
The Situation 

Albinism is an inherited condition characterized by a lack of melanin in the skin, hair and eyes, usually accompanied by impaired vision.  Albinism occurs in Tanzania at a rate that is ten times higher than the rate in developed countries.  People with albinism (PWA) in Tanzania are stigmatized and marginalized by their families and communities, and sometimes killed at birth.

This is due largely to superstitions that albinism is a curse from God, albino body parts bring wealth and that PWAs are born after a woman sleeps with the devil. Since 2007 in NW Tanzania, albinos have been hunted, mutilated and even killed for their body parts.   In that time, the murder of more than one hundred albinos has been documented, in addition to hundreds of mutilations and grave-robberies.

                                       

Diana, a 17-year-old Tanzanian PWA, is finishing her final year of high school and hopes to attend university. She is also a talented netball player.

The Plan

To date, governing bodies have not been effective at prosecuting these crimes, so alternative actions must be taken. We worked with Albino human rights groups in Tanzania, led by Sister Martha – an Albino herself and stalwart defender of Albino rights in Tanzania, to design and begin implementation of a participatory media project.

Goals:

(1) Sensitize communities to the issues faced by PWA through a video created by PWA themselves, telling their stories in ways that humanize them among people who believe they are a curse from God and question their humanness;

(2) Educate communities about the facts and myths regarding albinism, facilitate integration of new information and implications for the future;

(3) Destigmatize albinism and enhance the integration of PWAs within villages, and sometimes even within their own families;

(4) Help give PWAs in Tanzania voice to tell their stories.

The program launched last year with focus groups aimed at identifying the root causes for the many problems albinos face. Focus group participants said that the best way to improve their security and debunk these myths is to demonstrate to their communities that they too, are human. 

We went to Tanzania and led a storytelling workshop with albinos and traditional healers. The workshop participants then interviewed each other, off the record, to identify the stories that best address the root causes of their marginalization. Finally, we turned on the cameras, and recorded these interviews, with albino interviewers.

                      

                         Start of storytelling workshop with PWAs and natural healers.

Moving Forward

When we finish editing the video (with feedback from our Tanzanian partners), Sister Martha, traditional healers, and other albinos will travel to 40 villages along Lake Victoria to screen the video and engage in community discussion to:

(1) Ground people in their own experiences of albinism;

(2) Offer a new, humanizing vision of people with albinism through a video created by and featuring PWA telling their own stories, as well as a few facts (versus myths) presented by credible sources;

(3) Facilitate the processing and integration of new information through questions and discussion, and;

(4) Assist in articulating changes and exploring implications for the future.

The Impact

This video is a key to helping change the knowledge, attitudes, and behaviors about albinos in Tanzania. 

                  

Saiede and Sada are brother and sister. Saiede runs a successful fish market and Sada owns a small business selling baskets and raw weaving materials out of her home. 

What We Need

After we left Tanzania, Sister Martha became gravely ill (but is slowly recovering!). She volunteered to translate the fourteen interviews from Swahili to English, but is too weak to do so. We need funds to pay a professional translator to take on this work. 

We will also pay for the production of a short animated segment explaining how albinism is caused on a genetic level. One of the reasons for the marginalization of PWAs is a lack of knowledge about what actually causes albinism – this animation will help explain that in a matter-of-fact way.  

If we exceed our funding goals, additional funds will go directly to Albino Peacemakers to help further their efforts to end violence against albinos in Tanzania. 

                                     

Many Tanzanians don't realize that parents with dark skin can give birth to babies with albinism. In this photo, Beatrice is carrying her little brother. There are 7 children in their family: 3 albino and 4 dark skinned.

About Us

Sister Martha Mganga is the founder and director of Albino Peacemakers, a human rights organization working with PWA in the Mara Region of Tanzania. She has albinism herself and has worked with PWA for the past 25 years providing counseling, cobbling together resources for health care and education, and advocating for PWA; she also chairs the Arusha District of the Tanzania Albino Society.

                                  

                                           Sister Martha Mganga

Mark and Ericha Gudmastad are specialists in participatory media production and storytelling. They met in graduate school at the University of Denver, where they studied International and Intercultural Communications. They live in Washington, DC and both work for international non-profits with missions to improve the lives of marginalized populations around the world.

                                      

                                                  Mark & Ericha Gudmastad

Terry Morton went to Tanzania in 2010 to work with the Mennonite Central Committee, building the capacity of local nonprofit organizations.  Because of her background in conflict management, they also asked her to set up a peacebuilding program. She heard about the killing of albinos in Northwestern Tanzania, and this became the focus of her work. She and Sister Martha began working together two years ago.

                                                    

                          Terry Morton holding a baby goat near Mugumu, Tanzania.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you donate $75, we'll send you an 8X10 framed photo taken during the trip by photographer Pebble Hager. Let us know which one you'd like: 

Juliasi farming compound (Beatrice's sister)



Sister Martha and her mother 


Tired lion


"I got your back" zebras


A parade of elephants
story_txt:
The Situation 

Albinism
is an inherited condition characterized by a lack of melanin in the skin, hair
and eyes, usually accompanied by impaired vision.  Albinism occurs in Tanzania at a
rate that is ten times higher than the rate in developed countries.  People
with albinism (PWA) in Tanzania are stigmatized and marginalized by their
families and communities, and sometimes killed at birth.This is due largely to superstitions that albinism is a curse from God, albino body parts bring wealth and that PWAs are born after a woman sleeps with the devil. Since 2007 in NW Tanzania, albinos have been hunted, mutilated and even killed for their body parts.   In that time, the murder of more than one hundred albinos has been documented, in addition to hundreds of mutilations and grave-robberies.                                       Diana, a 17-year-old Tanzanian PWA, is finishing her final year of high school and hopes to attend university. She is also a talented netball player.
The Plan

To date, governing bodies have not been effective at prosecuting these crimes, so alternative actions must be taken. We worked with Albino human rights groups in Tanzania, led by Sister Martha – an Albino herself and stalwart defender of Albino rights in Tanzania, to design and begin implementation of a participatory media project.Goals:(1) Sensitize
communities to the issues faced by PWA through a video created by PWA
themselves, telling their stories in ways that humanize them among people who
believe they are a curse from God and question their humanness;
(2) Educate
communities about the facts and myths regarding albinism, facilitate
integration of new information and implications for the future;
(3) Destigmatize
albinism and enhance the integration of PWAs within villages, and sometimes
even within their own families;(4) Help give PWAs in Tanzania voice to tell their stories.
The
program launched last year with focus groups aimed at identifying the root
causes for the many problems albinos face. Focus group participants said that
the best way to improve their security and debunk these myths is to demonstrate
to their communities that they too, are human. We went to Tanzania and led a storytelling workshop with albinos and traditional healers. The workshop participants then interviewed each other, off the record, to identify the stories that best address the root causes of their marginalization. Finally, we turned on the cameras, and recorded these interviews, with albino interviewers.                                               Start of storytelling workshop with PWAs and natural healers.
Moving ForwardWhen we finish editing
the video (with feedback from our Tanzanian partners), Sister Martha,
traditional healers, and other albinos will travel to 40 villages along Lake
Victoria to screen the video and engage in community discussion to:
(1) Ground
people in their own experiences of albinism;
(2) Offer
a new, humanizing vision of people with albinism through a video created by and
featuring PWA telling their own stories, as well as a few facts (versus myths)
presented by credible sources;
(3) Facilitate
the processing and integration of new information through questions and
discussion, and;
(4) Assist
in articulating changes and exploring implications for the future.
The Impact
This
video is a key to helping change the knowledge, attitudes, and behaviors about
albinos in Tanzania.                   Saiede and Sada are brother and sister. Saiede runs a successful fish market and Sada owns a small business selling baskets and raw weaving materials out of her home. 
What We Need
After
we left Tanzania, Sister Martha became gravely ill (but is slowly recovering!).
She volunteered to translate the fourteen interviews from Swahili to English,
but is too weak to do so. We need funds to pay a professional translator to
take on this work. 
We
will also pay for the production of a short animated segment explaining how
albinism is caused on a genetic level. One of the reasons for the marginalization
of PWAs is a lack of knowledge about what actually causes albinism – this
animation will help explain that in a matter-of-fact way.  If we exceed our funding goals, additional funds will go directly to Albino Peacemakers to help further their efforts to end violence against albinos in Tanzania.                                      Many Tanzanians don't realize that parents with dark skin can give birth to babies with albinism. In this photo, Beatrice is carrying her little brother. There are 7 children in their family: 3 albino and 4 dark skinned.
About Us
Sister Martha Mganga is the founder and director of Albino Peacemakers, a human rights
organization working with PWA in the Mara Region of Tanzania. She has albinism
herself and has worked with PWA for the past 25 years providing counseling,
cobbling together resources for health care and education, and advocating for
PWA; she also chairs the Arusha District of the Tanzania Albino Society.                                                                             Sister Martha Mganga
Mark and Ericha
Gudmastad
are specialists in participatory media production and storytelling. They met in
graduate school at the University of Denver, where they studied International
and Intercultural Communications. They live in Washington, DC and both work for
international non-profits with missions to improve the lives of marginalized
populations around the world.                                                                                        Mark & Ericha GudmastadTerry Morton went to Tanzania in 2010 to work with the
Mennonite Central Committee, building the capacity of local nonprofit
organizations.  Because of her background in conflict
management, they also asked her to set up a peacebuilding program. She heard about the
killing of albinos in Northwestern Tanzania, and this became the focus of
her work. She and Sister Martha began working together two years ago.                                                                              Terry Morton holding a baby goat near Mugumu, Tanzania.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------If you donate $75, we'll send you an 8X10 framed photo taken during the trip by photographer Pebble Hager. Let us know which one you'd like: Juliasi farming compound (Beatrice's sister)Sister Martha and her mother Tired lion"I got your back" zebrasA parade of elephants

story:
Hey guys my older brother Giannis Giagos is traveling to Oregon to take his first out-of-state firefighter written test. Giannis is one of my biggest supporters with my dream to fight, and i want to help him follow his. Due to family obligations he is a little short on funds so I decided to put a fundraiser together for his travel expenses.  

Guys anything is helpful even if you just share the page. Becoming a firefighter in LA is so hard. He is willing to do whatever it takes. 

Giannis deserves a chance at his dream.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Lucy.

I'm a longstanding member of the Dreamwidth community, where folks know me as randomling. Over the past two years, I've been volunteering as a developer for this excellent open-source project: contributing patches, writing documentation, cheerleading, and holding the hands of new programmers (or “babydevs”, as we like to call them in Dreamwidth slang) through their first steps towards coding.

I'm relatively new to software development myself. I was originally trained in linguistics, and have a professional background in administration. I've always had an interest in computers and especially the web, so when the opportunity to learn to code – and help out my favourite site at the same time – came up, I jumped at the chance. Dreamwidth has been incredibly supportive.

I've now been offered a fantastic opportunity: to attend my very first technical conference with some of my fellow Dreamwidth developers. I'm one of the volunteers that Dreamwidth has chosen to fly out to Austin, Texas for YAPC::NA and the associated Dreamwidth hackathon. My contributions to this project will be enhanced enormously by this opportunity to attend a conference focusing on the language Dreamwidth is written in – but unfortunately, the financial side is a bit tricky.

Health issues mean I am not able to work, and the current UK Government's attitude to sickness and disability means I was recently turned down for benefits I am entitled to. I am appealing the decision, but this will take an enormous amount of time, effort and stress.

To get the most out of this opportunity, I'm asking for your help. Dreamwidth is generously paying for my flight, accommodation and conference registration, but my lack of income means that I will struggle to feed myself while I'm out there (my family are kindly taking care of me financially at home) – never mind attend the lunchtime and evening social events that are a key benefit of attending a professional conference.

With your help, I'll be able to invest more effort and more productivity into Dreamwidth – and any leftover funds will be donated straight back to the project, to support other volunteers having a tough time.

What I Need & What You Get

What I Need

I'll be in Austin for 7 days. $500 should cover:

  • $50 a day. This should be more than enough to cover breakfast, lunch and dinner, a reasonable contribution to gas and car rental (I'll be making use of someone else's rented car), and any incidental expenses that might come up.

  • $150 emergency money. This obviously won't cover a major medical emergency, but it'll be helpful if unexpected expenses come up. I'm hoping that I won't need this extra money, and I'll be able to feed it straight back into the Dreamwidth project.

What You Get

When it comes to offering perks, I have two major skills to use. One, obviously, is programming. The other is writing.

  • If you're a Dreamwidth user

I'm offering to fix bugs for cash, on a sliding scale! You can pick any one (or several, depending on the amount donate) of the bugs on this list of easy bugs, and I will hack away and get them fixed! Obviously this is most relevant if you use Dreamwidth on a regular basis, because this has the potential to improve your experience of the site.

  • If you like stories

I'm offering to write a story for you – one you help to create yourself! This could be a fan fiction story (have a look at my list of fandoms) or an original one. Provide me with a prompt, a paragraph about what you like, or a list of things you'd like to see included, and I'll write something just for you based on your idea.

The Impact

Getting the most out of this conference will make a huge difference to me – and, I think, to the users of Dreamwidth.

Programming is my dream job. I love the challenge of trying to understand a forest of code, or of working out how to make something new behave just the way you want it to. I love looking at a site and being able to point to the features I wrote, and I love the enormous amount of learning that I've done over the past two years. This conference is my first contact with the wider world of professional programming – and I want to make the most of the opportunity. It brings me one step closer to my goal of a career in software development.

I like to think that my participation in the conference, and more importantly the hackathon, will make a difference to Dreamwidth. One bug I'm hoping to devote lots of time to while I'm in Texas is a quick-account-switch system which would make a huge positive difference to many DW users (including myself; then again, it's no surprise that programmers like to scratch their own itches). A fellow programmer has already done lots of work on this, and it would be fantastic to get it up and running.

Ultimately, I want to use my programming skills to change the world. Fully engaging with this conference will really increase my chances of being able to do that – improving my skills, putting me in touch with a wider circle of developers, and broadening my experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has the financial wherewithal to donate – but you can still help out! Use the Share tools to tell your friends about the campaign, and boost the signal any way you can. I appreciate every single post and tweet.

With your help, I can get where I'm headed – and make a real difference when I arrive!

story:
Your lonely knitting days are over, today your passion can find places to be shared.


Crowdknitting is a social network with an amazing growth potential: sign up, get to know people and become their friend, share and exchange advice, join others in groups, arrange meetings, suggest projects, create events, get people to know you, build a movement... change the world!


About us

Crowdknitting is a social network for the knitting lovers and for all those who wish to learn more about this activity; children, teenagers, adults, mothers and grandmothers, schools and companies, creative people or knitter wannabe. A new way of meeting and connecting, a thread that links, creating relationships and new opportunities

The name CrowdKnitting is a mixture of the word crowd, an assembly of people and a word often used in the marketing field to indicate something that implies sharing and collaboration, and the word knitting, an activity we all enjoy doing.

Thus, the original goal of CrowdKnitting was to create collective and shared yarn bombing projects to characterise the urban landscape and support social projects. Almost necessarily, this idea quickly evolved into a knitcommunity; people who make of their passion for knitting a way of expressing themselves and a business opportunity.


The Project

Crowdknitting is a Social Network which aims at helping the innovation and growth of the "hand-knitted in Italy" industry with new ideas and challenges coming from the variety of its Community. The social platform goal is to help its members get in touch with other people in order to create relations and professional opportunities, a place where individuals with a common interest can interact with the support of technology.

With this idea in mind, we created the You4Knitting Project, with the objective of giving stylists, knitwear designers and creative talents the opportunity to meet colleagues as well as to find companies interested in buying their work, while giving companies the possibility of accessing new ideas and creative innovation.

We are thus about to launch an e-commerce platform based on ideas coming from the community , products that are handmade by our 'certified knitters'. 

Thanks to the You4Knitting project and to the short distribution chain (community-knitters-customers), everyone will benefit ; turning a passion into a job, selling high-quality products at a fair price.

Original handmade items with a soul, recognizable through their own identity card and specific features. 

Crowdknitting will also become a market place opened to everyone willing to offer its products.

Every knitter has his/her own history, but we all share one passion: knitting.

Crowdknitting is not only web!

We started a net of Crowdknit Cafes, a new way of perceiving knitting, a synthesis between an event and a starting point for the circulation of a new culture; a group of people who meet to knit and share ideas and projects, but also promotional events for businesses that see knitting as an innovative way of socializing.

At the moment, we have 22 Crowdknit Cafes all over Italy, but we dream to see them spread to other countries too! 


What do we need?

Crowdknitting is a project based on highly customized open source technology which needs continuous graphic development and UI support to make it as user-friendly and intuitive as possible.

These interventions, that so far we have financed ourselves, need continuous funding. 

Furthermore, the manufacturing of handmade items designed by our creative talents need an initial investment to start the production chain. 

Therefore, our objectives are:

- to implement new modules to further develop our Social Platform and the Market Place;

- to manufacture at least 2 collections of handmade clothes in 2014 in order to start off this type of business.


Goal:

15.000 EUR

Why contribute to this project

We firmly believe in Crowdknitting; first of all, for its social nature, meaning that sharing ideas and being a community are an essential part of it. Secondly, because we believe that knitting can catalyse economical growth by starting new business processes.

What do you get by helping us?

Every single contribution is essential to us, so we'll be thankful to anyone making a donation, however small. As a thank you, once you make a donation we will send ou our thank you as follows:

€ 5 or more

you are a Start Crowdknitter 

                                     

We add your name to the list of supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive our personal thank you email. Furthermore, if you are a knitwear designer or a  knitter you will be able to send us your CV: we will evaluate it and if we find it suitable you could be part of our You4Knitting project.

€ 10 or more

you are a Start Crowdknitter plus 

We add your name to the list of supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive our personal thank you email as well as our Crowdknitting badges, which you can proudly wear whenever you feel like it.

€ 20 or more

you are an Addict Crowdknitter Silver

We add your name to the list of supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive our personal thank you email, as well as a postcard and our Crowdknitting  badges, which you can proudly wear whenever you feel like it.

€ 40 or more

you are an Addict Crowdknitter Gold 

We add your name to the list of supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive our personal thank you email as well our Crowdknitting  badges, which you can proudly wear whenever you feel like it. On top of that, you will also receive a small hand-knitted gift together with our postcard.

€ 80 or more

You are a Social Crowdknitter 

We add your name to the list of supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus we will send you a personalized cowl, hand-knitted by one of our certified knitters - only 30 available.

delivery within June 2014

€ 100  or more

You are a Social Crowdknitter Plus 

Have you always dreamt about receiving a hand-knitted, personalised gift? Now is the time to finally get it! Your name will be added to the list of supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive a hand-knitted accessory which you will be able to choose between different colours and models from the patterns that we will make available on our website. 

only 15 available

delivery within July 2014

€ 200 or more

You are a Professional Crowdknitter 

We add your name to the list of supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus we will send you a custom-made item, hand-knitted with love by one of our certified Knitters, which you can choose from a list that we will make available to you.

only 10 available

delivery within July 2014

€ 500 or more

You are a Star Crowdknitter Silver 

Since you believe so much in our project, we are pleased to offer you the opportunity to use our market place free of charge (that means no fixed costs or commissions on the items you sell through it). We add your name to the list of our Silver Supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website.

€ 1000 or more

You are a Star Crowdknitter Gold 

We love you. We add your name to the list of our Golden Supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus we offer you the opportunity to use our marketplace free of charge (that means no fixed costs or commissions on the items you sell through it).  Furthermore, you can choose a hand-knitted garment from our Crowdknitting Store that we will have knitted for you and sent to your address.


Press

After 12 month from the launch of  Crowdknitting Social Network, we've had 2000 registered users, 22 Crowdknit Cafès all over Italy, we have been noticed by some key national media.

“A social network exclusively for "knitters". Crowdknitting.com was born from the vision of four passionate knitters who tapped into a lively and growing community, creating an online (and offline) platform for them to share and meet.”

“...the Crowdknitting project, which turns knitting into moments of sharing and a means of taking back our cities through Yarn Bombing - open-air exhibitions of collective knitted works of art.”

“From now on, knitting lovers won't feel lonely any more. Actually, there is a social network that has been thought specifically for them, it's called Crowdknitting. Its creators will be at next week's Fuori Salone in Milan and, to tap into the high levels of creativity available at the exhibition, they decided to show themselves in person to their followers. They will be holding a small workshop called Knitting for Yarn Bombing.”

“The amazing show of innovation, starring twenty protagonists from the Italian North-Eastern regions

«...  Crowdknitting (from the English “crowd” and “knit”) is a social network for those who are passionate about the traditional craft of knitting which has been created by a team of Venetian friends ...  »

CHE FUTURO!

“Can you describe it in a tweet? It's the first Italian social network entirely built around knitting and crochet lovers, as well as for those who wish to approach these crafts.”

« ...  Yes, it is yet another social network, but this time we are dealing with something really special. Try to imagine something that acts like a bridge between past and future, between handmade and digital, crafts and social platforms ...»

« ... We happily give space to those promoted by our friends of Crowdknitting, who gather knitting and yarn lovers to knit together and produce works of art that are beautiful to look at and good for the spirit...»

« ...  If you still don't know the new Crowd Knitting social network... Get to know it, take part! Something is happening in the word of crafts, and we know it: you've been constantly surprising us from September up until today...»

« ...  Their philosophy is to create job opportunities, turning a passion into paid work. Their keywords are: solidarity, community, to meet, exchange and share...»

«...  The event that truly impressed me  has certainly been the one regarding “Crowdknitting”, something I didn't even know existed before, but that I found has had a pretty good reception by the fashion, art and design worlds...»

«...  Alessandra Perdonello, Maria Cristina Pizzato and Lucia Salvemini decided to invite all the users of their online community to knit together, and this time off the web. ...»

http://nova.ilsole24ore.com/tag/social-network 7th February 2014

Knitting and sharing:   four friends passionate about knitting and the social network they created and manage. This is how Crowdknitting.com was born, behind this name the very idea of intercepting the Italian community of knitting enthusiasts. Online discussion for “knitters”, people who love knitting. Not only online. In fact, the Crowdknitting team has been organizing “Crowdknit Cafes”, for years, which are meetings to knit together.

How does the Crowdknitting Store work?

1.  Our stylists design models to be produced; these models will be sent to our knitters together with the necessary yarn to realise them.

2.  Every knitter knits the models in different colours, every garment has its own identity card.

3.  The customer can choose an item from our shop window; if the item is currently available, Crowdknitting Store will dispatch it immediately; if it isn't available, it can be ordered and it will be received within 30 days.

4.  The quality and conformity of the items is guaranteed by the care with which we choose our designers and knitters.


Crowdknitting taps into its community to receive feedback and suggestions about the models to be offered; these suggestions are crucial to creating a handmade product whose quality is the highest possible.


You can find the Crowdknitting project on:

www.crowdknitting.com


                 


Other ways to help us

You can contribute to our project also by sharing it with your friends and connections with the IndieGoGo sharing tools.

Thank you for your time!

but we all share one passion: knitting.
Crowdknitting is not only web!
We started a net of Crowdknit Cafes, a new way of
perceiving knitting, a synthesis between an event and a starting point for the
circulation of a new culture; a group of people who meet to knit and share
ideas and projects, but also promotional events for businesses that see
knitting as an innovative way of socializing.

At the moment,
we have 22 Crowdknit Cafes all over Italy, but we dream to see them spread to
other countries too! 
What do we need?
Crowdknitting is a project based on
highly customized open source technology which needs continuous graphic
development and UI support to make it as user-friendly and intuitive as
possible.
These interventions, that so far we
have financed ourselves, need continuous funding.  
Furthermore, the manufacturing of
handmade items designed by our creative talents need an initial investment to
start the production chain. Therefore, our objectives are:
- to implement new modules to
further develop our Social Platform and the Market Place;
- to manufacture at least 2 collections
of handmade clothes in 2014 in order to start off this type of business.
Goal:
15.000 EUR
Why contribute to this project
We firmly believe in Crowdknitting;
first of all, for its social nature, meaning that sharing ideas and being a
community are an essential part of it. Secondly, because we believe that
knitting can catalyse economical growth by starting new business processes. 
What do you get by helping us?Every single contribution is essential
to us, so we'll be thankful to anyone making a donation, however small. As a
thank you, once you make a donation we will send ou our thank you as follows:
€ 5 or more
you are a Start
Crowdknitter                                      We add your name to the list of
supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive our personal thank you email. Furthermore,
if you are a knitwear designer or a 
knitter you will be able to send us your CV: we will evaluate it and if
we find it suitable you could be part of our You4Knitting project. 
€ 10 or more
you are a Start
Crowdknitter plus We add your name to the list of
supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive our personal
thank you email as well as our Crowdknitting badges, which you can proudly wear
whenever you feel like it. 
€ 20 or more
you are an
Addict Crowdknitter SilverWe add your name to the list of
supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive our personal
thank you email, as well as a postcard and our Crowdknitting  badges, which you can proudly wear whenever
you feel like it.
€ 40 or more
you are an
Addict Crowdknitter Gold We add your name to the list of
supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus you will receive our personal
thank you email as well our Crowdknitting 
badges, which you can proudly wear whenever you feel like it. On top of
that, you will also receive a small hand-knitted gift together with our
postcard.
€ 80 or more
You are a
Social Crowdknitter We add your name to the list of
supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus we will send you a
personalized cowl, hand-knitted by one of our certified knitters - only 30
available. 
delivery within June 2014
€ 100  or more
You are a
Social Crowdknitter Plus Have you always dreamt about receiving
a hand-knitted, personalised gift? Now is the time to finally get it! Your name
will be added to the list of supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus
you will receive a hand-knitted accessory which you will be able to choose
between different colours and models from the patterns that we will make
available on our website.  
only 15 available
delivery within July 2014
€ 200 or more
You are a
Professional Crowdknitter We add your name to the list of
supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus we will send you a
custom-made item, hand-knitted with love by one of our certified Knitters,
which you can choose from a list that we will make available to you.
only 10 available
delivery within July 2014
€ 500 or more
You are a Star
Crowdknitter Silver Since you believe so much in our
project, we are pleased to offer you the opportunity to use our market place
free of charge (that means no fixed costs or commissions on the items you sell
through it). We add your name to the list of our Silver Supporters on the
Crowdknitting.com website. 
€ 1000 or more
You are a Star
Crowdknitter Gold We love you. We add your name to the
list of our Golden Supporters on the Crowdknitting.com website, plus we offer
you the opportunity to use our marketplace free of charge (that means no fixed
costs or commissions on the items you sell through it).  Furthermore, you can choose a hand-knitted
garment from our Crowdknitting Store that we will have knitted for you and sent
to your address.
Press 
After 12 month from the launch of  Crowdknitting Social Network, we've had 2000 registered users, 22 Crowdknit Cafès all over Italy, we have been noticed by
some key national media. “A social network exclusively for
"knitters". Crowdknitting.com was born from the vision of four
passionate knitters who tapped into a lively and growing community, creating an
online (and offline) platform for them to share and meet.”

“...the Crowdknitting
project, which turns knitting into moments of sharing and a means of taking
back our cities through Yarn Bombing
- open-air exhibitions of collective knitted works of art.”

“From
now on, knitting lovers won't feel lonely any more. Actually, there is a social
network that has been thought specifically for them, it's called Crowdknitting. Its creators will be at next week's
Fuori Salone in Milan and, to tap into the high levels of creativity available
at the exhibition, they decided to show themselves in person to their
followers. They will be holding a small workshop called Knitting for Yarn
Bombing.” 

“The amazing show of innovation, starring twenty protagonists
from the Italian North-Eastern regions


«...  Crowdknitting
(from the English “crowd” and “knit”) is a social network for those who are
passionate about the traditional craft of knitting which has been created by a
team of Venetian friends ...  » 

CHE FUTURO! 
“Can you describe it in a tweet? It's the first Italian social network
entirely built around knitting and crochet lovers, as well as for those who
wish to approach these crafts.”

« ...  Yes, it is yet another social network, but this time
we are dealing with something really special. Try to imagine something that
acts like a bridge between past and future, between handmade and digital,
crafts and social platforms ...» 

« ... We happily give space to those promoted by our friends
of Crowdknitting, who gather knitting and yarn lovers to knit together and
produce works of art that are beautiful to look at and good for the spirit...»

« ...  If you still
don't know the new Crowd Knitting social network... Get to know it, take part!
Something is happening in the word of crafts, and we know it: you've been
constantly surprising us from September up until today...»

« ...  Their philosophy is to create job
opportunities, turning a passion into paid work. Their keywords are:
solidarity, community, to meet, exchange and share...»

«...  The event that truly impressed me  has certainly been the one regarding
“Crowdknitting”, something I didn't even know existed before, but that I found
has had a pretty good reception by the fashion, art and design worlds...»

«...  Alessandra Perdonello, Maria Cristina Pizzato
and Lucia Salvemini decided to invite all the users of their online community
to knit together, and this time off the web. ...» 
http://nova.ilsole24ore.com/tag/social-network 7th February 2014

Knitting and
sharing:   four friends
passionate about knitting and the social network they created and manage. This
is how Crowdknitting.com was born, behind this name the very idea of
intercepting the Italian community of knitting enthusiasts. Online discussion
for “knitters”, people who love knitting. Not only online. In fact, the
Crowdknitting team has been organizing “Crowdknit Cafes”, for years, which are
meetings to knit together.
How does the Crowdknitting Store
work?
1.  Our stylists design models to be produced;
these models will be sent to our knitters together with the necessary yarn to
realise them. 
2.  Every knitter knits the models in different
colours, every garment has its own identity card.
3.  The customer can choose an item from our shop
window; if the item is currently available, Crowdknitting Store will dispatch
it immediately; if it isn't available, it can be ordered and it will be
received within 30 days.
4.  The quality and conformity of the items is
guaranteed by the care with which we choose our designers and knitters.

Crowdknitting taps into its community to receive feedback and suggestions about
the models to be offered; these suggestions are crucial to creating a handmade
product whose quality is the highest possible.
You can find the Crowdknitting project on:
www.crowdknitting.com 
  
          
          
          
          
          




Other ways to help us
You can contribute to our
project also by sharing it with your friends and connections with the IndieGoGo
sharing tools.
Thank you for your time!

story:
5/29 UPDATE: Police Detectives closed the case last week (5/22). The car will not be returned to Shelly and she has no recourse to be compensated for her loss. These funds will be a huge blessing. We plan to purchase a car for her with these funds in the next week. Every dollar given will be used to help Shelly.

------------------------------------------

For those of you whose lives have been touched by Shelly Steenwyk, you are already aware that she is one of the kindest women you could know. Many of us have enjoyed her nurturing and loyal friendship for years, have been encouraged by her words and genuine smile. Shelly is a beloved administrative assistant at Anderson University and is actively involved with her local church. 

A couple of years ago, Shelly's life changed dramatically when she assumed the role of mother to foster children. As she expressed in a blog post, "If there is someone hurting, or in need, or broken, I can't pretend to not notice. I cannot be passive to pain and I certainly can't turn a blind eye to the modern day orphan anymore." We are full of admiration and hope because of Shelly's constant sacrifice and steadfast love for the children who call her mom. Life as a single foster parent presents many challenges, but Shelly continues to work hard to make it happen. (You can read in depth about her journey as a foster mom on her blog )

Here is one way we want to help:

On February 14, Shelly was heading up to the mountains with her sister for a birthday weekend.  While singing along to Pandora, a cop rolled up behind her with lights on. Having never been pulled over before, she was surprised when the officer asked her to get out of the car, patted her down, and then cuffed her. Apparently she was in possession of a stolen car. (Read about it in her words)

Though Shelly legally purchased her Hyundai Tucson 2 years ago for $4,800, possessed the car's title and registration, and was properly insured, her car was immediately impounded. Shelly and her sister were released at the scene to find their own way home. (A letter from Shelly's dad explains how she bought a stolen car without knowing it.)

Shelly is currently borrowing a car, and will not be reimbursed the money she spent buying it. Insurance is not going to cover anything because it was “pre-stolen.” Police say they've never had such a bizarre case like this and there's not much they can do.

We would like to bless our friend Shelly by raising money to buy her a another car. 5k is just a start--we’d love to raise even more to buy her something newer if possible. 

In the unlikely event that she does get some money back for the car (updated 5/29), extra monies will be used to help fix up her house (she has old windows that need to be replaced)--no funds will go unused! 

Please give generously to this deserving young lady. And pass this along to your friends. Every bit helps. Together we can pour out love on Shelly and her foster kids, just as she has poured out her love on us.

story:
What's the Story Mornin' Glory???

So... I’m a foodie.  This gluten free, soy free, dairy free thing is kinda tricky when you’re a foodie at heart.  But let me back up a little.

5 years ago my body rebelled.  I was in pain, and swollen, and exhausted... all the time.  They worked me up for bone cancer... multiple sclerosis... lupus... lyme disease... negative.

Thankfully :)

But, I still felt awful.  I couldn’t drag myself out of bed.  I hurt.  Everywhere.  Hugs from my kids... hurt.  My brain was foggy.  My body was swollen.  They finally settled on fibromyalgia... with IBS... with ADHD.... with depression. 

And they medicated me.  A lot.

For the next 3 years symptoms got worse, medications increased, and I gradually lost me.  I missed myself.  I missed my life.

Then I tried gluten free eating.

One week later most of my symptoms were gone.  3 weeks later the medication were gone.  All of them.  Kicked to the curb.  I had food testing done and discovered soy and dairy intolerance, too.  I sent them all packing.  After all, they weren’t very nice to me.

I felt alive again.  Sassy even :)

Which brings me here.  Baking yummy stuff... ‘cause I’m a foodie.  A complicated one, but a foodie none the less.  Everything I bake is food I miss... soft sandwich buns... chewy sugar cookies... bagels that feel like a bagel… thick pizza crust.

For the love of all that is awesome... REAL FOOD!

My hope is to bake more than just food for you, I hope together we can bring fun back into food.  When you have a food sensitivity, social events can be isolating.  You can’t share tapas, go in on a pizza, snitch a bite of pasta.  Food is no longer a source of social connection... you’re left on the sidelines of the dinner table, eating plain salad alone. 

My mission is to change all of that.  I envision a bakery and café that serves amazing gluten free and allergy friendly food so good everyone will want to share.  I envision an environment that will make you and your friends want to linger over a cinnamon roll.  A café where you can share a pizza and order anything from the bakery case.  A place where everyone will love the food, love the ambience, love the company, and people with food intolerances will feel safe and free to love food again.

So, now you know my long term vision and mission.  My goal is to be in a position by spring of 2015 to start looking for the perfect location.  I love the brick and wood buildings of Kalamazoo, where the floors creak just right and the ceilings are tall, where it’s big enough for a poetry slam stage, but small enough to hear the whisper of your best friend.

The next phase in this journey is to start producing a few products through a commercial kitchen.  Thankfully, Fair Food Matters in Kalamazoo supports a shared commercial kitchen which I am now a part of.  Pizza crust and soft sandwich buns will make their debut first to local restaurants and small grocery stores.  This phase will further establish the success we’ve enjoyed with our booth at the Farmers’ Market and help finance the next phases leading to a café.  Check out the photo gallery of this campaign!

I love that you’re here, reading this, wanting to share in this journey with me.  I love that I get to bake great food for people who have been missing their favorites.  I love when my customers take a bite and say… “Oh my gosh… this is gluten free??”  

I love my customers, I love great food, I love what I do.  You’re support helps me continue to do that, and helps me head to the next phase…. I can’t wait to get started!

The Details

This next phase includes producing pizza crust and soft sandwich buns in a commercial kitchen to supply local restaurants and small grocers.  We are looking for funding for the initial one-time expenses and three months of recurring expenses.  We’ll still move forward with this project if we don’t receive full funding, it will just be at a slower rate and a smaller scale than what we have currently planned.  If we receive an abundance of funding (we love you too!) we’ll be able to add more products to our commercial line up.

THE BUDGET :)

One-Time Expenses:

·  Pizza pans and Bun pans = $1070

·  Label design, printing and barcode purchase = $1250

·  Allergy testing and state inspection = $100

·  Product and Liability insurance = $800

·  IndieGoGo administration fees if fully funded (4%) = $344

·  IndieGoGo administration fees if not fully funded (9%) = $774

Monthly Expenses:

·  Kitchen Rental = $576 (this is an hourly rental, which will increase as we use the kitchen more)

·  Ingredients and packaging = $1450

·  Sampling and marketing = $125

Stretch Goals:

·  More funding will allow us to add Vegan Cinnamon Rolls to the lineup:

          o  Ingredients and packaging = $500 per month initially

          o  Kitchen rental = $250 per month initially


We've got some great perks for every level of donation!  Thank you so much for showing us some love!

    Risks & Challenges

    Of course every great journey has risks and challenges.  This adventure is no different.  There is always the risk that funding won't be achieved at a level to confidently move forward to the next phase.  I have an awesome support system and determination to realize my goals.  Smaller funding simply means slower growth.  

    There is also the risk of smaller demand for my products than projected.  Statistically, 1% of the population has celiac disease and up to 25% of the population has a food intolerance.  These statistics hold true to the number of customers I see at the markets.  I consistently hear from my customers that there is a great need for gluten free options in our region.  I want to meet that need.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Thank you so much for getting all the way to the end!!  I appreciate your interest and support.  Thanks for joining me on this journey, I couldn't do this without all of you.  We're offering some pretty cool perks for each level of donation!  There are other ways you can help too:

      ·  Share the link to this campaign on your Facebook page or other social media.

      ·  Spread the word about Free Love Bakery and our mission and vision.

      ·  Come say Hi at the Kalamazoo Farmers’ Market every Saturday and the 100 Mile Market every Wednesday evening.

      ·  Like our Facebook page www.facebook.com/freelovebakery.glutenfree to follow our progress!

story:
What's happened?

Earl Foolish is a small independent jewelry brand, based in Sweden but doing business worldwide. 

The company was formed in November 2013, and all tech going into the company was things that I already had, like a laptop, a drawing tablet and a printer. I had recently been considering investing in a new computer, a dedicated work computer, but I decided against it since there still isn't enough money in the business to leave room for that in the budget.

And then shit went down.

The 2011 MacBook Pro that has been the work horse in all this, crapped out. Google reveals that it is a common problem with that generation of the MBP, but Apple won't institute a replacement program and the only solution is to replace the logic board. (you can read more about these issues here).

I have an older replacement laptop that is decent for day to day use like staying on top of orders, checking emails, etc - but it's not cut out for any heavier work, and since all jewelry is designed in photoshop and illustrator, it's put a stop to the creative process. This right in the middle of my work on the upcoming collection for the fall/winter season 2014, as well as other projects. Not only that, but all work files, from jewelry designs to promotional material, is stuck on the harddrive of the broken down MBP with no other backups (my fault that, I know)

Okay so what's the deal

  • I need to extract the files from the MBP and replace the logic board
  • or alternatively look into a refurbished iMac to use as a dedicated work computer, if I can figure out how to restore the files without replacing anything.
  • ironically, the cost of replacing the logic board is about as much as it would cost to get a decent refurbished iMac.
  • If this campaign meets its goal, it will be enough to cover one of those things.

    What do I get out from this?

    There are several levels of perks for you if you contribute, for example sketch commissions and patches. None will be digital art or digital design, for obvious reasons. You can get cool custom things, and I get to save my business! Example photos can be found in the gallery.

      What if I don't have any spare cash?

      It's ok! I see stuff I wanna contribute all the time, but it's not always you're in a financial position where you'd feel comfortable doing that, or another cause might be more pressing. What you can do though is:

      • Signal boost the living hell out of this

And then shit went down.
The 2011 MacBook Pro that has been the work horse in all this, crapped out. Google reveals that it is a common problem with that generation of the MBP, but Apple won't institute a replacement program and the only solution is to replace the logic board. (you can read more about these issues here).
I have an older replacement laptop that is decent for day to day use like staying on top of orders, checking emails, etc - but it's not cut out for any heavier work, and since all jewelry is designed in photoshop and illustrator, it's put a stop to the creative process. This right in the middle of my work on the upcoming collection for the fall/winter season 2014, as well as other projects. Not only that, but all work files, from jewelry designs to promotional material, is stuck on the harddrive of the broken down MBP with no other backups (my fault that, I know)

   
Okay so what's the deal

I need to extract the files from the MBP and replace the logic board
or alternatively look into a refurbished iMac to use as a dedicated work computer, if I can figure out how to restore the files without replacing anything.
ironically, the cost of replacing the logic board is about as much as it would cost to get a decent refurbished iMac.
If this campaign meets its goal, it will be enough to cover one of those things.


  What do I get out from this? There are several levels of perks for you if you contribute, for example sketch commissions and patches. None will be digital art or digital design, for obvious reasons. You can get cool custom things, and I get to save my business! Example photos can be found in the gallery.
 

What if I don't have any spare cash? It's ok! I see stuff I wanna contribute all the time, but it's not always you're in a financial position where you'd feel comfortable doing that, or another cause might be more pressing. What you can do though is:

Signal boost the living hell out of this

story:
The Icarus Project is hard at work turning out new, lifesaving tools for folks facing emotional distress to heal ourselves and our communities (Mad Maps). We’re deepening our racial justice efforts and strengthening local leadership, all while broadening our grassroots fundraising strategies. We need the participation of people like YOU to sustain our movement at this critical, inspiring time!

Our Story:

Right now, you or someone you know and care about may be confronting experiences commonly labeled as mental illness. For some, mainstream strategies are effective. But far too many of us wind up alienated by mainstream responses, rather than feeling seen and supported. If you’re like us, you know someone, or many people, who have struggled to find care that resonates with their experiences, particularly if they’re a person of color, a woman, LGBTQTS-identified, disabled, or working class, among many other marginalized identities.

And we know that you, like us, want to see a world where everyone can be well, no matter their status, abilities, or identities.

You believe that alternatives are not just possible, but necessary.

So do we. At The Icarus Project, we’ve spent the past twelve years creating radical alternatives to the mental health mainstream. We’ve seen first hand how community support and tools like Mad Maps (described in the video above), can heal individuals, and how in turn individuals can transform the traumatizing conditions of their communities. And we need your help to keep making this life-saving work happen.

With 15,000+ members in our online communities, and 15 local chapters across the country, we have been a lifeline for thousands of people who feel stigmatized by conventional mental health approaches. We equip our membership with resources like Mad Maps - wellness documents that help chart out paths to healing - in ways that uplift mutual aid and self-determination.

Today, the Icarus Project is at an exciting and critical moment. Your contribution will help us to keep centering people of color in our leadership and confronting oppression within our movement, in a long-term decolonization process. With your support, our Mad Maps program will become more ambitious and more impactful than ever before. Inspired by participatory action research, Mad Maps are in part a collection and compilation of hundreds of our members’ strategies for navigating and improving on a mad world. And over the the next year, we will produce four Mad Map guides that examine the intersections between madness and issues of oppression, intergenerational trauma, personal experiences, and collective liberation. And we can’t do any of this without collaborators like you.

Your support will help us to research, produce, and print Mad Maps, and to enhance our other programs, especially capacity building for racial justice and community organizing work at the local level. As we move to a model of community investment and greater sustainability, and work to decolonize Icarus, we need your participation to ensure that Mad Maps - and all of our essential, life-changing programs - continue to thrive.

What You'll Get:

In addition to the knowledge that you’ve supported some vital, paradigm-shifting work, we’ve got a seriously fabulous selection of gifts in exchange for your contribution. We’ve got our beautifully illustrated, innovative resources like Navigating the Space between Brilliance and Madness, books from Icarus co-founders Jacks McNamara and Sascha Altman DuBrul, brand-new totebags, films, mixes - and a few other exciting rewards still in the works.

And don’t forget the recognition - for just $5 you’ll get a shout out on our Facebook page (nearly 5,000 members!), and for a $30 gift, you’ll have the option of receiving an original haiku on the theme of your choice. And all donors who contribute at least $10 will get their name in our Mad Maps compilation to thank you for helping to uplift radical mental health.

Other Ways to Help: 

  • Share this campaign - a little signal boost goes a long way! Please spread the word over email, Facebook, Twitter, and other social media, and use the tags #icarus2015 and #madmaps.

  • Host a potluck or bakesale - maybe you don’t have the money to make a contribution, but you have the space to raise it! Host a potluck, a movie night, or a plain old party, and ask guests to make a small donation towards our work.

  • Talk to friends or family members - especially if they’ve been impacted by mental health issues - about making a contribution.

  • Reach out to allied organizations about highlighting the campaign on their social media pages and websites

Where Your Donations Are Going:

We want to be as transparent as possible about what your donations are actually going to support. Each Mad Maps guide, 4 in all, will cost $2,750 to design and print, for a total of $11,000:

  • Design & Layout: $500
  • Artwork: $500
  • Editing: $250
  • Printing: $1,500
Additionally, we will be combining all 4 guides and releasing them in book form, slated for June of 2016. The design, editing, printing, and distribution costs total $4,000.

These figures don't incorporate the many hours of staff time that go into gathering information and transforming it into meaningful, cohesive guides, just the bare bones costs of getting them out into the world. We thank you for helping us to make these publications a reality!


Who We Are:

The Icarus Project is a support network, media project, and social change organization by and for people who experience the world in ways that are often diagnosed as mental illness. We advance social justice by fostering mutual aid practices that reconnect healing and collective liberation. We transform ourselves through transforming the world around us.


What We Want:

The Icarus Project seeks to overcome the limitations of a world determined to label, categorize, and sort human behavior. We envision a new culture that allows the space and freedom for exploring different states of being, and recognizes that breakdown can be the entrance to breakthrough. We aim to create a language that is so vast and rich that it expresses the infinite diversity of human experiences. We demand more options in understanding and navigating emotional distress and we want everyone to have access to these options, regardless of status, ability, or identity.

story:
Short Summary

Crohn's Awareness Project was started by Brad Watson-Davelaar in 2010. As a Crohn’s sufferer, Brad wanted to find a way to help those who struggle like he had for countless years. He started working on awareness for Crohn’s Disease, a condition he has suffered with for over 16 years, but quickly expanded his operation to bring awareness for all IBD sufferers. Fast forward four years and we bring you to A Night of Gut Busting Laughter presented by the Crohn’s Awareness Project! This is a dream come true for Brad.

With a bounding leap, he turned on the C.A.P. signal and his trusted band of sidekicks answered!

The Nitty Gritty

Crohn's Awareness Project is holding their fundraiser on November 2, 2014 to bring in funds to help Crohn's and Colitis Canada advance their research in finding a cure.

With your help we can give our supporters a night they won’t ever forget and offer you great rewards for helping us out. With a portion of the campaign funds we will finally be publishing our book, 'Tales from the Toilet Bowl'. Something we have been wanting to do for quite a while. Our higher tier donors will be receiving signed paperback copies of our Funnies book as a backer award along with a chance to get their name in the credits of the book!

With your contribution we can really make a difference. People with Crohn’s tend to suffer in silence and we would intend to change that. We want to educate people and improve the quality of life of those suffering from IBD.


    Our Impact

    Starting out as a small project to help bring education & awareness for all IBD sufferers, the Crohn's Awareness Project grew int a force for good. The Crohn's Awareness Project use their Funnies to help explain the everyday lives of an IBD sufferer. We pride ourselves in helping the community understand & deal with the everyday troubles they go through.

    We don't want to stop there! 

    A Night of Gut Busting Laughter is a step to something much larger. We have a long term plan that includes connecting with the community more. Brad always had the dream of helping out youths & those who are first diagnosed with IBD. It's a scary world to step into but Crohn's Awareness Project wants to be there to help people understand what they are dealing so they can live a productive life.


    Risks & Challenges

    In addition to raising funds to operate the fundraiser, we are also looking to raise money to help publish our Funnies book.  The years of hard work and creative thoughts put into this book are just waiting to be released to the public.  Without donations, this book might have to lie in the dark for a while longer as people yearn for its release.  The backs of toilets will remain barren while the book basket beside the toilet overflows with the dusty remains of Reader’s Digest long forgotten as the reader waits for the much anticipated arrival of their shiny new CAPS Funnies bathroom reading material!

    One of the biggest challenges with a small campaign like ours is getting the word out there.  With YOUR help, we can spread the word about this campaign, raise the funds we need, and raise awareness about conditions that have been locked behind kitchen pantries and bathroom doors for too long. Through your donations and sharing this campaign with your friends and families, we can also boost our ticket sales to make this the best birthday fundraiser ever!

    Overcoming the Dumps:

    In order to make this fundraiser as big of a success as we can, we are working together as a team to try and bring in as much local support as possible.  We have a very dedicated and hardworking group of local volunteers that vary in specialities ranging from artists, scholars, media and business managers.  But what matter more than any of that is our passion.  This project is very close to our hearts & our determination to see this through will see us overcome any hurdles that may try to slow us down.  But we know we aren’t invincible superheros and we need your help to make this possible.

      The C Team!

      Brad:

      Brad has been a crohn’s sufferer for 16 years. He never felt comfortable with sitting on the sidelines, always involved in one project or another to try & bring awareness to Crohn’s. An idea was brought to life that would focus on the power of laughter & how it can change peoples lives. Something happened over the short time that the Crohn’s Awareness Project was starting to grow. An experience that not only helped others heal but ultimately, it ended up helping Brad of all people.

      Dylan:

      A cartoon and art fanatic from birth, Dylan has been working as a freelance cartoonist since high school, adding animation to his roster after graduating with a Masters in Classical Animation from the Centre for Digital Imaging and Sound. Dylan has worked in studios around Vancouver doing everything from shadows and highlights on classically animated commercials to lead character Flash animation on such shows as Chaotic and Delilah and Julius. In addition, he has written and directed several short cartoons under his own banner, Outhouse Cartoons, including a feature length Flash animated film called The Case of the Midnight Murderer. He also writes and draws the web comic, Cowman.

      Byron:

      Currently working on his PhD from SFU in Communication, Byron is also on the board of directors for the Soong Ching Ling Children’s Foundation of Canada. It was through his passion for sharing media literacy for health & education awareness that he came to join The Crohn’s Awareness Project.

      Dave:

      David is a film editor who has been working in the animation industry for 8 years. He's worked on several animated feature films and is currently working on a new CG animated series of "Bob the Builder". David had never heard of Crohn's Disease until he met Brad 14 years ago. Over these years he's watched one of his best friends go through the ups and the many downs of Crohn's. He wanted to get involved with the Crohn's Awareness Project in order to bring people's attention to Crohn's and hopefully help people living with Crohn's.

      Brody:

      Hailing from the great prairie nation of Alberta, Brody comes to us with the purest of intentions and the strongest of wills! Organization and getting things done is one of Brody’s strong points. They work in the derby community supplying roller skates and gear to anyone who is interested in giving it a try. In their spare time Brody loves to watch movies and play games, but has found a new love for helping the members of C.A.P. get their message out there and succeed in anything that they set their minds to.

      Hollie:

      Coming all the way from Australia, Hollie has lived in Canada for a short time but that didn’t stop her from jumping on board with C.A.P. Hollie is a professionally trained pastry chef with a giant spatula and a giant heart. She never hesitates to stand up for what she believes in, and in this case she believes that Crohns and Colitis need a voice too. Such a valuable member of the team.

      Annie:

      Majoring in Speech Language Pathology, Annie loves helping people out. When she heard that Brad needed help with his fundraiser she jumped at the opportunity to get in there and spread the word. Leaping short dog houses in a single bound, and running faster than a speeding iguana, she wows people with her linguistic skills and makes them bend to her will with her grammatical super powers!


      Help us Community, You're our Only Hope

      Crohn’s Awareness Project can use your help in more ways than just financially! Awareness is the name of the game. Help us spread the word through social media & health groups. Let your friends & family know. That person standing behind you in the coffee line, give them a heads up.  Share our campaign with your friends on FB, email it to your bestie, tweet us @capbc, the possibilities are endless with how you can help us make this a success.  Help make a difference!  Help spread the word!

      Perk Update:

      Crohn's Awareness Project Pins from Maggielena!
