story:
We started out with a dream to keep bees and a great old friend gave us the tools to do just that. We started with one single hive and have grown to 5 hives. It doesn't seem like a whole lot of growth, but for us, small has been better. We maintain the health and happiness of our hives by natural means and never introduce unnatural weirdness into our hives via feed or medication for any reason. That does not mean we do not feed our bees in the fall or whenever they need it and that also does not mean we don't medicate our hives if they catch a cold...it just means we use natural methods; feeding them sugar syrup or honey they produced the season before and treating them with essential oils and other preventative methods that benefit the bees when they are ill.  Our bees and other fabulous busy little pollinators are free to graze on our wide variety of fruit producing trees, various berry bushes and plants, medicinal wildflowers, veggie blossoms and herbs. Our love of bees and all things natural brought us to realize the amazing health benefits of honey and other hive products both internally and on the surface of our skin which in turn led us to learn the different medicinal properties of the herbs and flowers our bees were foraging upon.  All of our growing practices are done without the use of insecticides, pesticides, herbicides or any kind of harmful chemicals for that matter  so our bees are happy and healthy!!!  Our love also led us to realize just how important bees and other pollinators are to life on Earth!  Honey bees account for 80% of all insect pollination; without such pollination we would see a dramatic decline in the available fruits and vegetables that depend on pollinators.  We have already began to see such a decline due to the ever declining numbers of healthy bees. This is due largely to our defunct agricultural system that is poisoning our ecosystems with pesticides and other harmful substances.

It is up to us and the new generations to come to build up the health of our environment and to overhaul our agriculture system to ensure the livlihood of all pollinators.  

Here at Dancing Bee we are striving to do just that! If we are able to raise the funds needed to purchase a 40 acre plot of land we will be able to research more apicentric methods of beekeeping, expand our knowledge and practice agroecological methods of farming!

We will be able to build facilities  that will house education centers that schools can visit to not only learn about honey bees and eco-friendly sustainable farming but also satisfy their required science curriculum!

Right now we are on 5 vertical acres; only a portion of them usable due to the simple fact that they are vertical acres and heavily timbered.  With more space we will be able to plant orchards upon orchards of naturally grown sustainable fruit trees for our honey bees to feast upon without being exposed to harmful substances and pair those trees with wild flowers and other naturally occuring plants to help maintain a healthy ecosystem.  We will have the means to grow fields of organic heirloom veggies to share with low-income families and long term nursing facilities.  We will have the space to utilize wind mills and solar panels to power our buildings.  We will be able to hold festivals celebrating our pollinators! We will have a safe place for people to visit; the worry of coming into contact with pesticides or herbicides will not be there! We will be able to give more homes to honey bees that might otherwise be sprayed.  We have become known in our small community to be the ones to call if here is a swarm in the area or a colony that has rooted itself in the walls of a home; they trust we will do all that we can to ensure the survival of those bees. We will have a place that will be a positive impact on our community!  We have many programs to help put fruit trees and raw honey in the hands of local families.  Fruit trees and Honey bees are an amazing gift of nature that support not only healthy living and self-sufficiency/ self-reliance but can also give you a satisfied sense of self-independence from 100% dependence on large box stores and reward you with the pride and satisfaction that comes with that.  Planting fruit trees and following agroeconomic and apicentric practices ensures food independence for future generations long after we are gone and can serve as a remembrance and our foresight to our kids and grand kids as they walk and enjoy the fruits of their labor.  My kids will walk with their kids and pick fruit from the trees we planted together long after we are gone and there is an indescribable feeling of security that comes with that.  It could be the best investment you ever make; an investment in yourself, in the Earth, in our pollinators, and in future generations. The best time to plant and grow is 10 years ago and today.  

As a big thank you we are offering perks! These perks come from our apiary! They are produced by the people and bees of Dancing Be Apiary right here in Eatonville, Washington! We are as organic as nature allows! So you are guaranteed products free from harmful chemicals and other unnatural weirdness and produced and harvested using organic means! All materials and ingredients we are not able to grow ourselves are purchased from local businesses who's mottos on organic and sustainable farming mirror that of our own! It is important to us that we provide you with only the most healthful products because as we always say "You are what you eat and healthy bellies feed healthy minds!"

And please remember...just because you cannot make a monetary donation does not mean you can't contribute to our cause! The power of word-of-mouth is an amazing thing!!! So SHARE SHARE SHARE!!!

In the event we are unable to reach our goal, 100% of the funds will go into an interest bearing account where they will patiently await the day when they are put towards the end goal!
story_txt:
We started out with a dream to keep bees and a great old friend gave us the tools to do just that. We started with one single hive and have grown to 5 hives. It doesn't seem like a whole lot of growth, but for us, small has been better. We maintain the health and happiness of our hives by natural means and never introduce unnatural weirdness into our hives via feed or medication for any reason. That does not mean we do not feed our bees in the fall or whenever they need it and that also does not mean we don't medicate our hives if they catch a cold...it just means we use natural methods; feeding them sugar syrup or honey they produced the season before and treating them with essential oils and other preventative methods that benefit the bees when they are ill.  Our bees and other fabulous busy little pollinators are free to graze on our wide variety of fruit producing trees, various berry bushes and plants, medicinal wildflowers, veggie blossoms and herbs. Our love of bees and all things natural brought us to realize the amazing health benefits of honey and other hive products both internally and on the surface of our skin which in turn led us to learn the different medicinal properties of the herbs and flowers our bees were foraging upon.  All of our growing practices are done without the use of insecticides, pesticides, herbicides or any kind of harmful chemicals for that matter  so our bees are happy and healthy!!!  Our love also led us to realize just how important bees and other pollinators are to life on Earth!  Honey bees account for 80% of all insect pollination; without such pollination we would see a dramatic decline in the available fruits and vegetables that depend on pollinators.  We have already began to see such a decline due to the ever declining numbers of healthy bees. This is due largely to our defunct agricultural system that is poisoning our ecosystems with pesticides and other harmful substances.
It is up to us and the new generations to come to build up the health of our environment and to overhaul our agriculture system to ensure the livlihood of all pollinators.  
Here at Dancing Bee we are striving to do just that! If we are able to raise the funds needed to purchase a 40 acre plot of land we will be able to research more apicentric methods of beekeeping, expand our knowledge and practice agroecological methods of farming!
We will be able to build facilities  that will house education centers that schools can visit to not only learn about honey bees and eco-friendly sustainable farming but also satisfy their required science curriculum!

Right now we are on 5 vertical acres; only a portion of them usable due to the simple fact that they are vertical acres and heavily timbered.  With more space we will be able to plant orchards upon orchards of naturally grown sustainable fruit trees for our honey bees to feast upon without being exposed to harmful substances and pair those trees with wild flowers and other naturally occuring plants to help maintain a healthy ecosystem.  We will have the means to grow fields of organic heirloom veggies to share with low-income families and long term nursing facilities.  We will have the space to utilize wind mills and solar panels to power our buildings.  We will be able to hold festivals celebrating our pollinators! We will have a safe place for people to visit; the worry of coming into contact with pesticides or herbicides will not be there! We will be able to give more homes to honey bees that might otherwise be sprayed.  We have become known in our small community to be the ones to call if here is a swarm in the area or a colony that has rooted itself in the walls of a home; they trust we will do all that we can to ensure the survival of those bees. We will have a place that will be a positive impact on our community!  We have many programs to help put fruit trees and raw honey in the hands of local families.  Fruit
trees and Honey bees are an amazing gift of nature that support not only healthy living and
self-sufficiency/ self-reliance but can also give you a satisfied sense of self-independence
from 100% dependence on large box stores and reward you with the pride and satisfaction
that comes with that.  Planting fruit
trees and following agroeconomic and apicentric practices ensures food independence for future generations long after we are
gone and can serve as a remembrance and our foresight to our kids and grand
kids as they walk and enjoy the fruits of their labor.  My kids will walk with their kids and pick
fruit from the trees we planted together long after we are gone and there is an
indescribable feeling of security that comes with that.  It could be the best investment you ever make; an investment in yourself, in the Earth, in our pollinators, and in future generations. The best time to plant and grow is 10 years ago and today.  
As a big thank you we are offering perks! These perks come from our apiary! They are produced by the people and bees of Dancing Be Apiary right here in Eatonville, Washington! We are as organic as nature allows! So you are guaranteed products free from harmful chemicals and other unnatural weirdness and produced and harvested using organic means! All materials and ingredients we are not able to grow ourselves are purchased from local businesses who's mottos on organic and sustainable farming mirror that of our own! It is important to us that we provide you with only the most healthful products because as we always say "You are what you eat and healthy bellies feed healthy minds!"
And please remember...just because you cannot make a monetary donation does not mean you can't contribute to our cause! The power of word-of-mouth is an amazing thing!!! So SHARE SHARE SHARE!!!
In the event we are unable to reach our goal, 100% of the funds will go into an interest bearing account where they will patiently await the day when they are put towards the end goal!

story:
UPDATE!

After reaching our goal in a mere 3 days, thanks to unprecedented support from our friends and followers of our work, we realised the potential to raise more money to bring our end goal of equipping ourselves for more types of jewellery production that bit closer was very much within our grasp. Rather than editing the mission statement we started out with, here is an update of what we are hoping to raise and what it will be put towards!
We are now aiming to raise $1500. The final goal is to be fully equipped with tools and materials with which to begin production of sterling silver jewellery, alongside our upcoming copper collection. The additional $800 will be allocated as follows:
- $450 will be used to buy in a decent bench tool selection. This will by no means be entirely comprehensive but it will certainly be a strong starting point and more than enough to enable us to make a start on our jewellery and altar tool collection.
- $200 will be used to buy in soldering equipment.
- $ 150 will be used to buy in a small amount of silver with which to begin making.
We could set our goal higher and list off countless items we could certainly use, but we do not wish to work our business that way. The whole idea of this campaign is to afford the kit to enable us to produce new products, the profits of which will then be used to expand our business and our product line. We have built up what we have from the ground so far and intend to continue expanding and growing through hard work and giving back. So, once again, any help we can garner will be much appreciated! Thank you so much for taking the time to read about our campaign and what we do. We appreciate it more than you could ever imagine.

Short Summary

Hi!

We are a husband and wife small business specialising in beautiful, magical and functional handmade and natural items. From candles to crystals, incenses to spell kits, we cater to an array of different needs. Whether you need altar or ritual supplies, wonderful, high quality crystal and mineral specimens, or even just beautifully scented, handmade candles to enrich your home, we have it all!

We often receive requests to add jewellery to our product list, and with a background in jewellery design and manufacture, it is something we are passionate about and keen to bring to our business. As we are building our business up from nothing, we need to find funding in order to add new product lines to our repertoire that require special equipment to make. We are looking to buy in an electroplating system, tools, chemicals, precious metals and gems to work with in order to breathe life into our vision of beautiful, unusual and functional jewellery, in keeping with our existing product line.

With any money we raise from this campaign, we intend to buy in the equipment we need in order to make this dream a reality. The ability to revive our passion for jewellery design and manufacture, add a new facet of creative expression to our business and open the door to many new and beautiful products not just limited to jewellery would mean the absolute world to us and, we hope, our customers as well. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have worked out exactly what we need to get started. The amount we have decided to aim for is $700. This will go towards the following:

  • Electroplating system and tools- $300
  • Materials, findings and packaging supplies- $200
  • Crystals and minerals to work with beyond what we already have in stock- $200
Our goal is to buy in the equipment we need in order to start making jewellery using some of our favourite materials such as copper (for its health benefits and magical properties), crystals and semi-precious gemstones. We eventually wish to incorporate sterling silver, gold and precious gemstones as well but we are starting out with the basics in order to establish ourselves and work our way up from there. Once we start selling our initial creations, we will use the profits from those to buy in more equipment, training and materials.
We have put together a list of very exciting perks for our contributors. We have numerous discount code options for anyone who might like to do a bit of shopping in our Etsy store, including a 10% code that never expires! We have taken some of our most popular products and services and added extras to them or set a special Indiegogo campaign lower price, and we have decided that our very first 10 pieces of copper and natural crystal jewellery that we make will be super limited edition exclusives, just for those who buy the jewellery perk. We are particularly excited about that one.
Any funds we raise via this campaign will go towards our jewellery project, so even if we do not reach our goal of $700, we will still use the proceeds that we do take to buy in the equipment and materials required. Our goal is set at this amount so that we can afford to buy in the things we need to make an immediate start. Of course, if all goes well and we end up reaching, or even exceeding, our goal, we will buy in everything we need right away. If we do exceed our goal, we will be able to start moving on to the other materials that we plan to add in future that little bit quicker.

The Impact

Our project represents something extremely important, not just to us but also to our customers and contributors for a number of reasons. First and foremost, small businesses are a vital addition to the economy. By supporting small businesses, you are ensuring that creatives and professionals who choose to go the route of small business self-employment are able to continue offering their products and services to the world and support themselves and their communities by doing so. In a market dominated by mass produced, soulless, disposable products, handmade, carefully and lovingly produced items supplied by independent companies, artists and designers are a valuable and desirable addition to the marketplace, both online and on the high street.
This is our first foray into the world of crowd funding and we are excited to see how it turns out. Your support is greatly appreciated and we are keen to make a start on our project and begin delivering the products that we are working on and that people are asking us for. As a husband and wife team that relies on our business to support ourselves and our ever growing animal family, we are immeasurably grateful to those who choose to patronise our business and cannot express how much every purchase, custom order and commission means to us.

Risks & Challenges

We know that a campaign such as this is not without its risks and we are also extremely aware that we are only two people, doing everything that we can to deliver our products and our promises in a timely and professional manner.
We foresee a lot of work ahead of us with this campaign, not least in delivering the perks that we have put together for our contributors. We have tried to be as realistic as possible with our estimated delivery times for the perks that we will be sending out, be it physically or via email, but we would like to take this opportunity to say that occasionally there are unforeseen delays. As such a small business, we rely on other, larger companies for small batches of supplies that we buy in in order to make our items. Occasionally we are at their mercy if they are out of what we need etc. Though this is seldom an issue, it has happened and it has a knock-on effect through us, to our customers. For the sake of transparency and honesty, we wish to make it known that though we have an extremely good track record (we maintain a 5-star rating on our chosen selling platform), we are only two people working non-stop to deliver our goods and occasionally there are small delays. We pride ourselves on our fast communication and our openness so we encourage you to message us if you have any questions or concerns at any point along the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! If you wish to help us out but cannot afford to make a contribution to our campaign, please consider the following:

  • Get the word out to your friends! Tell people about our campaign! Use the hashtag #houseofildjewels to talk about what we're trying to do. Facebook, twitter, tumblr, instagram... it's all good and it all helps.
  • Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you SO much for reading. Please let us know what you think, whether you choose to contribute or not!

story:
Why We Need Your Support

On November 8th, Typhoon Haiyan hit and became one of the world's most powerful typhoons as it affected a total of 9.5 million people across the Philippines -- and displaced at least 600,000 -- when it slammed into the country.  There are still millions dealing with the effects of the emotional wounds that the devastation caused.  

TRE® can help these survivors start to heal from the emotional trauma of Typhoon Haiyan.

To help address this reality, TRE® is heading to the Philippines to assist Typhoon Hayain Survivors. Chris Balsley, TRE® Level III Trainer is leading an international team of volunteers to Manila to offer TRE® trainings to local relief workers and aid workers. Chris Balsley earned his TRE® Level III certification working directly with David Berceli and TRE® International.  Prior to that he worked as a trainer providing programming on stress and resilience to the U.S military. 

What is TRE® and how can it help Typhoon Haiyan survivors?  

TRE®, Tension and Trauma Releasing Exercises was invented by Dr. David Berceli as a type of trauma treatment modality and can be helpful for reducing stress and tension, but used most widely for sufferers of PTSD, post traumatic stress disorder.

Help TRE® do what it was intended for- providing outreach to those affected by natural disasters. 

How You Can Help

  • We need funds for travel expenses, local housing and in-country food allowance for our TRE® volunteer trainers that will be there to assist. 
  • We also need funds for:  TRE® booklets, t- shirts to identify the TRE® team, water, yoga mats, and space to conduct the TRE® sessions.

What You Get

The perks that we are offering are:  

  • $25, E-mail updates of the trip and you will be given a personal thank you on Facebook.
  • $50, TRE® will friend your personal Facebook page and will be followed on TRE®'s Twitter page.  
  • $100, A signed copy of Dr. David Berceli's The Revolutionary Trauma Release Process will be mailed to you.  
  • $250, A private TRE® session with Chris Balsley via Skype and a personal thank you card from Dr. David Berceli.  
  •  $500, A month of Executive Coaching with Chris Balsley and a personal thank you call from Dr. David Berceli. 

Your Impact

Be a part of something greater than yourself!  Help someone that you will never even meet.  

  • You can be a valuable part of helping the Typhoon Haiyan survivors recover from the psychological and emotional wounds caused by the natural disaster.  
  • Join the movement and help TRE® be one step close towards its vision where all people have access to this amazing self- help, self regulating method that can reduce the devastating effects of stress, anxiety and trauma!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out- calling out loud mouths! 

  • We understand everyone can't contribute, so we ask that you get the word out and help us make some noise about the campaign.  
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter!.

story:
Rayford's parents are retired and partly depended on him to make ends meet.  They are having a difficult time covering the cost associated with his funeral arrangements.  I wanted to give everyone that asked to help out, a small - yet very concrete - way of helping his family get through this extremely painful time.  Any amount you can pitch in will be deeply appreciated.  The family is having his body cremated and there will be a small ceremony here in NYC and one in Avon Park/Sebring FL.

I'm coordinating this with his family as per their wishes.  If you have any questions, you can reach out to me directly.  323.691.7467.  Thank you again for all your kind words.  This is a very painful time for all of us.

story:
This is a fundraiser for Cindy Hines Fatino. Here is whats going on with her in her own words, 

"On April 16th a lump formed on my left shoulder. This was really not unusual for me, every time I get sick with a cold or strep, my lymph nodes tend to swell. Throughout the evening the lump kept growing and growing, I got a little worried, but didn't panic. 

On Wednesday April 17th, my PCP was not in the office, so I chose to go to a Urgent Care first thing in the morning. The doctor there told me there was "nothing worry about", but she wanted a sonogram just in case. The sonogram was inconclusive, so I visited my PCP the next day, who suggested a CT scan of my neck to see what was going on ... so 4 hours later I was in the imaging suite, having a neck CT. The nurses told me that I was to wait in the facility until a radiologist read the scan (at this point ... I began to worry). Once the scan was read, my PCP asked to speak with me in person at which time he told me ... we need to get a needle biopsy. 

Early the following week a needle biopsy of the left lymph node and a full body CT were performed. Exactly 1 week later, I went to the surgeons office for the results and hear the horrifying news, "Ms. Hines, you have Non-Hodgkin s Lymphoma" . NOT WHAT I WAS EXPECTING. In that moment everything changed."

Cindy has been fighting cancer for months now and is currently getting her stem cells harvested and is being prepped for a bone marrow transplant to happen soon. 

This Fundraiser is to help Cindy pay for the ever increasing medical bills associated with her fight against cancer.

story:
Welcome to the Campaign! 

Hey, this is the Cappy’s Team- the coaches and staff at Cappy’s Boxing Gym in Seattle, Washington. Our training program has produced Olympic caliber athletes and made us local legends for our work in helping everyday community members transform their lives. Youth boxers, fitness boxers, recreational boxers and competitive boxers have all found a home with us. Cappy's Boxing Gym is more than a place to workout, we generate power for the community. People come to the gym to learn how to communicate more effectively, to relieve stress, to become better parents, to strive for personal growth in a safe and welcoming environment. 

It’s always been a challenge to run a small boxing gym and the summer is the most difficult time. We want you to know we need your help in order to stay open through the summer months. This gym belongs to everyone- all the boxers, community members, and boxing enthusiasts- let’s keep it open.

What We Need & What You Get

The $15,000.00 we’re asking for will ensure that the gym will still be open in the Fall of 2014 for the celebration of our 15th anniversary. 2013 has been year of transition for Cappy’s. As a team, we’ve made important changes to how the business runs. We’ve added classes, trained a new coach, upgraded our technology, added a brand new life coaching program.

 We feel these changes are going to take us to the next level as a business but we need some time for them to take effect. Unfortunately, the summer months can be very slow for the gym and without your help, we may not make it. 

Giving us your support is going to be fun! We have some awesome perks to share with you. 

  • Special 15th anniversary celebration gear including t-shirts, zip up hoodies, caps, and workout bags. 
  • Looking for legendary status, we’ll put your name on the back of our special t shirts that everyone will be wearing. 
  • For people who love experiences, there are plenty of perks for you. We have personal coaching sessions, group workouts, and guided adventures. 
  • And for all of you who love to give back more than you love getting, we’re offering the opportunity for you to sponsor neighborhood youth who want to learn the sweet science.

The Cappy's Impact

One of Cappy’s mottos is “Boxing is for Everyone”. When you support Cappy’s, you support an environment where all people are safe and welcome to come train towards the goal of transforming their lives. Check out our video with testimonials from real clients who talk about how much they value this business. When you support Cappy’s, you also support a business that invests in its employees through on-the-job training, health care, and personal empowerment. Cappy’s impact doesn’t stop at its doors. Community outreach is just another way to express our passionate commitment to the health and well being of our society. Caring for our clients, empowering our employees and investing in the community is Cappy’s most powerful 1-2-3 punch combination. 

Other ways to help: Be in our Corner...

We’re incredibly grateful for your support. Those of you who can give, please do. The reality is that small businesses depend on money. Those of you who can’t give support in that way, we need your help too. Spread the word! Businesses like Cappy’s depend on local community support and on the network of friends and family that you already know.

story:
Our Story 

At the first Mama G’s Thanksgiving Street Dinner in 2009, we were shocked by the overwhelming number of people who lined up for a meal. There were fewer than four turkeys to go around and we ran out of food in less than an hour. We decided then that we would commit ourselves to never letting anyone go hungry, especially around Thanksgiving. And that’s what we’ve been doing - with your help - for the past five years. 

Through the generosity of friends from near and far, Mama G's has grown into an annual celebration that brings people from all backgrounds, experiences, and neighborhoods in San Francisco together to share a warm, thanksgiving meal in the unlikeliest but humanist of places - the streets. This year we will be celebrating our 6th anniversary and hitting the streets once again on Sunday, November 23rd. 

    The Impact

    Each year Mama G’s Thanksgiving Street Dinner reaches out to the poor and marginalized, hungry and homeless among us. Since 2009, we have served close to a thousand people a warm, nutritious, Thanksgiving meal in the heart of one of San Francisco’s most underserved neighborhoods – the Tenderloin.

    We provide a balanced, nutritious, dietary friendly meal to everyone who needs it. Many of those at our table haven't had a warm meal in weeks or months. Many do not have access to a diet rich in greens or vegetables. This is why what we do matters.

    We believe in the goodness of each person who comes to our table. We care about our community's health and well-being. And because of this, our volunteer and support base has more than quadrupled since 2009. We have continued to serve and reach more people in need each year. On average we serve over 200 people each Thanksgiving. 

    What We Need & What You Get

    Our annual street dinner is 100% funded by community members and friends of Mama G's. This is truly a grass-roots movement. We have had donors contribute from as far as Washington D.C. and as local as Golden Gate Ave. 

    This year, we are hoping to raise over $1,500. Will you help us reach our goal? 

    A donation to Mama G's supports a local, community-based idea addressing a growing issue facing San Francisco - hunger. Every dollar donated goes towards purchasing turkeys, stuffing, mashed potatoes, salad, bread, cranberry sauce and all of the staples you expect and appreciate at your Thanksgiving table each November. In addition, your donation covers the overhead costs associated with planning and executing an urban street dinner.

    Any additional funds collected above and beyond the bottomline needs of our event are donated directly back to Tenderloin community organizations such as St. Anthony's Foundation, Glide Memorial Church, and Project Open Hand who proivde warm meals to those in need everyday throughout the year. 

    Every dollar donated builds hope in our community. Thank you for considering a donation to our event. Without your generosity, we could not do the work that we do each year.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      • Share this donation page with friends or family.
      • Like our Facebook page or Follow us on Twitter!  
      • Offer us a recipe of your favorite Thanksgiving dish. 
      • Cook your favorite Thanksgiving dish and bring it to our table on Nov. 23rd or serve as volunteer on the day of the event. Interested? Contact us.

story:
***Thank you for any donation, large or small, that you can give!***

(If all of my Facebook friends donated just $1, I would exceed my goal!) :-)


My name is Jennifer Rivas (aka Marshall) and I have a deep passion for volunteering. In the past, I have donated my time for at local nursing homes, participating in environmental restoration projects on San Nicolas Island, read names for the traveling Vietnam Wall, raised money for numerous organizations through running 5Ks, delivered for the home delivered meals program at the Santa Clarita Senior Center, and have worked tirelessly to rescue shelter dogs in Southern California. Working with non governmental organization The Real Uganda is a fulfilling and rewarding experience for me, and I hope for the children as well! Last years visit was one of the highlights of my life and I felt so fortunate to spend time with all the amazing kids who live at the orphanage!

I have paid for the majority of my trip through my savings. With buying the plane ticket, insurance, immunizations, volunteer placement, required police check and purchase of required supplies (mosquito net, several cans of bug repellant with DEET, weather and culturally appropriate attire) I still have some items I would like to purchase for teaching!  Additionally, I want to make an extra donation to the orphanage through buying additional supplies once I get to Uganda. The supplies can be purchased cheaper in East Africa and donating items over money is preferable.

Last year my generous donors were able to fund uniforms for the ENTIRE school! The power of working together brings tears to my eyes!!!

***The children will appreciate it and your generosity means so much***

story:
WHO WE ARE

The Ugandan Women Entrepreneurs Association Limited (UWEAL) has spent 25 years supporting women entrepreneurs, and women leaders for a better Uganda. Our mission is to empower women entrepreneurs to create wealth through capacity building, networking and advocacy. Our vision is to envisage a wealthy woman responsibly contributing to national economic development.

UWEAL offers training, mentorship and business counseling services. We also organize various networking events such as business exchange visits, exhibitions, seminars, business forums and conferences locally, regionally and internationally to facilitate knowledge and experience sharing in addition to advocating for a favorable environment for women to do business.

In Uganda, agriculture is the biggest sector of the economy, and women farmers play an important part in it.  To excel in their essential role of food production and grow their livelihoods, they need support and training. Working with these businesswomen farmers, we have identified several of their needs:

  • Access to training on national regulations to access farming resources; 
  • Training done in their local languages and in English;
  • Training on broader business topics such as gender and cultural norms, and leadership; 


 "8 times out of 10, the farmer feeding the nation is a woman". 

Most of the food in Uganda is produced by women, but women rarely have the opportunity or the necessary resources to turn their skill into a profitable business. While women support their households and their communities through agriculture, this important contribution has not been recognized at the national level. 

OUR PROJECT

As part of its activities, UWEAL has been carrying out a Leadership, Entrepreneurship and Development (LED) training program across the country targeting women in agriculture for the past one year. Participants in the program receive training and coaching in business, collective marketing and leadership development. During this 3-day training, Ugandan women farmers learn how:  

  • To transition from subsistence farming to commercial farming; 
  • To fully access and utilize government agricultural resources and services; 
  • To form farming groups for collective marketing and increased productivity. 

We have so far successfully trained 140 women in 7 districts. The partnership which facilitated these trainings is coming to an end with the funding it came with. However, we have received tremendous feedback from farmer participants after the trainings. They appreciated UWEAL’s ability to translate news and regulations on agriculture in a more accessible manner, thanks to  local trainers who are both experienced and able to speak the local languages. They also reported increased knowledge in farming practices and they felt more confident as professional farmers. Finally, women farmers took advantage of the training to build relationships and plant the seeds for future cooperatives.

There are 111 districts in Uganda and our goal is to organize trainings in all of them. We need additional funds to reach more women in agriculture, build their capacity, and continue our initiative. We already see how these women are improving their leadership skills and are able to stand for their economic rights.


WHAT WE NEED

We are asking for $27,000 to fund this project. After running the program for a year, we have estimated that it costs $4500 to train 25 women farmers in one district. Our plan, for 2015, is to reach 6 new districts; 

The budget is allocated as follow: 

  • Trainers fee: $1,600
  • Venue hire for 3 days (includes room, meals for staff, trainers and women farmers) : $1600
  • Transportation for whole training team and staff: $700
  • Training material for 25  women: $600

As we hold these trainings, we are also engaged in continuous advocacy efforts to bring light to the conditions of women farmers in Uganda, working with other non-profit partners and government agencies. We are looking to influence legislation to bring more equal support to women farmers.

The IMPACT

The participation in the training has shown great results so far; women farmers have had the opportunity:

  • To refresh their farming knowledge
  • To learn new and innovative farming practices;
  • To meet other women farmers and share their experiences;
  • To improve their leadership skills as entrepreneurs.

We see our training as a way to create real and durable change in Uganda. Women becoming empowered have a direct impact on several levels.

On an economic level, more women farmers entering in commercial agribusiness will increase food production, and by the same opportunity, food security for the country. 

In Uganda, women are in charge of taking care of the family, and it is estimated that on average each family counts 7 members. In most cases, their subsistence depends solely on the success of the woman farmer. We therefore see these dependents as directly and positively impacted by these changes. The associated financial security for rural women leads to notable improvements in the well being of their families regarding their children’s health and education.

On an individual level, gaining access through training to innovative approaches and awareness of state regulations, and the resulting increase of their production and therefore business power, reinforces the women farmers’ standing in their communities. Financial autonomy plays an important role for women’s decision making abilities. Already acting as family support, they also now have a safe space to exercise their leadership qualities. Women who participate in our training recommend it to other women farmers and start organizing in farming groups to better address common issues in their industry.

We believe our training is an essential public service allowing women farmers to access public resources, to play their part in the economy of their country, and become full citizens. 

Risks & Challenges

Several risks exist inherent to the management of nonprofit organizations.

Staff turnover could cause some delays in the roll out of the training. We however have board members who are deeply committed to our mission,  are women farmers but also advocates working with the government to change policy at the country level. They are a sure resource for our participants to receive accurate information and professional counseling regarding farming practices, business creation and management and advocacy related questions.

As of now, the main risk we foresee is not being able to reach our fundraising goal and continue such a promising initiative. We see this risk being suffered by the women farmers who will be left with very few opportunities to receive the individual support they get through our intervention. As we mentioned before, Uganda has 111 districts and we have already began receiving invitations from other districts to train women farmers in their areas.  Funding this campaign is only the start of a long but encouraging process. If we surpass our fundraising goal, we will be able to include more districts. If however, we fall short, we will still run the project for a smaller number of participants and districts. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

As of now, we are not able to provide merchandise perks for your donation. It would be too costly for us to ship goods individually to all our supporters. We are nonetheless grateful for all the support to our campaign and each contributor will receive a personal thank you email. 

Help us spread the word about this campaign about women's economic empowerment in Uganda! Share it with your friends and family! Let us know if you have ideas about how to better serve Ugandan women farmers; if you have expertise in this field, feel free to contact us as well.

story:
My name is Matt Anderson and I started a skull cleaning and mounting business here in Wisconsin from scratch. I grew up in Montana and have always had a passion for both art and animals and that approach is what I bring to my skull cleaning and mounting business. I don't want to go the traditional route with securing financing from a bank and putting myself in a hole, but I do need a bit more than I currently have to get this thing off the ground. I started my business as a partnership and my partner is getting out so I have to completely shift how I do the process if it is going to continue. 


Where the money will go

I am looking to turn my business into a mobile platform using an old horse trailer that I will insulate and wire with electrical to run my skull cleaning business. Roughly half of the $2000 that I asking for will go to purchasing an old horse trailer. The remaining money will go toward insulating and wiring and setting up a workstation inside of the trailer. 


    The Impact

    My entire philosophy with my business is turning animal mounts into works of art. I love how aesthetically pleasing a really clean, white skull looks displayed on the wall. I have come up with a system that will allow me to simultaneously have up to twenty skulls cleaning at one time. Your help will allow this business to grow and continue to exist. 


      Risks & Challenges

      I think this is a pretty straightforward plan. I work at Home Depot and have access to people with all of the necessary skills to help make a safe and secure mobile workspace while re-purposing an old trailer. 

      You can check out my business website at www.classicskulls.com

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for checking out our campaign! I guess we should introduce ourselves and our idea:

  • Helder Hills is the name that myself (Casey) and my partner (Justin) have come up with for the name of our soon-to-be alpaca farm. I grew up on a beef farm in rural Ontario and have an Agricultural High Skills Major on my side, so I know my way around a farm. Justin has several summers worth of experience working hard on his grandfathers dairy farm so he's been able to get his hands plenty dirty in the agricultural world, too! We both love the farming life but knew cash-cropping just wasn't for us, for starters we didn't want to grow corn. We like things a little more off-centre than that!
  • We did our own research and one day Justin asked if I wanted to raise alpacas. That was the turn-around point. I'm a crafter by nature (I taught myself how to crochet) and I knew how wonderful alpaca fiber is. Softer than wool, warmer too; it's so great to work with! We wanted to be able to bring this quality to others, either by making yarns for other crafters or finished products like scarves and duvets to those who don't know how to make their own.
  • Here's where you come in! Justin and I currently do not own a farm but we have an agreement set up to rent an existing alpaca farm. Everything infrastructure-wise is already in place, all we need is the alpacas and supplies. Every dollar earned will go towards purchasing supplies (including food, emergency cria [baby alpaca] kits, vet bills, harnesses, shears, etc.) and the alpacas themselves. We're looking to start off with a modest 30 alpacas; 25 females and 5 males. This will give us plenty of breeding room (we can't have crossing bloodlines!) while starting us off at a decent pace.
  • With your donations we will be able to start this company before the spring shearing to provide our products in the first year of business!

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $50,000 to get this farm up and running. Here's the breakdown:

  • $18,000 for one year of property rental
  • $24,000 for the starting herd (estimating $800 per alpaca X30 alpacas)
  • $4,500 for livestock insurance (approx. $300 for our top 15 alpacas)
  • $2,000 for supplies (includes first-year vet fees, nail trimmers, shears, emergency kits, fence repairs, etc.)
  • $500 for business operations
  • $500 for feed (pellets all year, hay only when pasture is unavailable)
  • $500 for marketing
Now this is all fine and dandy, but you're probably wondering "what's in it for me?". Well we decided to make 6 grades of perks, seeing as there are 6 grades of alpaca fiber. All alpaca products are made by our mentors at Alpaca Central and the Grand Valley Fiber Company:

  • Grade 1: For $15 you will receive photographs of our starter herd (photos by Justin).
  • Grade 2: For $50 you will receive a pair of alpaca-local wool blend insoles.
  • Grade 3: For $100 you will receive a Bear Buddy kit (essentially a build-your-own teddy; includes bear-shaped felt cutouts, stuffing, and yarn all made with alpaca fiber).
  • Grade 4: For $150 you will receive a skein of alpaca-merino blend yarn (sock weight).
  • Grade 5: For $500 you will receive an afghan made by myself.
  • Grade 6: For $1000 you will receive an invitation to our very first spring shearing. Don't worry, we won't put you to work! Learn how to shear alpacas through the attempts made by Justin and I, meet the herd, and learn as much about alpacas as you can!

Should we not reach our total end goal we will focus on purchasing the supplies required. If we earn more than what will purchase our starter supplies we will look into boarding a herd at another farm instead of renting our own to reduce our property costs. We hope to earn enough to start off with 30 alpacas, but we will start off with less and add to our herd along the way if necessary.

Risks & Challenges

As we have found with the alpaca business there is really only one great risk factor: loss of an alpaca. Fortunately, these animals have very few health risks; however, we intend to insure 15 of the top animals in the initial herd until the point in which our herd has grown significantly and we become profitable so as we can afford the risk and have developed our skills to the point where we feel comfortable without the insurance.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are tight and we don't expect anyone to give us everything they have. If you can't donate but still would love to see a large-scale, complete-cycle alpaca farm become a reality please share our campaign with your friends and family! 

We're on Facebook! If you'd like updates on our progress, please Like Helder Hills :)

I grew up on a beef farm in rural Ontario and have an Agricultural High Skills Major on my side, so I know my way around a farm. Justin has several summers worth of experience working hard on his grandfathers dairy farm so he's been able to get his hands plenty dirty in the agricultural world, too! story:
We are here to provide you with an eco-friendly and incredibly FUN transportation alternative for your next vacation!

Our vacation spots are some of the most beautiful sites we have on our little ball of mud, so help us keep them looking as beautiful as possible for our grandchildren.  There is nothing sadder than seeing the results of years of pollution taking their toll on our planet, especially the beautiful beaches and mountain towns we use to get away from the stresses of our everyday lives.  Scooters have finally shook their stigma here in America, and are now being seen for their economic value similar to how Europe and Asia have seen them for years.  The gas guzzling SUV's will soon be a thing of the past as our environmental awareness continues to increase.  We intend to be on the forefront of taking action based on that awareness at tourism hot spots across America, so please help us get going!

Questions (and answers) that our video may not have addressed.


What exactly is your business?

We are in the business of renting 49cc motor scooters, mostly to vacationers, to enhance their holiday experience.  In markets where our rental center is in a pedestrian area, we will also rent mobility scooters so seniors and the disabled can enjoy their vacation experience as well.  Surprisingly, the economics (cost, etc.) of mobility scooters is very similar those of motor scooters. 

We also sell new and our slightly used scooters (discussed later).  And we rent helmets in cities where the law deems them optional equipment (in cities where they’re required, we include them), and we sell souvenir hats, t-shirts, sunglasses, suntan oil and other accessories.

In most states and Caribbean countries, only a regular driver’s license (no motorcycle endorsement) is required to operate 49cc scooters.  They are rated to operate between 30 and 40 miles per hour depending on the altitude of the city and other factors.

Although there are lots of motor scooter rental outlets throughout the country and the Caribbean, no company owns more than a few outlets.  This is an industry in its infancy!  Scoot Over America will be the only national chain, allowing renters to get on line and reserve the city and scooter they want to rent, or call a toll free number and speak to a reservations agent.

What will you do with the money?

Most of the money we raise will be used to massively increase our fleet of motor scooters.  We will be recruiting “independent agents” (just like U-haul, one of the business models we are seeking to emulate) in vacation spots throughout the country and the Caribbean.  These scooters will become our agents’ stock and trade.  We will also be acquiring computer tablets to accommodate our “Scooty Rental Program” (our proprietary point-of-purchase rental software), computer printers for contract preparation, flat screen TVs for providing scooter operation and safety procedures to renters.

The Caribbean?

Millions of cruise passengers are transported to various Caribbean ports annually. The cruise lines aggressively sell excursions in each of these ports, yet none currently offers “scooter tours”.  This is because the industry is very splintered.  It would be difficult for the cruise lines to deal with dozens of different independent operators.  We believe that by working with and offering sales commissions to these cruise lines, they will begin pre-selling guided, narrated scooter tours in each of these destinations, which will be managed and operated by our local Caribbean agents. 

What are you doing to improve our global environment?

 

We are significantly reducing the carbon footprint left by visitors in cities in which we operate by substituting the use of tour buses, automobiles, etc, with highly efficient motor scooters (100+ miles per gallon) and electric mobility scooters.  In cities particularly troubled by pollution (E.g. New York, Pittsburgh, Phoenix, Houston, etc.) we will provide our agents ELECTRIC motor scooters, eliminating even the smallest carbon footprint.

Isn’t scooter renting a seasonal business?

In most states the scooter rental season is six months long, mid-April through mid-October.  However, at JUST these times, vacation hot spots in California, Florida and the Caribbean go into their busy season.  Aided by our computer program, each fall, we will simply relocate our scooters from cold climates to those cities which enjoy heavy winter tourism.

Exactly how big are you now, and how big do you plan to get?

We have been in business for three years.  We became profitable the first week.  The economics of our business are impressive:  While it typically takes a car rental company 150 rental days to recoup their cost of the rental vehicle, we can recover our cost of a scooter within a week!

During our first season, we operated a 10 motor scooter fleet in the captivating mountain town of Ruidoso, New Mexico.  Within the first twelve months we expanded our fleet four-fold to 40 scooters, operating in three locations (we added Albuquerque, NM and Santa Fe, NM).  During this time we perfected our business model, creating the “Scooty Rental Program” a point-of-purchase computer program that allows us to monitor and audit rental transactions in an unlimited number of remote locations. 

  We deem 36 states “friendly” to motor scooters (allowing vacationers to rent without a motorcycle endorsement on their driver’s license).  Each of these states has anywhere from one to a few dozen tourist locales, providing us over 150 target markets nationwide.  Additionally, there are over 30 popular Caribbean cruise ports for the conquering!

Are you “giving back” to our community?

Since our inception, we have had a particular soft spot for the brave men and women who defend our country, offering them generous military discounts when they rent motor scooters or, in the case of injured veterans, mobility scooters.  We proactively seek out veterans for employment, have discounts for veterans to open their own Scooter Over America location, and even our General Manager is a veteran who was deployed to Iraq for 12 months.  In preparation for our national expansion, we have committed to donating a portion of our proceeds to the Wounded Warrior Project. 

What will you do if you raise more than the $48,000 requested?

  We will expand that much faster.  We will also modernize our scooter transporting equipment and our scooter maintenance and repair facilities.

What if you don’t raise all the money you request?

  All monies raised will be poured into our national expansion ambition.  A less-than-hoped-for supporter response will merely require that we reach our full potential by reinvesting profits.  It may result in slower growth; however, we WILL reach our goals!

Scooters are “maintenance intensive,” right?

  Rental scooters receive a rigorous workout by multiple users, of varying experience, who may not treat rental property as well as their own.  Most handymen, rather than master mechanics, can be trained to repair motor scooters and mobility scooters.  We will make company-trained repairmen available in each region where we have “agents”.  Out of our share of agents’ rental revenues, we will perform all scooter maintenance and repairs.

What do you do with your scooters as they age?

  Like the major car rental companies (another of the business models we are seeking to emulate), when our scooters reach a specified mileage they are offered for sale with a thirty day warranty.  This year alone, we have upgraded 20% of our fleet through the sale of used scooters and application of those proceeds toward new scooters.  And because of our buying power, we are able to successfully sell our used scooters for MORE than our cost of new replacements!

What are your long term aspirations?

  In the long term, we want to provide vacationers with an inexpensive and fun means of exploring their holiday destination while improving on the environmental footprint left by tour buses and SUVs in the American and Caribbean cities we serve.

  Sadly, there are currently no American manufacturers of motor scooters.  As our fleet reaches into the thousands, and our specifications for our rental vehicles becomes more rigorous, we would like to establish our own American factory, employing American workers dedicated to providing pleasure to American vacationers.

What are the qualifications of your staff to make your plans a reality?

  Please visit www.scootoveramerica.com/about.  You will be impressed with our caliber of experience and expertise.

What are the perks?

  We have a wide variety of perks to fit what any contributor is looking for.  For the smaller investors who just love the idea of providing clean vehicles in our most beautiful vacation locations, we wanted to give you a hat to keep the sun off your face while renting one of our scooters on your next vacation. 

Because Indiegogo is the perfect site for fellow entrepreneurs to get the word out on their products, we designed a perk for you to place your logo on both sides of one of our rental scooters for the life of the scooter.  The advertising certainly works for us and we think it will work for you too! 

We are a vacation company, and we wanted that option to be available to you as well.  If you haven’t been to the beautiful mountain town of Ruidoso, NM, location of our flagship scooter center, you should pick up our 3 day getaway package, complete with 2 scooters for you to use for your entire trip. 

We love our Wounded Warriors, and we know you do too.  You can make a donation that will purchase a motor scooter or mobility scooter for one of our brave military personnel wounded defending our freedom, to be delivered directly to their door. 

Finally, for those who love this idea, and already have a passion for scooters, we have a perk where you can get a limited edition Scoot Over America scooter of your own, or 2 for you and your partner!  Our expansion is so exciting to us, and we want you to be excited about being part of it.

If you are interested in bringing a Scoot Over America location to a tourist town near you, we want to know about that too!  Please visit www.ScootOverAmerica.com/Agent for more information!

story:
We're on a mission to help everyone eat better and save more.

Website Link:  http://stretchrecipes.com/about/

Blog Link: http://stretchrecipes.com/blog/

We're starting by building a Food App that will help you eat better and save more without lots of planning and without blowing your budget.  Stret¢h pairs your cash on hand or budget with delicious, easy to make nutritional chef recipes and coupons.  

PRE-ORDER THE COMPLETED APP NOW BY CONTRIBUTING $1

This app will be available for Web, iOS, and Android.  Here's a concept drawing:


How does Stret¢h work?:

  • Enter your budget or cash on hand; 
  • Enter the number of people you're feeding; 
  • Enter the number of days you want your budget to last; 
  • Eliminate your dislikes and can't haves;
  • Choose your recipes;
  • Pick your store;
  • Receive your shopping list, and select your coupons.

Why should you use Stret¢h?:

  • Maximizes your food dollars;
  • Reduces food waste;
  • Displays meals that are within your budget from a database of over 500 recipes.
  • Generates your shopping list and recommended stores;  
  • Automatically recommends coupons that match what you actually have on your shopping list for additional savings.  

Simply stated, we want our users to experience the simplicity of being able to:

Enter budget. Choose recipes they like. Get Shopping list & Coupons.  Live a better life. 


We won the Audience Choice Award at the Austin Tech Crunch Meet-Up.  We won tickets toDisrupt in San Francisco in September.  We also one of six finalists for the UnLtd USA incubation and mentorship program!  UnLtd will provide a year of support and $5k of Seed funding to the winner.  UnLtd USA will be a great place to truly test to see if our product and see the impact it is making in peoples lives before we scale up.  We'd like to get our MVP ready before attending Disrupt!  With your support, we can achieve this goal!  


For every $1,000 contributed, we will host a 1-on-1 Stret¢h cooking class for a family or individual in need.


WHY DID YOU COME UP WITH THIS APP, LAUREN?

Because Cheetos, Potato Chips, and Ground Beef changed my life.  A few years ago, when I was in graduate school, my youngest brother came to live with me.  I couldn't afford to feed him.  As a result, he had to sign up for food stamps.  In his first trip to the grocery store, he exhausted his entire month's budget.  After I finished yelling at him and cursing the system for being foolish enough to give him a full months funding in one shot... I realized it wasn't his fault.  Even though we didn't grow up in the same house, I personally knew it was hard to balance all of those decisions.  

I grew up with my grandmother who was retired, diabetic, had heart disease, and cancer.  As a result, I often ate fast food for sustenance.  When I left home at 17, it was hard to budget and plan my meals, and yes, I had no concept of what was proper nutrition.  

This life experience motivated me to begin Stretch Recipes to solve 5 key challenges:

1)  I have only 'X' dollars and I need them to last 'Y' days before I get my next paycheck.

2)  I want to eat something other than ramen, junk food, and/or the same 5 things my mother cooked for me.  

3)  I always forget the coupons, or I'm an extreme couponer and if my mobile device would take care of it, I'd be in heaven.  

4)  I'm trying to save for (insert) goal and the only place I can cut is my food and budget.  

5)  I've recently had to change my diet.  My funds are limited and it's just a lot of stress trying to plan everything out.  

HOW WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION HELP?

We're raising funds to help us to reach our next milestone, the MVP (Minimum Viable Product).  This MVP will enable us to test our product with a group of 100 people to fine tune for a great experience and make sure it's amazing when we go to launch the Beta.  These funds will cover:

  • Front-end design (UX and UI):  Easy to use and intuitive.  No clutter, no questions on how to use, and no numerous questions asked to get it to work.  We want only the best experience for our users.  
  • Hosting Costs:  We have a database and algorithms designed to help you maximize the experience.  We need hosting to ensure delivery and no down times.
  • Content Creation:  Pictures of food make it more fun to browse recipes.  We also need groceries and photographers.  Licensing fees quickly add up. 
  • Marketing and Research:  Truthfully, by contributing to this campaign, you effectively tell us the most important answers - Is what I am doing really needed?

Now, are you ready to Stret¢h your dollar to eat better and save more? 


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

My co-founder and I work full-time on this project – living off our small savings to bring our idea to life.  We believe in this that much.  

We have designed your contribution levels to ensure that we can achieve the goals we have outlined above on time.

We've estimated dates for delivery based on our current timeline for getting the product completed and launched and have aligned these to the target contribution levels.

With your support and our commitment we plan to have the MVP completed by September 2014.

We promise to  always keep you updated on our progress.

Our Team

Lauren Foster is the Founder, CEO/President of Stretch Recipes, Inc. an Austin based start-up.  A proud Chicago native and first generation college student and MBA, she is an Entrepreneur with over 15 years sum total experience in Media, Telecommunications, and Real Estate. Her hobbies include top golf, dancing, and traveling.

It was recognizing the cyclical budget and nutrition patterns within her own life that led her to found Stretch Recipes, Inc.   She created Stret¢h because she wanted to make a tool that actually helps people with tight budgets maximize their dollar and have access to more nutritional recipes. She herself grew up in a low income household without the tools to learn how to budget for groceries, nor to prepare healthy meals.

In August/September of 2013, the answer to providing help came in the thought to build an actual tool.  Already working in mobile apps, it seemed the best form to create a self-governed solution.  In November 2013, she began looking more into the problem and seeking help to pull it off.  In March 2013, she began landing partnerships with the SNAP program and local food banks in an effort to ensure the application would work for the tightest of budgets.  In early April, Lauren resigned from her full-time job in Real Estate Sales at Meritage Homes to found and build Stretch Recipes full-time.  Later that month, she also met CTO Ben Shank who would eventually become her Technical Co-Founder equally obsessed with creating a solution to help everyone eat better and save more.


Ben Shank began programming when his third grade teacher cut a deal with him: pay attention in class and receive computer mentoring after school. He was later mentored by his little league baseball coach, the 23rd employee of Sun Microsystems, and further taught by a lead engineer of Microsoft's TerraServer (now MSR Maps) who also introduced him to Miles Davis.

Ben went on to win a $250,000 sole-source software development contract with the State of Washington, integrate the computer vision subsystem leading to the first successful flight test and continuation of funding for ARGUS-IS, and lead development of AOL's internal content aggregation platform, spanning over 500 media properties including TechCrunch and Huffington Post.

He is working to complete his MS in applied mathematics through Columbia University in 2015, and completed his GSD in the mid 1980's. Ben is an avid motorcyclist, a fun uncle, enjoys playing jazz and progressive rock guitar, and has read one Philip Roth novel.

Acting on a deep-seated need to effect positive change in people's lives, Ben aligned immediately with Lauren's mission to maximize the choice of nutritional eating options to those with limited financial resources and left AOL to help realize her vision.


FAQ'S


We've done our best to anticipate questions you may have.  Please feel free to message us through Indiegogo and we will be more than happy to reply and update the FAQ's.  


Will this work for me if I am on Food Stamps?  Absolutely!  We are always working with partners to serve you.  When we say help everyone eat better and save more, we mean EVERYONE.  We have partners in Austin such as the Sustainable Food Center (SFC) and are always looking forward to growing more partnerships in markets that have similar programs.  What we love about SFC is that they offer Double-Dollar incentives at Farmers Markets for Seasonal Fresh Produce for SNAP and WIC recipients.  This means, your SNAP or WIC dollars go twice as far.  


How are servings calculated?   We base servings on recommendations based on the recipe.  However, that's what this MVP is for, to test to ensure that the servings are not only appropriate, but don't leave you feeling shorted at meal times.


Will you have Gluten-free Recipes?  Yes


Will you have Paleo Recipes? Yes


Will you have Vegan Recipes?  Yes


Will you have Normal every day recipes? Yes


Is this a diet fad app? No


Will you have recipes for certain medical conditions?  Yes.  We have identified 5 key medical restrictions we will roll out with the beta version.  These are common Food Allergies, Heart Disease, Diabetes, Liver Disease, and Celiac.  If there's a particular medical condition that we have overlooked, please feel free to email us and tell us about it at info@stretchrecipes.com


Will you have cultural specific cuisine (ie. Indian, Mexican, Mediterranean, etc.)? Eventually, we will start with mostly American and move to add cultural cuisines as we go.  If you have specific Chef or recipe recommendations, don't hesitate to email us at info@stretchrecipes.com.  We are always on the hunt for dishes that are diverse, delicious, and serve you.


I am not a good cook. We do our best to place recipes that are easy to make and also not hours to make (unless you can leave home while it prepares).  Additionally, we will launch a web class series for 101 that will help you get acclimated to the kitchen (knife safety, temperature recommendations, etc.) and also preparing most of the dishes within the App.  These classes will begin to appear on our website and within iTunes or YouTube in October 2014.  


I hear you, but I am really not a good cook. Let's start with the crockpot and safety video demonstrations.  We'll have you cooking with smiles of joy around the dinner table in no time.  


I'm single, will this App work for me?  Yes.


I have a large family of more than 5, will this App work for me?  Yes.


Can I use this at the grocery store?  Yes.


Will this work if I'm just wanting to plan for one day?  Yes.  It's generally recommended to plan for at least 3 days to maximize and reduce food waste, but if there is no other choice, it will search for the options to best maximize what you have for the one day.


Will this work if I'm just wanting to plan for a month?  Yes.  However, be sure to check your recipes.  If you are choosing a lot of fresh or organic produce, it is recommended to plan for at most 7 days at a time to reduce fresh produce food waste.  


Why are you not an all or nothing campaign? We work off limited savings to bring this to life.  Every cent aides us in getting further along with our project.  


I love what you're doing!  How can I help more in addition to my contribution?  

SPREAD THE WORD!  TELL FRIENDS... AND EVERYONE CHECKING OUT AT THE CHECKOUT ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN ;-)  ASK THEM, YOUR LOCAL GROCERS, EMPLOYERS AND PHYSICIANS TO GO A STEP FURTHER AND SUPPORT OUR CAMPAIGN.

Adoption Fundraising Campaign Summary

Hello! Thank you for visiting our adoption fundraising campaign! We are “The Reverends Pendergrass” because both of us are, well, reverends! We both serve churches as pastors. Put simply, we want to open up our home and family to an infant. We cannot have children of our own and we know that there are many courageous parents out there who are choosing to place their newborns into the adoption process. We trust that God will connect us with a child whose needs for love and care can be met in our household. Down to the details: adoption can be expensive ($20,000-$40,000 for a domestic adoption), and we want to offer you a chance to help us prepare to welcome an infant to our home! Your gifts go straight into our “adoption fund” which will go directly to adoption process expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

Our fundraising goal is $5,000 (just a small part of the estimated total cost of adoption). Like we said above, all money raised will go straight into our “adoption fund” (a savings account) to be used ONLY for expenses directly related to adoption such as the home study, agency fees, legal fees, finalizing expenses, etc. If we don’t reach our goal, that’s where the funds will still be going (Indiegogo just gets a bigger percentage of whatever funds we do raise).


What do you get? Check out the perks! You will get a personalized thank you (electronic or handwritten depending on your giving), a photograph of the actual newborn once we adopt a child, a framed photo, a painted handprint, a video of the baby, or even a photo book of the baby!

Keep in mind, anything having to do with the baby (like the photos, video, or handprint) won’t get to you until AFTER we adopt a child! That could be as long as a couple years from now. We will, of course, keep ALL of our supporters updated on our adoption process so you won’t feel like we’ve forgotten about you.

The Impact

Why should you give? There are so many children in the world that need parents and families who will love them and are capable of supporting them. Recognize that many children who are put up for adoption are born to parents who deeply care for their child’s wellbeing. They love their child so much that they would rather see another family raise them. That’s downright amazing! Yes, your gifts help us to adopt a child, but your gifts give a child a home and family forever!

Risks & Challenges

Before we can adopt, we have some things to do first. We have to have a home study done where a social worker comes to our home, interviews us, examines our financial records, does deep background checks on us, and interviews our families, friends, neighbors, coworkers, and others. Then, we begin applying to adoption agencies and networkers. Different agencies have different needs based on the children and families coming to them. Some agencies may not need or want us. It is a matter of being connected to the right agency at the right time. That will require prayer, patience, and perseverance. The biggest challenge to us: time. It can take one to two years after applying before being matched with an expectant mother looking for someone to adopt her child. Just know that when you donate to this campaign, your money will only be used for the adoption process, no matter how long it may take.

Other Ways You Can Help

MOST IMPORTANTLY: Share this campaign with your friends and family!!! The more the word gets out, the better our chances of reaching our goal!

What if you can’t (or don’t) want to contribute money to the adoption campaign? There’s plenty you can do, still! First, pray for us. Remember us in your regular prayers. Pray that we will be connected with the child (or children) that God might intends to bring into our family. Pray for us as we go through this process. It is emotional, it is slow, it is full of uncertainty. We will need encouragement from time to time. We will need to learn how to be parents in the meantime. We will need to continue to prepare our home to receive an infant. No matter how you help with our campaign, through gifts or prayers or encouraging words, thank you! We appreciate you and whatever you bring! It truly takes a village to raise a child. Our village just tends to be a little larger and a little more spread out these days, doesn’t it?

THANK YOU ALL!

story:
Dear Friends and Family, 

As you may or may not know, I am a chapter president in an amazing organization called I AM THAT GIRL. I AM THAT GIRL is a community, and a movement inspiring girls to LOVE, EXPRESS, and BE who they are. This organization has been, and continues to be, a source of inspiration and encouragement in my daily life.

I decided to start the IATG chapter here at Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU) because I felt a community where girls could come together and just BE, was lacking. We as females can be so competitive with one another that we forget to just stop and tell each other how great we are. We forget that although we may be different in numerous ways, if we only come together and TALK, we could break barriers! The IATG chapter at VCU has been a huge blessing to me. I've learned so much about myself in the short year that we have been an established group on campus and it continues to make me grow as a woman everyday.

The IATG chapter at VCU has bi-weekly meetings where we discuss issues that really matter to young women like ourselves - topics vary every meeting and each is full of laughter, love, and FOOD! Also, as a chapter we conduct confidence building workshops with young girls in the surrounding Richmond community that not only helps them, but is also a blessing to us. We are currently in the process of planning a Heels 2 Heal mini-marathon for Breast Cancer Awareness Month, where women, men, and children will come together and run a short distance in heels to symbolize the ability of overcoming something terrible, TOGETHER.

I AM THAT GIRL is hosting it's first leadership retreat this October in Los Angeles, California and has chosen 15 chapter leaders out of 100 chapters around the world. I am HONORED to be one of the 15 chosen for this once-in-a-lifetime experience.

This retreat will provide us with leadership training and connections to other local chapters around the world - helping us to strengthen our own community and the IATG community as a whole. 

In order for to attend the leadership retreat I need to raise $1,000. The money will go directly to the organization to continue the powerful programming they provide. EVERY dollar counts and is greatly appreciated!

Also, I AM THAT GIRL is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization - and that means your donation is tax-deductible! So I ask you, to please take a moment and donate to help me gain the tools to help others! 

Love,
Kendall
